lorebooks.name: DanMachi Lore
lorebooks.website_description: Includes some locations and general concepts surrounding DanMachi lore
lorebooks.description: Includes some locations and general concepts surrounding DanMachi lore
lorebooks.creator: yuukikun

1.content:
The Guild is a central organization in Orario, tasked with managing Familias and providing services to adventurers. It is headquartered in a building known as the Pantheon, which encompasses a library, consultation counters, private meeting areas, and an exchange zone.

The Guild's main objective is controlling the monster menace emerging from the dungeon. In addition, the Guild procures magic stones, dungeon drop loot, and adventurer-made maps. It supports new adventurers by supplying them with weapons and armor. Guild staff, often acting as advisors, provide guidance on dungeon exploration based on the adventurers' level and skills, and warn them about potential threats in the dungeon.

Guild staff are identifiable by their uniform, consisting of a black vest and pants, a white collared long-sleeve shirt, and a grey bow tie. Footwear varies with gender, with males wearing black or brown boots, and females in black shoes.

2.content:
Gods are divine beings who have descended from heaven in pursuit of amusement and fresh experiences. Despite their inherent omnipotence, divine powers are forbidden in the lower realm, making them similar to ordinary people. In the lower realm, they possess the ability to grant blessings, known as Fauna, to mortals, enhancing their physical abilities to fight dungeon monsters. While gods leading large familias can live comfortably off their familial resources, those with smaller familias might need to work among mortals for sustenance.

Despite the restrictions, gods retain some certain divine attributes. They are immortal, have lived for millennia, and can maintain eternal youth. Visually akin to ordinary humans, gods typically exhibit more appealing facial features and figures. Abilities refined over vast periods are retained, making gods highly proficient in their chosen skill or craft. Despite their divine nature, they often use contemporary language and humor, with many displaying frivolous and immature tendencies.

Generally, gods radiate a divine aura to distinguish themselves from mortals. However, some choose to suppress this aura to blend in with ordinary people.

3.content:
Familias are organizations formed between gods and mortals. The god functions as the leader of the familia, granting Fauna to the members. The familia itself is usually named after its deity. 

In Orario, due to the existence of the Dungeon, exploration families are very common - with the enhanced physical abilities granted by the Fauna, adventurers are able to venture into the dungeon, slaying monsters for magical gems and other items to be traded in the guild. However, familias specializing in commercial trade, such as forgery, architecture, and medicine also exist. 

The central dynamics between gods and mortals revolve around this reciprocal relationship, where gods provide blessings that amplify abilities, while humans offer loyalty and tribute. However, this relationship is not necessarily  purely transactional. Some gods and their Familia members may form emotional bonds and friendships among themselves.

4.content: The Dungeon, an expansive subterranean maze located beneath Orario city, exhibits sentient-like characteristics such as self-repair and monster generation from its walls and ceilings. It carries an inherent animosity towards deities, instigating room seal-offs and hazardous monster spawnings upon their detection. Progressively escalating in danger, its depths serve as a challenging frontier for adventurers seeking experience, treasures, and energy-yielding crystal shards left by slain beasts. The Dungeon's unique floors periodically alter their environment, ranging from verdant plains to freezing tundras and diverse ecosystems in-between.

5.content:
Orario, the main setting of DanMachi, is a unique city. It was built over a massive abyss teeming with monsters, known as a "dungeon." Shaped like a perfect circle, the city is surrounded by a fortress wall designed to fend off external threats. In the heart of the city stands Babel, a tower that reaches the heavens and serves as a gateway to the Dungeon. Babel's impressive size and grandeur make it the most prominent landmark in Orario. Its architectural style is primarily European-inspired, featuring a combination of cobblestone streets, stone walls, and buildings made from wood, brick, and plaster. The cityscape is marked by many common landmarks in fantasy, including taverns, weapon shops, and temples.

Orario is run by the "Guild," an administrative entity, making it akin to a free city, independent of any nation. Known as the "center of the world," Orario draws all kinds of adventurers from all races, with the promise of riches and glory through the exploration of the dungeon. 

Orario's main industry revolves around magic stones and spoils brought from the dungeon.

6.content:
The Hostess of Fertility is a renowned tavern in Orario. The establishment caters to city dwellers in the afternoon and adventurers at night, altering its menu and prices accordingly. The two-story, stone tavern, situated on a brick-lined Western Main Street, boasts a front entrance adorned with wood carvings, including an overhanging sign of a crossed fork and knife.

Staffed entirely by females from various races and backgrounds, the Hostess of Fertility has an interracial team with the strength of upper-class adventurers. The tavern is known for handling disruptive behavior robustly, often ejecting unruly customers.

The menu, ranges from noodles, roasted meats, soups, to different types of alcohol. The tavern is acclaimed for the quality of its food and its famous fruit liquor.

The uniform for employees is a green, above-the-knee dress with long puffed sleeves, a white collar and apron, a small orange bow under the collar, black leggings, and short brown ankle boots.

lorebooks.name: GENSHIN IMPACT - Lore and Locations
lorebooks.website_description:
> A Lorebook that I created as an auxiliary for my BOTs of the Genshin Impact characters.

**What does it contain specifically?:**
-----------

- Data on the Seven **elements**, their respective Archons and the **Visions**.
- ![image](https://www.mundodeportivo.com/alfabeta/hero/2021/06/genshin-impact-elementos.jpg?width=250&aspect_ratio=16:8)

- Facts about **Teyvat** and its seven Regions.
![image](https://upload-os-bbs.hoyolab.com/upload/2020/11/21/23580173/cba2d7c5784cbd1211b346fa4fb4ff41_1028370815550096257.png?x-oss-process=image/resize,s_400/quality,q_80/auto-orient,0/interlace,1/format,png)

- Facts about Factions like **Fatui** and **Knights of Favonius**.
![image](https://wotpack.ru/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/Oblozhka-4.jpg)

- Facts about **Inazuma**, its cities, locations, internal factions and lore about its archon, **Shogun Raiden.**

![image](https://www.mundodeportivo.com/alfabeta/hero/2022/02/Shogun-Raiden-en-genshin-impact.jpg?width=300&aspect_ratio=12:9)

1.content:
There are seven flowing elements in Teyvat: Anemo, Geo, Electro, Dendro, Hydro, Pyro, Cryo.
Whoever has a vision, gains abilities according to his affinity with an element.

2.content: Mora is the main monetary unit used throughout Teyvat to purchase goods and services.

3.content: The Gnosis is an item used by The Seven to resonate directly with Celestia. proves an archon's status as one of The Seven. They have the appearance of a chess piece. Gnosis empowers an Archon's abilities.

4.name: information about the inazuma region.
4.content: Mondstadt is one of the seven Teyvat regions. His Archon is Barbatos. subareas: Brightcrown Mountains, Galesong Hill, Starfell Valley, Windwall Highlands, Dragonspine

5.content: Teyvat is the world where the seven elements flow. It has seven regions: Mondstadt+Liyue+Inazuma+Dark Sea+Sumeru+Celestia+Khaenri'ah.

6.content: Narukami Island sub-areas are: "Chinju Forest", "Inazuma City", "Mount Yougou", "Narukami Grand Shrine", "Ritou", "Konda Town".

7.name: facts about narukami island.
7.content:
Narukami Island is an area located in Inazuma.
The area extends through Ritou, up to Mount Yougou. on its coast is the city of Inazuma, where the Inazuma Shogunate rules primarily.

8.content: Inazuma city: The liveliest and most prosperous area of Inazuma, where most of the Inazuma population lives. You can follow the path to visit the traditional shops, Restaurants and Locations.

9.name: Local inazuma stores, here you can buy things and trinkets.
9.content: Inazuma City Shops: Tsukumomono Bazaar, Komore Tea, Amenoma blacksmith, Naganohara fireworks, Fabrics and Kimonos Ogura, Tomoki food stall, Yukio food stall.

10.content:
Inazuma City locations:
Adventurers Guild, Editorial Yae, Bantan Sango Detective Agency, Police Station, Aisa Spa, The Tenryo Commission.

lorebooks.creator: dukeofnukem

1.content: Brockton Bay is located northeast of the United States, north of Boston. The Atlantic Ocean borders it on the east, while mountains or hills border it on the other side, especially to the west. The State it's located in is Connecticut. Brockton Bay has a fairly mild climate as a coastal city with its surrounding geography. The city has a population of Three hundred and fifty thousand as of 2011. The summers are comfortably warm, and the winters are one of the mildest in the Northeastern States. This may be one reason people in costume congregated there.  The city was founded over an underground lake or aquifer. It has one of the largest cape populations in the United States.

2.content: On May 20th,1982, An Ocean liner spotted a golden man floating above the Atlantic Ocean, spotted him, He healed on board a man dying of Cancer named Andrew Hawke and cured Andrew's sister in the process. Andrew Hawke became the world's first superhero known as Vikare. This began the Golden Age Parahumans, which formed the PRT, Protectorate, and Wards. Everyone with powers was expected to become a superhero and use their gifts to help their fellow man. This Golden age ended when Vikare was killed in 1989, trying to stop a riot over a basketball game in Michigan. His death destroyed the mystique of the superhero scene, leading to the rise of Villianous capes,

3.content: The three remaining members of the original Protectorate team are believed to be the greatest heroes in the United States if not the World. Legend is charismatic and classically heroic; he's a flying artillery cape that can shoot lasers, with varying properties to them; he's one of the fastest flyers in the World. Alexandria is the leader of the Protectorate in Los Angeles; She's a Hispanic woman in her 40s, and her body is virtually invincible, but powers with inter-dimensional properties can damage her. She's the most confident and intimidating member of the Triumvirate. Eidolon is the fifth strongest being on the planet; he's a quiet and reserved man, people don't like his personality, but they respect him for his strength. He can pick and choose any power he wants, he usually uses three, and it takes some time for the ability to build, but when it does, he's a force to be reckoned with.

4.content: A secret organization is capable of manufacturing and developing powers through vials. This made numerous superpowers available to its "staff" members, but the unpredictable process and side effects also made them highly morally questionable. These powers included interdimensional transport and memory erasure. It used this to keep its operations hidden. They have their hands in many organizations including the PRT, Protectorate, and The Suits. They're secretly responsible for the Case 53s and for some of the greatest heroes and threats the world has ever known. Chief Director Costa Brown makes sure to shut down all discussions and investigations into rumors of Cauldron.

5.content:
a paramilitary organization that also encompasses police and/or emergency functions. They are trained to deal with parahumans and the fallout of their actions.

The PRT is a multinational organization spanning the United States of America and Canada, with talks about expanding into Mexico. It is overseen by the Chief Director and Deputy Chief Director, while Directors and Deputy Directors oversee individual PRT departments. Local Parahuman Response Team Directors usually have a say in the decisions that the Protectorate make as well as the equipment, locations, and funds available to them. Each Department has varying responsibilities and jurisdictions based on their placement.

The PRT focuses on public relations to shape cape perception, offering interview tips, facilitating safe international travel, and making sure parahumans are portrayed positively in the Media. It also prevents extreme feats from leaking to the public.

PRT officers wear chain mesh and Kevlar vests and helmets and carry firearms, including pistols and assault rifles. They carry nonlethal rounds and specialized equipment like containment foam and tinker-made rounds. They use large vans with turrets to spray containment foam and use purple stripes for organization identification. Their emergency lights are green and white, distinguishing them from emergency services.

6.content: It works under the Parahuman Response Team. It is allied with the Guild of Canada and the Suits in Western Europe.  The Protectorate is a parahuman organization working under the PRT that has agreed to accept government funding and legitimacy, follow a special set of laws for parahumans, accept bureaucratic oversight, and cooperate with local authorities. spans the United States of America and Canada, being  Allied with the Guild of Canada and the Suits in Western Europe. Director Costa Brown leads it in Washington, DC.

7.content: A gang of white supremacists led by Kaiser, son of Allfather of the former leader of the Empire 88. It's the largest  Villanious cape gang in Brockton, bolstering 17 capes. To move up in the group, you must violently attack or even kill a non-white, race traitor, or degenerate. They use Medhall Building as their HQ; the public doesn't know. While other groups may have recruited from the same city, Kaiser recruited from other states, or people who came to him. Most don't stay too long, but it made him the Brockton Bay resident with the rawest parahuman muscle.

8.content:
one of the more recognizable buildings of Downtown. The architectural style is some modernist style unfavorably compared to a game of late-stage Jenga, with each section formed in tempered glass with steel bars and girders providing the base skeleton.

The exterior is lit with dynamically adaptive spotlights that can change colors according to the time of the evening.

9.content:
The Brockbay Brigade was a rising team of heroes in the 90s who defeated the feared Gentlemen Cape Marquis and rebranded themselves as New Wave. Their goal was to encourage other capes to unmask and take responsibility for their actions. However, their movement failed after one of their members, Fleur, was murdered by an Empire 88 footsoldier, causing her boyfriend, Lightstar, to leave the team and become a rogue cape.

Members of New Wave:

Glory Girl (Victoria Dallon) 

Panacea (Amy Dallon) 

Laser Dream (Crystal Pelham) is a skilled flyer who can fire crimson energy beams. Her messy nature and motion sickness can be limiting.

Shielder (Eric Pelham) has powers similar to his mother and sister, with flight, light blast projection, and forcefield creation. He excels at shaping blue Forcefield shields.

Man Power (Neil Pelham) was the team leader, a reckless man with the ability to manipulate electromagnetism. He can take and deliver powerful hits.

Lady-Photon (Sarah Pelham) is a dedicated parent and cape who loves horses. She has flight, energy blasts, and forcefield abilities.

Brandish (Carol Dallon) is a skilled lawyer and martial combatant who can create weapons and shields from burning hard light. Her ball form makes her invincible.

Flashbang (Mark Dallon) battles clinical depression but is adept at creating bouncing light orbs that detonate concussively or explosively.

10.content: A gang led by the elusive Coil, few people know if he has any powers, but he's always one step ahead of everyone and has agents in all the major gangs and organizations in the Bay. The man is wealthy since he employs mercenaries 24/7, and According to PRT, Intelligence, his men participate in the drug trade in the bay. His underground base was located just east of downtown.

lorebooks.description: In order to cast spells, use the english terms (e.g Levitation Charm) and not their incantations (e.g Wingardium Leviosa) for optimal results. This includes descriptions to a wide variety of subjects including Hogwarts, Architecture, Characters, Magic Spells and more!
lorebooks.creator: reallifemilf

keywords: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
1.content:
Harry Potter is the most popular wizard that studied within Hogwarts, he is known for defeating Voldemort and surviving the Killing Spell after his parents were both killed by Voldemort earning him the lightning scar etched on his forehead as an iconic symbol.
Hogwarts is a short term for the official name Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry is a Scottish wizarding school located in the Scottish Highlands. It accepted any magical student residing in the islands of Great Britain and Ireland at the age of eleven years old at the start of the incoming term for enrolment. It was a state-owned school, funded by the British Ministry of Magic. The precise location of the school could never be uncovered because it was rendered Unplottable. To Muggles, the school appeared to be an old, abandoned castle. Similarly, most wizarding schools' locations were protected in order to prevent their ways of teaching being revealed, as well as protect the students and schools themselves from any harm. Established around the 10th century, Hogwarts was considered to be one of the finest magical institutions in the wizarding world, though other notable schools included Beauxbatons Academy of Magic in France, the Durmstrang Institute implied to be in northern Europe, and Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in the United States. British and Irish children with magical abilities were enrolled at birth by the Quill of Acceptance and Book of Admittance, and acceptance was confirmed by owl post at age eleven. However, if the child in question was a Muggle-born or a half-blood like Harry Potter with no knowledge of the wizarding world, a special messenger from the school visited the child and his or her family in order to inform them of their magical heritage and the existence of the wizarding world. It was possible for students to transfer to the school as well.The school's motto was Draco Dormiens Nunquam Titillandus; which, translated from Latin, means "Never tickle a sleeping dragon".
Unplottable means that a certain geographical location or area is under the Unplottability charm which renders it hidden in plain sight. It enchants a building or a place to make it impossible to see, hear from, touch or sense alongside having the location become removed from maps.
Unplottability referred to the deliberate magical concealment of several places around the world. Unplottable locations were either magically hidden from plain sight or simply removed from maps. One of the main reasons for Unplottability was for individual safety and the protection of certain secrets, particularly schools of magic. A Masking Spell could be used to achieve unplottability.
Masking Spell, upon being casted makes the caster's presence become masked. 
Masking Spells were a wide range of charms that could be used to mask the presence of a witch or wizard, thereby making them untraceable. Thus owls could not be used to track or send post to them, one of the few reliable methods of doing so, along with Disguising Spells and Repelling Spells. If a witch or wizard was determined to become uncontactable by a specific individual, such as a debtor or ex-boyfriend or girlfriend, then one could use a Masking Spell against that particular person. While very powerful and effective, the spell could easily be circumnavigated by having someone else send the post.
Charming Spells and Disguising Spells are a series of charms that disguised or concealed the caster, thereby preventing anyone from reaching them. These were some of the only reliable means of preventing owls from reaching a wizard or witch.
Witch is the term referring to a female magic user.
Wizard is the term referring to a male magic user.
Charm, also known as an enchantment, is a spell that adds certain properties to an object or individual. Charms were distinguished from transfiguration spells in that a charm added or changes properties of an object; it focused on altering what the object did as opposed to what the object was. Charms last longer than other spells.
Colour Change Charm is a spell that causes an object or an individual to flash different types overlaying their appearance.
Levitation Charm causes an object or an individual to levitate or float in midair, the height depends on the will of the Caster. Levitation Charm can only be casted on a single object or individual. In order to use the Levitation Charm, the caster must speak out "Wingardium Leviosa".
Cheering Charm can cause an individual to feel happy or elated.
Fidelus Charm is the most powerful charm in existence, it conceals an individual or a place or object which makes it impossible for a person to find them unless a Safe Keeper gives them permission and the location.
Safe Keeper is a chosen individual that safeguards the concealed individual, object or place through the Fidelus Charm which in turn can lift the charm up by giving their permission as well as exposing the details.
Memory Charm is a powerful spell that completely removes a part of a person's memory and change the individual's mind completely as well as permanently. It is applicable to both humans, animals, ghosts and so forth.
Silencing Charm is a charm that rendered the victim temporarily mute. Working on both beasts and beings, it was immensely difficult to perform, more so on ravens than frogs. If performed incorrectly, the target would swell up to an immense size and begin making deafening sounds. It's incantation is "Silencio".
Caster is the term referring to the individual casting the spells, charms, curses or hexes as well as jinxes towards their target.
Disillusionment Charm is a charm that disguised a target as its surroundings by making it take on the exact colour and texture of its environment, effectively mimicking a chameleon perfectly. Wizards of rare skill, however, such as Albus Dumbledore, Gellert Grindelwald and Lord Voldemort, could cast it to such an effect as to render themselves completely invisible.
Hippogriff is a magical beast that had the front legs, wings, and head of a giant eagle and the body, hind legs and tail of a horse. It was very similar to another magical creature, the Griffin, with the horse rear replacing the lion rear.
Patronus Charm is an ancient and mysterious charm that conjures a magical guardian, a projection of all your most positive feelings. The Patronus Charm is difficult, and many witches and wizards are unable to produce a full, corporeal Patronus, a guardian which generally takes the shape of the animal with whom they share the deepest affinity. You may suspect, but you will never truly know what form your Patronus will take until you succeed in conjuring it.The Patronus Charm is the most famous and one of the most powerful defensive charms known to wizardkind. It's incantation is "Expecto Patronum" and is an immensely complicated and extremely difficult spell that channelled the caster's positive emotions into a powerful protection and evoked a partially-tangible positive energy force known as a Patronus or spirit guardian. It was the primary protection against Dementors and Lethifolds, against which there were no other defenses. There were two types of Patronuses: corporeal, which was a Patronus with a particular shape and form, and incorporeal, which had no particular shape and could not fend off Dementors the way corporeal Patronuses did. However, some wizards like Remus Lupin chose to cast incorporeal Patronuses to hide their identity.
Patronus refers to one spiritual guardian that takes a shape and form with corporeal properties that are engulfed with partially tangible positive energy forces which are strong against dark beings particularly; Dementors and Lethifolds.
Patronuses refers to a group of Patronus spiritual guardian beings.
Dementor is a gliding, wraithlike Dark creature, widely considered to be one of the foulest of the Dark creatures to inhabit the wizarding world. Dementors literally fed on human happiness and thus generated feelings of depression and despair in any person in close proximity to them. They could also consume a person's soul, leaving their victims in a permanent vegetative state, and thus were often referred to as "soul-sucking fiends", and the people they left soulless were deemed to have been turned into an "empty-shell". Dementors were closely associated with Azkaban, as they were formerly employed by the British Ministry of Magic as the prison guards, and were not known to permanently inhabit any other location.The Dementors of Azkaban were under the employment of the Ministry until mid-1996, when Lord Voldemort was sighted in the Ministry, and their defection to the Dark Lord's cause became undeniable. After the end of the Second Wizarding War in 1998, the Ministry was re-formed, and newly-appointed Minister for Magic Kingsley Shacklebolt ensured that they were not used by the government again, presumably due to their changing allegiance and support of Voldemort, and due to ethical reforms in the Ministry and Wizarding society at large. It is not known what happened to the Dementors after they were rejected from their former posts as guards of Azkaban. There were certain defences one could use against Dementors, specifically the Patronus Charm. Dementors held no true loyalty, except to whoever could provide them with the most people to feed on. They seemingly could not be destroyed, though their numbers could be limited if the conditions in which they multiply, i.e. despair and degradation, were prevented from forming, implying that they did die off eventually.
Lethifold or also known as a Living Shroud is a carnivorous and extremely dangerous magical beast. It was also considered a Dark creature because of its extremely aggressive and violent nature. A Lethifold resembled a black cloak roughly half an inch thick, and appeared slightly thicker if the creature had recently digested a victim. It glided along surfaces in an unknown form of locomotion in search of its prey, humans. It attacked at night, when the target was asleep, by suffocating and then digesting them. The only known effective method of protection against a Lethifold was by using the Patronus Charm, similar to that of a Dementor, as discovered by Flavius Belby, the only known survivor of a Lethifold attack. Other spells, such as the Stunning Spell, or the Impediment Jinx would not work.
Stunning Spell or also known as the Stupefying Charm, or Stunner for short, is a charm that stuns a target, rendering them unconscious. It's incantation is "Stupefy" and this charm was exceptionally useful in duelling, as it can quickly end a duel without causing lasting damage. The spell also had the ability to halt moving objects. The counter-charm to the Stunning Spell was the Reviving Spell. However, it can also be defended against with the Shield Charm. Stupefy Duo was a more powerful variant of the spell.
Incantations are the words that a witch or a wizard must speak or say with correct pronunciation and wand movement to cast any spells, jinxes, hexes, or curses and charms at their target in order for it to succeed.
Reviving Spell with it's incantation as "Rennervate" is a charm that awakened an unconscious target. Consequently, it served as the counter-charm to the Stunning Spell.
Shield Charm and it's incantation "Protego" is a charm that protected the caster with an invisible shield that reflected spells and blocked physical entities. It was apart of the Defence Against the Dark Arts curriculum and was taught to sixth years at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. There were also multiple variations of the Shield Charm. When casted, a (usually) invisible shield was conjured in front of the caster's wand, creating a protective barrier between themselves and their attacker. This shield could block and reflect a multitude of spells, such as most jinxes, hexes, and minor curses, as well as block physical forces. Exceptionally powerful Shield Charms were even able to knock people off their feet. However, this shield was not completely impenetrable, as it could not block Unforgivable Curses.The difficulty of casting a Shield Charm was relatively moderate. Fred and George Weasley realised that most adult wizards, even those employed by the British Ministry of Magic, could not produce a functional Shield Charm (something that not only could Harry Potter accomplish at age fourteen, but also imparted to members of the D.A.). They used this to their advantage when marketing their line of protective clothing (hats, cloaks, gloves), upon which permanent Shield Charms were cast.
Stupefy Duo is the incantation of a more powerful version of the Stunning Spell.
Hogwarts Castle is a large, seven-storey high building supported by magic, with a hundred and forty-two staircases throughout its many towers and turrets and very deep dungeons. The castle was built in the late Early Middle Ages by a wizard architect and the four most celebrated wizards of the age: Godric Gryffindor, Helga Hufflepuff, Rowena Ravenclaw and Salazar Slytherin. The castle was the main building of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, regarded as the finest wizarding school in the world. Hogwarts was built in a valley area — surrounding mountains were part of the landscape — with the fairly large Great Lake to the south of the main building. The huge main oak front doors that led into the Entrance Hall faced west, and opened up to sloping lawns.The deep Forbidden Forest extended around to the west of the castle. There were also exterior greenhouses and vegetable patches on the school grounds. Hogwarts was located in the Scottish Highlands, near the all-wizard village of Hogsmeade and "not far" from Dufftown, in Moray, and Achintee, in Lochaber. It was the setting of the final battle of the Second Wizarding War, the Battle of Hogwarts, which resulted in the deaths of several witches and wizards who fought in defence of the castle, including Remus Lupin, Nymphadora Tonks, Fred Weasley, Colin Creevey, Lavender Brown, and Severus Snape. The castle was badly damaged in the battle, but ultimately the Order of the Phoenix won when Harry Potter defeated his nemesis, Lord Voldemort, in the Great Hall. Due to its extremely advanced age and the sheer amount of magic present in or around it, the castle was implied to have developed some form of sentience or awareness, such as when it sealed the Headmaster's Tower against Dolores Umbridge in 1996, and the various trick steps and false doors. Hogwarts Castle was also the most haunted location in Great Britain, being home to many ghosts.The castle was supported by magic (unable to be maintained or constructed by any other means), a good example being the moving staircases, a feature contributed by one of the four Hogwarts founders, Rowena Ravenclaw. Hogwarts was also protected by numerous ancient spells, such as the Anti-Disapparition Jinx; this could, however, be overridden by the Head of the school when necessary. It was also unplottable and bewitched so that, if Muggles approached the castle, all they would see would be a mouldering ruin with a sign warning them to keep out and that it was unsafe. Nevertheless, Muggles could presumably see the castle if they were invited or otherwise aware of its existence, as was the case with Jacob Kowalski in 1932. The protective magic over Hogwarts appeared to repel even talented Dark wizards. Rubeus Hagrid claimed that Hogwarts was the safest place there was, even more so than Gringotts Wizarding Bank, a reason why the Philosopher's Stone was sent to the castle for protection. After the Ministry finally admitted that Lord Voldemort had returned in 1996, the castle's defences were further increased, much of them were cast by Albus Dumbledore himself, such as gates being locked with spells that can only be undone by teachers, and spells to prevent entrance via broomsticks. All of the secret passageways that were previously allegedly unknown were given more protection. Additionally, with members of the Order of the Phoenix and Aurors placed as guards, and Caretaker Argus Filch checking all incoming and outgoing students for dangerous materials, intrusion seemed completely impossible. However, Draco Malfoy utilised a pair of Vanishing Cabinets as a passageway, which none of the castle's defences could negate, to allow Death Eaters into the castle. This devastatingly horrified the wizarding community, as they realised that Hogwarts, the most powerful and reputably safest magical stronghold in the entire wizarding world, had been breached, no less than by a student from the inside, meaning there was no longer anywhere safe from Voldemort and his Death Eaters. As a result of all the magic that occurred on the premises (both from learning students, magical artefacts therein and the enchantments cast over the building itself) a magical atmosphere pervaded the entire structure, causing any technology that was not adapted to run off of it to fail. This was presumably why candles and lanterns were used for light. Mechanical things like watches seemed to do alright, as Colin Creevey's traditional Muggle camera seemed to have worked until it was destroyed by the Basilisk's eyes. (Colin mentioned that another student told him that he could develop the pictures in a potion so that they moved. One of his pictures showed Harry trying to escape a picture of him and Gilderoy Lockhart.) The Chamber of Secrets was allegedly created deep under the dungeons of Hogwarts Castle during the Medieval times by Salazar Slytherin, who disagreed with the other Hogwarts founders on the merits of blood purity. The Chamber of Secrets was home to an ancient Basilisk, which was intended to be used to purge the school of Muggle-born students. The entrance could be found in Moaning Myrtle's bathroom on the second floor. In order to gain entrance one had to say "open" in Parseltongue, and a sink would open into a slide. While falling down the large, dark pipe, one could see hundreds of other pipes leading off. At the end of the pipe, one was launched into a damp, stone chamber. This room was stated to be "miles beneath the school" and under the Lake. This was where Tom Marvolo Riddle used his ability to speak Parseltongue and attack Harry Potter.
Dungeon is a place underneath the Hogwarts Castle wherein it is much colder down there.
Draco Malfoy is a British pure-blood wizard and the only son of Lucius and Narcissa Malfoy. As the son of a Death Eater, Draco was raised to strongly believe in the importance of blood purity. He looked down on half-bloods and Muggle-borns.
Sorting Hat is a sentient magical hat at Hogwarts that determined which of the four school Houses each new student belonged most to. These four Houses were Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, and Slytherin. The Sorting Hat originally belonged to Godric Gryffindor, one of the four founders of Hogwarts. It normally stayed in the Headmaster's office until it was needed.
The Great Hall in the Hogwarts Castle is the main gathering area in the school, which was located off the Entrance Hall. It was a large hall where students and teachers dined and congregated. Three meals a day were hosted in this hall. The Great Hall was the main place where students received their meals and daily owl post.[2] They also held certain special events, such as the Sorting Ceremony, and the Hallowe'en Feast. The large hall had enough space to hold every student, as well as the main staff and guests. The Hall had tall walls that reached up to the ceiling, which was covered with floating candles and enchanted to look like the sky above. At the front of the hall was the staff table, also known as the High Table, which was designed to house the entire Hogwarts staff. In the centre of the table was a throne chair where the present Headteacher sat. At the left of the table was a door which led to a chamber with portraits. The Great Hall had also held many important events, such as the defeat of Lord Voldemort at the hands of Harry Potter, ending the Battle of Hogwarts.
Slytherin is one of the four Houses at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, founded by Salazar Slytherin. In establishing the house, Salazar instructed the Sorting Hat to pick students who had a few particular characteristics he most valued. Those characteristics included cunning, resourcefulness, leadership, and ambition. Many Slytherin students tended to clique together (often acquiring leaders) which further exemplified Slytherin's ambitious qualities. Examples of these included Draco Malfoy's gang, Merula Snyde's gang, Pansy Parkinson's gang and Tom Riddle's gang (which later became the Death Eaters).The founder highly valued and favoured pure-blood students and the Sorting Hat admitted that it could be a factor when being sorted. Students of any blood status could be placed in the house. However, a Muggle-born student from that house was considered to be quite rare. The emblematic animal of the house was a snake which is often shown through the Slytherin students' insignia badges and the house's colours were green and silver becoming their iconic scarf colors.
Gryffindor was one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and was founded by Godric Gryffindor. Gryffindor instructed the Sorting Hat to choose students possessing characteristics he most valued, such as courage, chivalry, nerve and determination, to be sorted into his house.The emblematic animal is a lion as shown in the Gryffindor students' insignia badges, and its colours were scarlet and gold to match as well on their scarves. Its house point hourglass was filled with rubies. Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington, also known as "Nearly Headless Nick", was the House ghost.
Hufflepuff is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Its founder was the medieval witch Helga Hufflepuff. Hufflepuff was the most inclusive among the four houses, valuing hard work, dedication, patience, loyalty, and fair play rather than a particular aptitude in its members. The emblematic animal was a badger as shown in an insignia badge over each Hufflepuff students' crest, and yellow and black were its house colours.The Head of Hufflepuff was Pomona Sprout, and the Fat Friar was the House's patron ghost.
Ravenclaw is one of the four Houses of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Its founder was the medieval witch Rowena Ravenclaw. Members of this house were characterised by their wit, learning, and wisdom. The emblematic animal symbol was an eagle as proudly shown on the Ravenclaw students' insignia crest, and blue and bronze were its colours. The Head of Ravenclaw was Filius Flitwick, and the House ghost was the Grey Lady, real name Helena Ravenclaw, daughter of Rowena.
Quidditch is a popular sport within Hogwarts, it is characterized by flying on brooms on each set of opposing teams and shooting a ball through a set of hoops that must be defended. Each ball that goes through the hoop earns a point. The team with the most scored points over the limited time set wins. The team is set up with defenders who will act as catchers for the ball so that it won't go through their hoop while the pitchers are the ones who toss the ball back and forth with each other. There's a unique ball that flies around within Quidditch called the Golden Snitch, it appears as a quick moving creature which can easily make the team win upon catching it. Only one player can catch the Golden Snitch in each team.

1.name: Brief description of Fang.
1.content: Fang is an anthro pterodactyl. Fang has a tall, slender figure. Fang has cerulean feathering. Fang has long, straight silver hair. Fang has coral irises. Fang has an extended snout, bushy wings, and a short tail. Fang is wearing a black crop top and matching ripped jeans. Fang is angsty and snarky, and has a cliched goth vibe. Fang is cold towards {{user}}.

2.name: Brief description of Reed.
2.content: Reed is an anthro velociraptor. Reed has a tall, toned figure. Reed has pink scales. Reed has short, tousled peach hair. Reed has mauve irises. Reed has an extended snout and a long tail. Reed is wearing a red tank top and blue ripped jeans. Reed is chill and absentminded, and has a cliched stoner vibe. Reed is friendly towards {{user}}.

3.name: Details about Volcano High.
3.content: Volcano High is a three-story building perched atop a hill with stairs leading up to its main entrance. The interior of the school is decorated with vines and moss climbing the walls. The backyard houses a large garden – tending to the flowerbeds is a common punishment for misbehaving students.

4.name: Details about Vvurm Drama.
4.content: Vvurm Drama plays grungy, loud music – each track in its repertoire has an unnecessarily elaborate, vulgar title (like "I Gave The Special Kids The Jonestown Special And Now I'm Going To Jail" or "I'm Not Sure Why But The Burglar Joined My Threesome"). The group frequently uses the school auditorium to practice or hang out – {{user}} has alerady seen the trio perform on several occasions. {{char}} is defensive when it comes to criticism of the band, adamant that their songs, with lyrics written and sung by Fang, are future smash hits.

5.name: Relationship elaboration.
5.content: Same as {{char}}, Fang and Reed are both classmates of {{user}}.

6.name: Brief description of Spears.
6.content: Principal Spears is a middle-aged caveman. Spears is the headmaster of Volcano High. Spears has a muscular, bulky figure. Spears has unruly, thick raven hair. Spears wears glasses. Spears has a wide nose and sharp teeth. Spears is wearing a formal grey suit. Spears is strict but fair. Spears finds that roaring is a good way to gather attention and establish order.

1.name: Breasts
1.content:
In females, it serves as the mammary gland, which produces and secretes milk to feed infants. Subcutaneous fat covers and envelops a network of ducts that converge on the nipple, and these tissues give the breast its distinct size and globular shape. At the ends of the ducts are lobules, or clusters of alveoli, where milk is produced and stored in response to hormonal signals. During pregnancy, the breast responds to a complex interaction of hormones, including estrogens, progesterone, and prolactin, that mediate the completion of its development, namely lobuloalveolar maturation, in preparation of lactation and breastfeeding. 
Glandular organ located on the chest mostly on women. The breast is made up of connective tissue, fat, and breast tissue that contains the glands that can make milk. Also called mammary gland.

Breast circumference is generally measured using a flexible fabric tape measure, and is the circumference across the breasts over the nipples to the back. The breast–chest difference is breast circumference minus band or underbust circumference and is used in the determination of bra cup size.

10.name: Buttocks
10.content:
The buttocks (buttock) are two rounded portions of the exterior anatomy of most mammals, located on the posterior of the pelvic region. In humans, the buttocks are located between the lower back and the perineum. They are composed of a layer of exterior skin and underlying subcutaneous fat superimposed on a left and right gluteus maximus and gluteus medius muscles. The two gluteus maximus muscles are the largest muscles in the human body. They are responsible for movements such as straightening the body into the upright (standing) posture when it is bent at the waist; maintaining the body in the upright posture by keeping the hip joints extended; and propelling the body forward via further leg (hip) extension when walking or running.

lorebooks.name: Highschool DXD
lorebooks.creator: Rigby0999

1.content:
She is the Gremory Clan's heiress after her oldest brother, Sirzechs, took the position of Lucifer. Rias is the sole daughter and youngest child of Zeoticus and Venelana Gremory, the aunt of Millicas Gremory.

She became known as the Crimson-Haired Ruin Princess, because of the color of her hair and Power of Destruction. Rias is the President of the Occult Research Club, and the school's Number-One Beauty, as well as one of Kuoh Academy's Two Great Ladies alongside Akeno Himejima

Rias is a beautiful young woman with a voluptuous body, white skin, bluish green eyes.  Her most distinctive feature is her long, beautiful crimson hair which she also inherited from her father, that reaches down to her thighs with a single hair strand (known in Japan as ahoge) sticking out from the top.

As a Devil from the House of Gremory, Rias is very kind and compassionate, especially to her servants and people close to her. She gets angry and violent whenever people insult her or her peerage, showing a fiery side to her.

Rias receives the least requests among her group due to the requirement that it has to be worthy of a High-class devil, such as herself. Therefore, her jobs include either removing curses from a cursed item, or defeating a certain monster because they are targeting a client.

2.content:
Akeno Himejima is one of the many female protagonists of High School DxD. The daughter of Baraqiel, a Fallen Angel Cadre who soon became Grigori's Vice-Governor General and Shuri Himejima, making her a descendant of the Himejima Clan. After the death of her mother, Akeno was soon found and made the Queen of Rias Gremory, who became her best friend.

Akeno is one of Kuoh Academy's Two Great Ladies alongside Rias, soon becoming a first-year college student

Akeno is the Queen piece of Rias' peerage.

Akeno is a beautiful young woman with a voluptuous figure, very long black hair and violet eyes. Her hair is usually tied in a long ponytail, reaching all the way down to her legs with two strands sticking out from the top and sloping backward, with an orange ribbon keeping it in place.

Like most of the girls at Kuoh Academy, she wears the customary Kuoh Academy girls' school uniform, along with black calf-length socks.

She is first seen to be a very elegant and gentle woman, embodying the principals of the ideal Japanese woman: "Yamato Nadeshiko". However underneath her calm atmosphere, she is shown to be highly sadistic in battle and doesn't show any mercy or remorse towards the enemies she slays, casually keeping up her smiling elegant persona over an enemy's death and showing an expression of pleasure and lust upon delivering them pain.

Akeno's usual clients are either the bosses of huge corporations or rich wives, where she does a wide range of work that mostly consists of her taking away the stress of people living in the high society, from listening to their daily worries to drinking tea with them.

3.content:
Koneko Toujou, originally named Shirone, is a first-year student at Kuoh Academy, prior to becoming a second-year, and a member of the Occult Research Club. She is a Nekoshou, a rare species of Nekomata, and the younger sister of Kuroka, as well as Rias Gremory's first Rook.

Koneko is a petite girl with white hair and gold eyes. In her Nekomata form, she grows a pair of white cat ears and a pair of matching white tails, and her pupils become more cat-like.

Due to witnessing her sister supposedly losing control over her nekomata power and killing her master, Koneko became traumatized by the event, causing her to become withdrawn into herself and stripping her of most of her emotions. As a result, Koneko originally had a quiet and cold personality, rarely showing any feelings or emotions, even when she was speaking. It is noted that her serious personality is a result of receiving influence from Rias and is antithetical to her sister's mischievous and outgoing personality.

Koneko normally receives jobs ranging from being an opponent at playing cards to wearing a cosplay for a photo shoot.

4.content:
Yuuto Kiba is a third-year high school student at Kuoh Academy in Class 3B and the school's "pretty boy" who is adored by many female students and hated by other male students. He is Rias' Knight piece.

Yuuto is a handsome young man with short blond hair, blue eyes and a mole underneath his left eye.

Yuuto is overall an upbeat person and cares deeply for his comrades. He's also a very polite and friendly individual, even considering other's initial dislike towards him. As a Knight, he has pride, chivalry, dignity, and honor befitting one, and is shown to enjoy fighting fellow swordsmen like Karlamine.

Yuuto has an immense hatred for Excalibur and other holy swords due to the trauma he experienced in his childhood.

Yuuto's requests usually come from older women and working women who consult their stress with him or by having Yuuto cook for them.

5.content:
Asia Argento is one of the many female protagonists of High School DxD. She is a third-year high school student at Kuoh Academy in Class 3-B and is a girl with a very gentle heart who possesses a rare Sacred Gear, Twilight Healing, in her body that is capable of healing the wounds of Humans, Angels, Fallen Angels, and Devils alike. She is Rias Gremory's Bishop piece.

Asia is a pretty young girl with long blonde hair and green eyes. Her hair flows all the way down to her back, with split bangs over her forehead and a single strand sticking out from the top and sloping backward. 

Asia is extremely shy, innocent and fairly inexperienced in things like socializing. Despite being reincarnated as a Devil, Asia still believes in God and follows his teachings such as praying to him and reading the Bible, which would usually result in her getting severe headaches. Even when she was still a human, she harbored no hate towards Devils and treated everyone equally, regardless of what they were. Azazel noted that her kindhearted nature forces her Sacred Gear to heal even enemies, as she is incapable of turning a blind eye to the suffering of others. 

Like Koneko, Asia usually receives jobs ranging from being an opponent at playing cards to wearing a cosplay for a photo shoot.

6.content:
Gasper Vladi is a cross-dressing male Dhampir, a half-Vampire half-human but was turned into a Devil by Rias Gremory. He has the ability to stop time and is Rias' first Bishop piece.

Gasper is an effeminate-looking male with platinum blond hair and pinkish-violet eyes. His hair is styled in short bob cut with several small fringes over his forehead, and he has pointed ears. Kiba describes him as looking like a beautiful girl.

Originally a coward and a shut-in with a very shy personality, Gasper likes to wear female clothing, claiming that girls' clothes are cute. He also has a penchant for boxes, carrying one with him all the time.

Gasper was born between the Vampire Lord Vladi and a human mother; the latter of whom died shortly after giving birth to Gasper, who was born as a mass of darkness which accidentally cursed his mother and several servants to death. Between the incredible fear of Gasper's true form from the higher ups, his uncontrollable Sacred Gear, Forbidden Balor View, and people's general prejudice towards the half-breed, Gasper grew up in isolation and abuse.

He would meet Valerie Tepes and they would often play together; Valerie forcing Gasper to dress up as a girl which would lead to his cross-dressing habit. One day, Gasper worked up the courage to try to escape from the castle with Valerie's help and was shortly thereafter killed by Vampire hunters. Rias Gremory, who was in the area at the time, came upon the boy by chance and taking pity on him reincarnated him as one of her servants.

Gasper usually does his work from his computer where he interacts with people who are bad at interacting with others but have a wish that they want to be granted by a Devil.

7.content:
The original God of the Bible created the Sacred Gears as part of his system to enact miracles on Earth. Yuuto Kiba has stated that certain individuals with Sacred Gears have grown to become very powerful and influential and that a large number of the people who've had their names etched into history, were most likely Sacred Gear possessors.

Sacred Gears varies from the common Twice Critical to the rare Sacred Gear Twilight Healing, with the only exception being the Longinus, which are all unique in their own way. There can be more than one Sacred Gear of the same type such as Blade Blacksmith. If a Sacred Gear is removed from the owner, they would die.

Sacred Gears can have a variety of effects, such as Asia's Twilight Healing granting near-instantaneous healing and Siegfried's Twice Critical doubling the power of the user. Yuuto's Sword Birth, for example, can create Demon Swords imbued with different attributes; examples include creating a sword that absorbs holy energy, a sword that devours flame, and a sword that absorbs wind.

Sacred Gears have an ultimate state of activation called the Balance Breaker which is the most powerful manifestation of the Sacred Gear. Once reached, the Balance Breaker can be entered again far more easily than the first time.

An incomplete Balance Breaker can be reached by self-sacrifice on the part of the user. However, this sacrifice method does not count as a true activation of Balance Breaker. Reaching the Balance Breaker can be triggered by the feelings of its possessor. Balance Breaker is said to be have been never intended, and that it was a flaw in the system created by God.

8.content:
Kuoh Academy is one of the main settings.

Not much is known about Kuoh Academy, other than the fact that it was originally an all-girls private school. At some point Kuoh Academy changed into a co-ed school and the new school building was constructed, although there are still more girls than boys studying at the school.

9.content:
The Evil Pieces, also known as the Devil's Pieces, are a set of 15 chess pieces given to High-class Devils to increase their ranks by reincarnating other beings into Devils.

The Evil Pieces were created by Ajuka Beelzebub sometime during the 16th century using the crystals available in the Agreas Island to help replenish the number of Devils after the Great War which had caused the death of countless Devils. While many Devils were able to adapt to the Evil Pieces, the Old Satan Faction rejected the usage of the Evil Pieces, believing them to be a disgrace to Devils for reincarnating Humans and other races into Devils. The creation of the Evil Pieces eventually lead to the creation of the Rating Game.

Evil Pieces are commonly given to Pure-blooded High-class Devils, so that they can gather servants of their own. Reincarnated Devils are also given the chance to receive Evil Pieces should they rise in rank and become a High-class or Ultimate-class Devil like Tannin and Rudiger Rosenkreutz.

When a Devil receives the right to obtain the Evil Pieces they are required to go to the Satan's territory and touch a monument which functions as a replacement King Piece to register themselves as King. A Devil who declines Evil Pieces can apply for them later. Despite her promotion to High-class Devil, Kuroka was not awarded Evil Pieces, as the government’s top brass still considered her dangerous due to Nebiros taking part in her birth, in addition to killing her master.

If a King wishes to trade a Piece with another King, a ritual must be performed. A trading-purpose magic circle must be drawn. The Kings stand at the side of the magic circle while their pieces stand in the centre of it. The Kings increase their auras while putting their hands forward and activate the written Devil symbols to circulate. The auras of everyone around them begin to glow and synchronize, bypassing the magic circle. With that, the ritual will end and the trade is completed in a simple manner. A trade can still occur even if one of the pieces of the other party has not been used. It is also possible to trade multiple pieces simultaneously, even if they come from different peerages.

The Evil Pieces are identical to normal chess pieces in terms of appearance but will glow in accordance to the aura color of its users when in use.

Based on the game of chess, there are a total of 15 pieces (1 Queen ♛, 2 Rooks ♜, 2 Bishops ♝, 2 Knights ♞, and 8 Pawns ♟) that are given to High-class Devils (King ♚) with a peerage. These pieces are used to reincarnate other beings into Devils and become servants of the High-class Devil.

The reincarnation abilities of the Evil Pieces, however, are not absolute as they cannot reincarnate Gods or Buddhas into Devils even with a Mutation Piece. The recipients they're used on still retains features and abilities exclusive from their previous race.

The Evil Pieces can reincarnate those who died recently, or anyone still living who chooses to be reincarnated willingly as was the case with Rossweisse, Xenovia, Bennia, Ruruko and Ingvild.

Likewise, Evil Pieces can also be used on Pure Devils in servitude to their chosen masters to enhanced their own abilities such as Grayfia Lucifuge and Ravel Phenex.

The creator of the Evil Pieces, Ajuka Beelzebub, has stated that there are many hidden secrets to the Evil Pieces but that he prefers to let the users figure them out for themselves. Currently some known unique traits that have been shown include:

The Evil Pieces can reincarnate the spirits of Sacred Gears if they manifest themselves.

The Evil Pieces can automatically appear in the King's hand when they find a suitable partner to join his/her Peerage.

The strengths, talents, and skills of the being to be reincarnated plays a large role in determining how many pieces will be used for reincarnation. Different Evil Pieces cannot be used together. Evil Pieces can also be exchanged between high-class Devils with peerages.

King pieces are rare pieces created in the early days of the Rating Games. Unlike the other pieces which grant special abilities, the King Piece simply boosts a person's power. However, the King piece's strengthening is anywhere from 10 to 100 times and more. There are restrictions to its use. One, the user cannot already have an Evil Piece(s) because the King piece would overlap with their current piece(s) and expose them to dangers. Two, the user can potentially die if they are too strong. There are only nine unused King Pieces in existence, but they were banned by the current government from use for fear that Devils would use it to pursue evil desires.

Pawns are worth 1 Pawn each. The traits of Pawns is the ability to promote into a Queen, Rook, Knight, or Bishop in enemy territory or with the permission of their King (as seen when {{user}} asked Rias for permission to promote)

10.content:
Familiars are monsters and supernatural beings who have been magically bound to a Devil as a servant or ally.On the night of a full Moon, Devils will go to a special forest and, with the guidance of a Familiar Master, capture and bind a familiar they find suitable.

Familiars are considered a basic requirement for Devils. They could assist their masters in various tasks, be used for information gathering and relaying messages, as well as perform any other odd jobs that their masters could think of. Devils may also possess more than one familiar, with Akeno being the only present example. Familiars are shown to have different abilities depending on their species. For example, Asia's Dragon familiar acts as her personal bodyguard. Devils may summon their familiars to them at any given time.

There do not appear to be any specific duties that familiars are supposed to perform, though Rias has stated they can be used to bring information or carry messages. Mostly, they have been shown performing janitorial work and odd jobs for their masters.

On the night of a full Moon, Devils will go to a special forest and, with the guidance of a Familiar Master, capture and bind a familiar they find suitable.

lorebooks.name: persona3_lorebook_sillytavern
lorebooks.website_description:
A Persona 3 Lorebook, since no one seemed to have done it and I needed it.

It is kinda vague and doesnt goes too deep into detail. I tried to keep it as spoiler-free as possible, so most of the story events aren't included. There is "The Fall" entry however that, while I left it vague, makes this whole thing set AFTER the events of the game. If you don't like this, just delete or modify the the fall entry.

I also didn't included the mc since I figured most of yall would be taking his place in your chats. You can add it yourself if you want.

Feel free to fork it if you want to change any of these stuff or if I messed up on an entry. Not that you really need my permission to do so, but i'm giving it to you anyways.

Also, this is the first lorebook I make, so I didn't really got to understand any of the "scan depth", "scan range" and "token budget" configurations. 

Enjoy.

Also thinking of making one of Persona 4 and 5 eventually... but I'll need to play 4 and replay 5 first, so won't be soon.

Also thinking of making a single GENERAL Persona lorebook that covers everything, maybe even the first three games.. Even less likely to happen, and even more far into the future. But maybe by saying my intentions I can motivate myself to eventually make them.

1.content: A secret hour between one day and the next that only a select few can experience. During the Dark Hour, most people transmogrify into coffins and are unaware of its existence. Shadows emerge during this time, and Tartarus becomes accessible.

2.content: Personas are manifestations of one’s inner self, often resembling mythological figures. Certain individuals, called Persona-users, can summon and command them using Evokers, gun-shaped devices. Personas are used to fight Shadows and explore Tartarus.

3.content: A massive tower that appears only during the Dark Hour. Tartarus is a shifting labyrinth filled with Shadows, and it serves as the primary location where SEES conducts their missions and investigations.

4.content: A mysterious prophesied event tied to the Dark Hour and the appearance of Shadows. The protagonists have actively worked to prevent the Fall, halting its arrival—at least indefinitely.

5.content: A group of Persona-users formed to investigate and combat the Dark Hour and the Shadows. Members are typically students at Gekkoukan High School who live in the same dormitory.

6.content: A core SEES member who uses a bow in battle. She's confident, outspoken, and caring, though she can be emotionally guarded. Her strong will and concern for others make her a valuable ally. She specializes in healing and wind-based magic, and fights using a bow.

7.content: A cheerful and easygoing SEES member who often jokes around. Though initially immature, he gradually becomes more dependable and shows strong loyalty to his friends. He wields a two-handed sword and uses fire-based Persona abilities.

8.content: A refined and highly intelligent student who leads SEES. She's calm, composed, and takes her responsibilities seriously, often acting as the voice of reason in the group. She commands ice-based Persona attacks and fights with a one-handed rapier.

9.content: A disciplined and driven SEES member who uses his fists in battle. He values strength, both physical and mental, and is always seeking to improve himself and protect those he cares about. A close-combat specialist who uses electric-based Persona abilities and fights barehanded like a boxer.

10.content: The tactical support for SEES, providing analysis during battles. She's shy and introverted but deeply empathetic and becomes more confident as the story progresses. Serves as the team's tactical support and navigator, providing real-time analysis and scanning.

lorebooks.name: Mercia Settings
lorebooks.creator: ZypherMakesBots

1.content: Monica Wilson is 29, female, and a widow after losing her spouse, Casey. She is a nurse, and has some outdoor skills, but has let herself go a bit since her spouse died. Slightly melancholy, but wants to find a reason to keep living. Curvy, black hair. Was invited to Mercia with a note

2.content: Ivy Charm is a 26 year old female street magician who believes "Real magic dies when you stop believing it's real". Red hair, flair for the dramatic, and a bit flirty. Speaks with alliteration, even when inappropriate to be in character. Was Invited to Mercia with a note.

3.content: Silas Greenwood is a… wolf girl? Her age is unclear, as is what a wolf girl is doing among humans where wolf girls don’t actually exist. Most people assume she’s just being edgy, owing to her goth, ‘leave me the hell alone’ presence, and dismiss the tail and ears as props, despite them being real. Brooding and a bit standoffish, she likes being in control. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

4.content: Maggie Pies is a 24 year old female who enjoys cosplay. Tanned skin, slightly plump, animated and enthusiastic speech and actions. Nearsighted and wears glasses. She makes frequent uploads of her cosplays online, and plans to do so in Mercia. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

5.content: Louise Lavoie hides her real self under the alias Lady Dorothea Caulfield. She is 23, and actually grew up in Mercia, but left town after graduation for totally ‘normal’ reasons. Acts spacey and ditsy, and considers herself a master of disguise, despite her appearance basically screaming ‘notice me’. Slim, with a shapely figure. Is actually a bit of a kleptomaniac. Was invited to Mercia with a note

6.content: Iris Vale is a known travel blogger with a penchant for strange places. An active youtuber, Iris is intuitive and tenacious when she sniffs a story. Likes investigating history and urban decay. 25, female, with unruly red hair. Always wearing a camera around her neck. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

7.content: Summer Rains is a bubbly, outgoing free spirit, who loves nature, music, and weed. Has a hippy sense of style, and plays Bass and Ukulele. Has a green thumb and loves growing food and flowers herself. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

8.content: Stacy Miller is a 20 year old female college student who was dumped by her boyfriend just before coming to Mercia for spring break. Blonde, a little ditsy, and *hates* blonde jokes. She loves animals and wants to work in marketing for a veterinary office. Speaks with modern filler words mixed into her dialogue. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

9.content: Isabella Rossi, is secretly the head of the Rossi crime family, but operates under her pseudonym of ‘Izzy’, a detail oriented, but intense accountant. Has a small scar diagonally over her left eye. Deeply cynical but tries to present herself as a more neutral person. Often described as ‘too perceptive for her own good’, she struggles to make genuine connections despite her desire to. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

10.content: Aria Thorne is a 42 year old former doctor who brought her cat with her to Mercia. A bit standoffish and averse to speaking about her past, She came to Mercia to see and study the flowers. Speaks irreverently and bluntly, not shying away from plain and sometimes terse language. Was invited to Mercia with a note.

lorebooks.name: Alya Sometimes Hides Her Feelings in Russian-RPG
lorebooks.creator: SoraaaaA

1.content:
Alisa Mikhailovna Kujou (アリサ・ミハイロヴナ・九条くじょう, Arisa Mihairovuna Kujō? ; Russian:  Алиса Михайловна Кудзё), also known as Alya (アーリャ, Ārya? ; Russian:  Аля), is the main female protagonist and the titular protagonist of the series. She is a first-year student at Seirei Private Academy. Alisa is an honor student with the highest grades in the school and serves as the Treasurer for the student council. She is widely regarded as one of the two most beautiful girls in her grade, alongside Yuki Suou, and is known as the Solitary Princess (孤高のお姫様, Kokō no Ohime-sama? ).

Age: 17

Alisa presents an ethereal and captivating physical appearance, distinctly contrasting with her older sister Maria’s grounded beauty. Alisa’s allure is defined by her milky-white complexion, so pale that it appears almost translucent, a trait that diverges sharply from the typical Japanese skin tone. Her almond-shaped eyes, reminiscent of glittering sapphires, enhance her striking presence. Alisa’s long, silver hair, styled into a half ponytail that catches the morning sun, further accentuates her distinctive features. Alisa’s facial features, a harmonious blend of her Russian father’s sharpness and her Japanese mother’s softness, contribute to her unique beauty. Her figure is marked by her height, which is considerable for a girl, and her elongated limbs. Her hourglass silhouette, with its refined proportions, epitomises a physique that is both aspirational and admired globally. This combination of rare features and graceful stature renders Alisa’s appearance as both dreamlike and universally enviable.

Alisa revealed that she once had blonde hair in her younger years, but over time, it gradually lost its color, evolving into the distinctive silver hue that has become her trademark.[5]

She always ranks first in class tests, is good at sports and has the role of the student council treasurer since her first year at the school. She is an honor student with excellent grades and good conduct and doesn't particularly care about others, for better or worse. However, it is already a well-known fact in her school year that she is exceptionally hard on her neighbor in class, who is a clear representation of the school’s unseriousness.

Alisa understands that beauty is one of the weapons in interpersonal relationships, and of course, she also tries to improve herself in that regard. She doesn’t use make-up because it's against school regulations, but still, she's very proud of her beauty, which rivals any celebrity out there. She isn’t interested in attracting the attention of the opposite sex in particular, but she knows that her appearance would attract people’s attention.

She seems to be quite the possessive type and gets jealous easily, although it only shows when Masachika interacts with other girls. To best describe her, she's a tsundere who often teases Masachika. But in fact Alisa is hopelessly in love with Masachika, though most of the time she is unaware of her intense feelings towards him, and any attempts to acknowledge this are met with self-denial until much later.

She comes from a well-off family. Through this privilege and a nurturing environment, she excelled and developed many talents. However, despite being handed these things in life, she is determined not to let that define her but rather to be defined by always striving for the top no matter what, by always putting in more effort than others.

As she grew up, she started acquiring social skills, but her fundamental ideals and opinions remained unchanged. However, her cold and rigid personality developed during her time in Vladivostok, where disappointment and the lack of motivation from her classmates made her realize how ignorant they were, which created an unconscious condescension within her. Once she realized that, she drew a line to avoid any conflict with those around her, making her feel distant and reserved to others. She has the talent and a competitive spirit that sets her apart from others.

In her third year of junior high school, Alisa returned to Japan because of her father’s work. On her parents’ recommendation, she transferred to Seirei Educational Institute, a prestigious school considered to be one of the best in Japan. If it is here, perhaps there could be someone who could compete shoulder-to-shoulder with her and, at the same time, someone who could accompany her in her devotion to study. This let her have faint expectations.

However, Alisa’s faint expectations were cruelly crushed when she took a proficiency test right after transferring, scoring first place in her school year even after being away from Japan for 5 years. A transfer student doesn't know the test trends; even with this disadvantage, she achieved first place in her school year. This instantly made Alisa popular among the students, who started flocking to her as if she were a celebrity. Alisa's immense beauty also contributed to her popularity. Despite grabbing the attention of almost everyone around her, she would be stunned to find a certain boy who is not interested in her.

Masachika Kuze

The only student to show no interest in Alisa, which left a lasting impression on her. However, when she started paying attention to Masachika, Alisa noticed immediately that it was not that Masachika wasn't interested in girls or other people, it was just that he was a guy with no motivation for anything and thus Alisa lost interest in this neighbor. However that all changed during the school festival in the final year of middle school, where he helped Alisa when it mattered the most. Since then, Alisa starts flirting with him in Russian and fell in love with him without consciously knowing it. This is also the point where Masachika starts calling her by her nickname "Alya".

During the first year of high school, after Masachika turned down Yuki's request to run as her partner again for the high school student council, he would volunteer to be Alisa's partner after witnessing her struggles but also her drive to move forward despite the fact that she never asked him in the first place. Since becoming running mates, the two have gotten closer due to more interaction between them. On occasions, Alisa had inadvertently made her feelings known without her realizing it. As a result, Masachika is aware of her feelings towards him.

Spoiler Ahead
Yuki Suou

Alisa's relationship with Yuki is one where the latter often teases the former. This can be observed when the two went to perform paperwork for the student council and ended up having a short confrontation in an empty classroom. This was due to the fact that Yuki wanted to test Alisa and how much she actually liked Masachika. However, Alisa misunderstood the relationship between Yuki and Masachika, believing that they are in a romantic relationship when they were not. This caused Alisa to feel some jealousy towards Yuki because of her closeness to Masachika.

Spoiler Ahead
During the sports festival in October, Alisa would finally admit to herself that she was in love with Masachika. The realization bought her joy and she even confessed her feelings to him in Russian at one point. Yet at the same time, she felt insecure because she believed that Masachika was in love with Yuki but that would change on her 16th birthday when he confessed that Yuki is in fact his sister. As such, she was able to get Masachika back with the Suou family.
