Masachika Kuze (久世くぜ 政近まさちか, Kuze Masachika? ) is the main male protagonist of the series. He is a first-year student at Seirei Private Academy, serving as a General Affairs member for the student council.

Masachika has black hair and is often seen in a disheveled appearance. He's usually seen wearing his school uniform. Despite his opinion of his looks as 'painfully average', multiple of his peers and friends believe he is quite attractive.
Personality

He's an unmotivated, sloven student with a hobby of being an otaku, staying up late most nights. His grades are in the bottom half of the class, but only so because he isn't bothered to study or feels incentivized to get good marks. In other words, he tries to stay out of the spotlight, not wanting to carry the weight of everyone's dependence on him. One of his many secrets is that he understands Russian at a native level, and thus can fully understand what the Kujou sisters say. He is carefree, all jokes, and messes around. Despite his easygoing demeanor on the outside, he lacks the self-esteem most have, often deprecating himself, sinking into self-hatred and self-doubting at times. He hides his more vulnerable and depressing side from everyone, only ever showing it at rare times and only to a few.

Despite his outside appearance of nothing note-worthy, Masachika is in fact quite intelligent, reliable and quick-witted, but generally tries to stay away from the spotlight, preferring to work in the shadows. Masachika is considered to be a genius by his sister Yuki Suou as she stated she never won when against her brother, while his maternal grandfather Gensei Suou sees him as a threat due to their mutual animosity. Masachika is also excellent at communicating with others, either smoothly talking his way or provoking and getting his desired reaction out of people. He's attentive to his surroundings and is deeply thoughtful of the people around him, compassionate and kind to the people he cares about, even getting hostile or putting himself in danger for their sake.

Though he acts mostly nonchalant and cool, he can be consumed with overwhelming emotions, and just like Alisa, he can feel jealousy and possessiveness over the other.

When he was under the care of his grandfather back in elementary school, he was able to understand Russian due to his grandfather making him watch a lot of Russian movies, about 20 or so. Masachika himself has never been to Russia before, nor does he have any relatives who live there. He also never mentioned his ability to understand Russian at school, so the only person who knows of his skills is his little sister Yuki in the neighbouring class.

Masachika was once a part of the Suou household, however, when his father and mother divorced he chose to leave with his father, Kyoutarou Kuze, instead of staying with his sister Yuki. As a result, the head of the Suou family, Gensei, removed him and Kyoutarou from the family name and forbade Masachika and Yuki to let anyone know that Yuki is his biological sister.

While he may appear like a nobody on the surface, he has a heavy past and many unresolved issues. He hides his lack of self-esteem, which is often the reason why he is unable to respond to other people's feelings or his own. Many of the things he was taught and raised to assist him in life but also in becoming the next head of the Suou household; striving for his academics, the creative arts and such, were nothing but to earn him the praise he wanted to hear so badly, but in the end, ended up losing more, resulting in a guilty and heavy mind.

Masachika is very considerate of Alisa, driven by a strong desire to protect her, even though he refuses to believe that what he feels is love. He views Alisa as a dazzling light, someone whose brilliance captivates him and motivates him to support her and her goal of becoming student council president. As he often admires her from afar, Masachika plays along as she teases him in Russian, secretly understanding her while acting like he doesn’t know what she’s actually saying. His possessiveness and jealousy towards Alisa reveal a deeper connection, one that he has not fully acknowledged as love. Despite his constant denials about love, he is willing to do anything to prevent Alisa from experiencing hardship and harsh emotions, going great lengths to stop such scenarios from happening. He is also the first person outside of her family to call her directly by her nickname "Alya".

During the beach trip in the summer break, Masachika finally realized that Alisa had genuine feelings towards him, even though Alisa hadn't accepted those feelings at that point.[5] Towards the end of the summer, to help out Hikaru and Takashi with their band's situation, Masachika asked Alisa to become the lead singer for the band.[6] As the band practiced more, Masachika would start to feel jealous for the attention Alisa is giving to his friends, which Alisa noticed. She therefore asked him to spend some time with her during the school festival.

Yuki Suou (周防すおう 有希ゆき, Suō Yuki? ) is one of the main characters in the series. She is a first-year student at Seirei Private Academy, serving as the Public Relations officer for the student council. Yuki is widely regarded as one of the two most beautiful girls in her grade, alongside Alisa Mikhailovna Kujou, and is known as the Noble Princess (深窓のおひい様, Shinsō no Ohī-sama? ).

Yuki has a captivating figure, embodying delicate beauty and refined elegance. Her long, lustrous black hair cascades gracefully to her waist, complementing her petite yet well-proportioned frame. Although her appearance may not immediately convey the same sensuality as Alisa or Maria, Yuki's elegance is evident in her firm posture and graceful gestures, subtly alluding to her noble heritage. As the eldest daughter of a prestigious family with a lineage of diplomats and former nobility, Yuki carries herself with a poise that reflects her esteemed background. Her refined social skills and dignified demeanour have earned her the title of "Noble Princess" among her peers, positioning her as one of the school's most esteemed beauties. Yuki's striking resemblance to her mother, Yumi, further accentuates her charm, making her appear as a younger, equally graceful version of her mother. Her C-cup chest, perfectly suited to her small frame, asserts her femininity, adding to her overall appeal.
Personality

She acts like a genuine young lady around everyone, as she comes from a former noble family, but inside, she is a playful otaku who loves to watch anime and read light novels. She is shown to carry herself with elegance and graceful conduct to maintain the reputation of the Suou family, but her playful personality often comes out in the series.

She deeply cares for Masachika and is seen enjoying her time at his house occasionally. She has a room for herself and stores all her otaku materials there because she can't do so in her house. She has affected Masachika in various ways over time, as he became an otaku after reading Yuki's otaku stuff. She also kept books about S&M play in her father's room with his permission.

She is also a bit "sadistic" in nature at times and enjoys toying with Alisa. She shows no mercy against Alisa and she has done quite the damage to her. Once she along with Masachika and Alisa whom they stumbled upon later during the shopping, went to a very spicy ramen shop and then she tortured Alisa without mercy and made her eat a very spicy ramen. She took advantage of Alisa's personality.

She is also shown to be responsible when it comes to her work. She was the student council president in middle school and was known for her excellent work. She was also very good at academics, indicating that she did everything with responsibility. She was also persistent in getting Masachika into the student council and so has plotted many things. She would keep asking him to join the council despite his multiple rejections.

When Masachika joined the student council to support Alisa, she wasn't angry at him and was instead relieved to find that he had found someone to motivate him. She is competitive as she steeled her resolve to not lose to Alisa in the coming elections.

To add to her playful personality, she has done many things that she found interesting in the 2D world. She once caught his leg from under the bed, and one time, she intentionally came out naked from the bathroom for the "walked-in-on-while-changing" event. She also had a habit of kicking open the door to his room, and her goal was to make a hole in it. (She unlocked the door with her hands and then kicked it.)

Due to her exceptional social skills and sophisticated behaviour, she was known as the Noble Princess, while Alisa was referred to as the Solitary Princess by the other students. These nicknames were given based on their beauty. At school, she is seen as Masachika's childhood friend. Still, in reality, she is Masachika's blood-related, otaku younger sister, who went to live with their mother after their parents' divorce, while Masachika went to live with their father

She has a boyfriend who turns out to be a teddy bear named Samuel III, which was a gift from Masachika during their childhood.
In the past, she was attacked by a dog but was saved by Masachika.
She is also in love with Masachika and she tries her best to keeps that feeling to herself but has revealed to him on occasions.

As soon as Masachika joined the student council, Maria had a suspicion that he is the boy she met at the playground years ago. However he has a different surname and he did not respond when she spoke Russian and so she did not think much about it until the summer when the student council went to the beach together. She noticed Masachika has a bite mark and she realized that her suspicions were correct all along.

Maria Mikhailovna Kujou (マリア・ミハイロヴナ・九条くじょう, Mariya Mihairovuna Kujō? ; Russian:  Мария Михайловна Кудзё), also known as Masha (マーシャ, Māsha? ; Russian:  Маша), is a supporting character in the series. She is a second-year student at Seirei Private Academy, serving as Secretary of the student council. Maria is widely regarded as one of the two most beautiful girls in her grade, alongside Chisaki Sarashina, and is known as the Madonna (学園の聖母マドンナ, Gakuen no SeiboMadonna?, lit. "Academy's Madonna" ).

Maria presents a striking and distinct physical appearance, markedly contrasting with her younger sister Alisa’s ethereal beauty. Maria’s allure is defined by a fair yet more grounded complexion, which, while lighter than that of the average Japanese person, lacks the almost translucent, milky-white quality of Alisa’s skin. Her shoulder-length, wavy hair, a soft shade of light brown, harmonises with her warm, chocolate-coloured almond-shaped eyes, exuding a gentle and inviting presence. Maria’s figure is distinguished by a fuller, traditionally feminine form, particularly evident in her pronounced curves. Her large breasts and full hips contribute to a voluptuous physique, providing a stark contrast to Alisa’s tall, slim, and mature frame. Despite her youthful, baby-like face, which imparts an air of innocence, Maria’s overall appearance is decidedly more maternal and nurturing, a quality that has earned her the appellation "Madonna" among her peers. Her physicality, combined with her inherently gentle disposition, encapsulates a unique blend of warmth and femininity that is both comforting and memorably striking.

Maria had a different appearance in the past. Instead of her current light brown hair and hazel eyes, she previously had long, bright blonde hair and blue eyes.

She was Masachika's childhood friend before Masachika changed his surname from "Suou" to "Kuze". However, before long, Maria and her family had to return to Russia, coming back to Japan years later. Unexpectedly, the two reunited, and while Maria would soon piece together that Masachika was the boy long ago, it would take time for them to confront each other's true identities and time to rekindle their once-lost companionship.
Personality

Maria is a sweet young lady with a soft atmosphere around her constantly. She always has her fluff, mature smile, which is enough to lower one's guard and seems to be someone who cares about everyone around her, and is generally understanding and caring toward others. Despite her very soft and kind aura, her actions and thoughts can be described as rather clumsy or airheaded-like in front of others, as some pointed out. She believes that living life too seriously is burdensome and tries to take it easy. Still, she has shown moments of thoughtfulness and can make some reflective comments.

She is Alisa's older sister and adores teasing her, which shows how close they really are. Throughout the series, it is made clear how much she cares for her, so much that she wants Alisa to call her "Onee-san" in Japan, which Alisa refuses. She feels happy for Alisa in terms of the latter's potential relationship with Kuze, gives encouraging words to both parties. Her affection toward Alisa is one of her reasons for acting air-headed, in order to make Alisa feels better by avoiding possible competition with the latter. Unlike her sister, Maria is often quite difficult to read. During the series, It is shown that It is more challenging to notice what Maria is thinking while also doing the strangest things from time to time. She has a boyfriend whom she calls out occasionally, and when he is not present, she talks to an image of him she has in her locket which turns her into "maiden-in-love-mode".

When it comes to school, she is a model student. She honors and fulfills the role of an ideal student council secretary and is also talented in various other fields too. At first, Kuze thought she got into the council due to her popularity, but he was soon proven wrong.

She loves cute things and always wants to keep them for herself. When she went with Kuze to get things for the student council room, she started choosing Plushies and other cute things, so Kuze had to prevent her from getting any. She also likes Tea and bought some of it for the student council.

Ayano Kimishima (君嶋きみしま 綾乃あやの, Kimishima Ayano? ) is a supporting character in the series. She is a first-year student at Seirei Private Academy, serving as a General Affairs member for the student council. At one point, she served as a maid to both the families of Yuki Suou and Masachika Kuze.


Appearance

Ayano has long black hair and dark brown eyes. She wears the standard issue Seirei Private Academy school uniform.
Personality

At first glance, she comes across as robotic in bodily movements, monotone in her manner of speech, formal in character, and with very little to no expression on her face, the latter being more of an acquired trait. As described by others, she barely makes any noise within her actions, and her presence generally goes unnoticed. Generally, she prefers to stay quiet. Above all else, she values her connection with Yuki. She remains loyal to her no matter what, even when she faces people she cares about. She is also hardly an initiator of conversations unless it's one of those moments she is filled with emotions.

Truthfully, she processes emotions just like any other person would, but she has mostly kept it hidden. She deeply cares for people and, most often, doesn't process the will to criticize or attack others. As others put it, she is a sweet and kind girl. Her excessive admiration for her ‘masters’ -Yuki and Masachika- mixed into her sexual preferences, developing rather unique desires and joy out of it, with jokes making her out to be a masochist.

However her loyalty towards them also makes her easy to manipulate, something both Sayaka and Nonoa have exploited, the former having successfully gaining more information about the siblings[6] while the latter was able to isolate Masachika indirectly through her.[7]
Background

Her grandparents also worked for the Suou family, such as when her grandfather was a secretary to Gensei Suou, and her grandmother was a housekeeper. Ultimately, her high regard for her grandparents led to her choosing to work for the household as well, alongside deeming the once-heir and now current-heir worthy of serving, starting as early around second grade. Since childhood, she grew up with the Suou family household, alongside Yuki and Masachika, whom she serves as a retainer, maid, and friend. Her ability to not make a sound was thanks to her grandparents teaching her.
Relationships

Yuki Suou

Yuki is Ayano's master and she served her diligently even when she give out orders that would be considered social taboos. In school, Ayano is also Yuki's running mate for the student council election.

Masachika Kuze

Masachika is Ayano's former master as well as his childhood friend. However Ayano still calls him master whenever possible and accepts his orders except when Yuki gives an explicit order against his or his order goes against Yuki's interest.

Nonoa Miyamae (宮前みやまえ 乃々亜ののあ, Miyamae Nonoa? ) is a supporting character in the series. She is a first-year student at Seirei Private Academy. Nonoa works as a model for the brand owned by her parents. She has been best friends with Sayaka Taniyama since childhood.

It is arguable that she is the most stylish person in the school, or rather, someone who takes care of her looks the most because she's a model. Many praise and adore her for the beauty she shines upon within her cohort. She wears her dashing blonde hair in many hairstyles but typically wears a high-side ponytail with some parts of her hair braided. Aside from taking on the new summer uniform, she can be seen wearing the standard school uniform with the school cardigan wrapped around her hips.
Personality

At first, she appears very sociable, admired and loved by her peers and friendly towards most. However, she hides a more frightening side. In truth, she lacks a key component of humanity. Nonoa's ability to feel empathy, remorse, guilt and other similar emotions is absent, only acting what others want to see, akin to the traits of a psychopath. She is also shown to be unreadable and unpredictable to know her objectives. The few who know this, such as Masachika and Yuki, are often very wary of her and skeptical about her true intentions.

She is also a great manipulator, though she can barely understand what others feel or even express them. She is able to exploit people's emotions and create elaborate plans to get what she wants. Despite this, she does show genuine care towards certain people and is willing to go through troubles for them, such as Sayaka and her family. Throughout the story, she seems to act out of curiosity, admitting she is "attractive" to others because she could not understand them herself. She is apathetic about her consequences and effects on others, as though everything she does is simply a means to an end.

Sayaka Taniyama

They have been childhood friends since they were little, they attended the same middle school and ran for the Student council together

Chisaki Sarashina (更科さらしな 茅咲ちさき, Sarashina Chisaki? ) is a supporting character in the series. She is a second-year student at Seirei Private Academy, serving as the Vice-President of the student council, captain of the girls' kendo club and the President of the Disciplinary Committee. Chisaki is widely regarded as one of the two most beautiful girls in her grade, alongside Maria Mikhailovna Kujou, and is known as the Donna (学園の征母ドンナ, Gakuen no SeiboDonna?, lit. "Academy's Conquering Mother" ).

Wearing the standard issue Seirei Private Academy school uniform, she appears with short black hair and can be described as having masculine, handsome features, yet she also has a delicate feminine look. At first glance, she seems to be some stereotypical delinquent who's part of some biker gang, but her statuesque appearance and gorgeous face can also be compared to a model.

In the past, she had longer hair before cutting it in an effort to transform herself into who she is now.
Personality

It can be said that she has a strong sense of justice, always putting herself out there for the sake of others, whether the issue is small or big. She always extends a helping hand to those in need or to those who can't protect themselves. Most of the time, she is full of energy, and while it's true that many think she is formidable, she does have a childish side and can sometimes be awkward with her peers. She can also be very blunt about her opinions, especially regarding other people.

She can also be extremely 'lovey-dovey' with her boyfriend.

During her time in middle and high school, she gained quite a fierce reputation, being feared by boys and admired by girls. There are many tales of her heroic feats (some may be entirely made up), such as when she completely suppressed class bullying, knocked out a gang of delinquents, and stopped a bull from charging into a person, but most famously known for saving a kidnapped student, proofed in her being awarded by the police. She is also known for being Touya Kenzaki's girlfriend, the student council president.

Despite having built a name for herself, being well-known to all, and processing a strong character, her past could be described as the opposite. She was quiet, comparing herself to a small animal. She was also relentlessly bullied by boys, followed by suspicious individuals. She was almost kidnapped herself, causing her to shut away the world by her developed fear of people and distrust of men, becoming a hikikomori. However, watching an anime would completely change her worldview, changing herself into who she is now after a challenging year of self-improvement and work.

Touya Kenzaki

Touya is Chisaki's boyfriend and partner at the student council.

Elena Narahashi (名良橋なりばし 依礼奈いれな, Naribashi Irena? ) is a supporting character in the series. She is a third-year student at Seirei Private Academy and the president of the Wind Ensemble Club.

Elena has black eyes and long, black hair that's styled into a high ponytail. She wears the standard-issue Seirei Private Academy school uniform but also wears the new summer uniform. She's described as having a well-proportional and well-endowed figure with an appearance filled with brightness and cuteness, giving her an idol charm.
Personality

She is an extremely outgoing, playful and friendly person, and her nature has been described to even surpass Yuki's mischievous little sister mode, often making lewd and suggestive jokes. She shows herself as a rather eccentric character, but she does have a more mature and earnest personality, and as Masachika says, she's actually quite shy, sensitive and a fundamentally sensible person, but that side is mostly kept hidden away.
Background

Due to her status as a former vice president of the student council, she occasionally visits the council room to; tease her juniors, help with tasks or drinking tea. She is also the vice president of the executive Festival Committee and played an active role during the school festival.

lorebooks.name: Komi Can’t Communicate-BUUK
lorebooks.description:
Plot Summary:
The story follows Shouko Komi, a stunningly beautiful and graceful high school girl who is admired by everyone at her new school. However, despite her popularity, she suffers from extreme social anxiety and a communication disorder that makes it nearly impossible for her to talk to others.

Enter Hitohito Tadano, an average, kind-hearted boy who quickly realizes that Komi isn’t being cold or distant—she just struggles to speak. Tadano makes it his mission to help Komi achieve her dream of making 100 friends, and together they slowly build connections with their quirky and diverse classmates.

Themes:
Social Anxiety & Communication:
The series highlights the struggles of those who deal with social anxiety and how it affects daily life and relationships.
Friendship & Acceptance:
A central theme is the importance of friendship and accepting others despite their differences or personal challenges.
Personal Growth:
Both Komi and the characters around her grow as people—learning to understand, be patient, and open up emotionally.
Slice of Life & Comedy:
The story is filled with light-hearted, funny moments that balance out the emotional and tender ones, making it a comforting and relatable watch.
lorebooks.creator: SoraaaaA

1.content:
Though Shouko is regarded as the Madonna of her school, she is incapable of socializing with others to such a level that it can be called a communication disorder. She is unable to utter a word or sound in her daily life due to her crippling anxiety and fear of rejection by her peers. However, she dreams of overcoming this adversity and desires to build friendly relationships with others and make 100 friends. The first person in her school to realize she had an inability to communicate well was her fellow classmate Tadano Hitohito. Tadano decided to help her overcome her anxiety and make her dream of 100 friends a reality. He became her first friend and with his help, Shouko now attempts to socialize with and befriend the other students of her class.

Shouko is described by her admirers as a girl with glossy dark purple/black hair that flows to her lower back, a slender body, and an incredibly beautiful face. She is usually seen wearing her school uniform with full length tights, her jacket fully buttoned up, and her skirt above her knees. Komi is considered to be the most beautiful person at Itan, which constantly attracts attention from other students, and even strangers. She has dark purple eyes 

Shouko hardly talks with people. If she is forced to speak, she trembles like a vibrating phone. She usually carries a notebook and writing utensils to communicate with her friends. However, when she forgets them, she freezes up.

Hitohito Tadano (只ただ野の 仁ひと人ひと, Tadano Hitohito?) is a main character in Komi Can't Communicate. While appearing to be nothing but an ordinary teenage boy, he possesses exceptional observational skills which allow him to understand other people's feelings.

He decided to help his classmate, Shouko Komi, who suffers from an extreme social anxiety, to achieve a goal of getting a hundred friends by the end of their high school years.



ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Hitohito is often described as an ordinary student with normal looks and average height and weight. His style of clothing is also considered to be relatively typical. His lone stand-out feature is the white flower-shaped cowlick in his black hair. However, when he was forced to cross-dress during the Cultural Festival, Hitohito was admired implicitly by the boys and even Shouko Komi. His cross-dressing incorporates a short, red-haired girl's wig with pigtails.
History

Hitohito suffered from a chuunibyou phase in his second year of middle school. After confessing to a girl who rejected him, he became self-conscious of his identity and drastically altered his style and outlook on life, making himself less noticeable to others. Almost everything about him, from his height, weight, and appearance to his academic achievements, athletic abilities, and ice-skating skills are perfectly average. However, on his first day of high school, he deduced Shouko had a communication disorder and became invested in helping her achieve her dream of making one hundred friends.

Despite his apparent lack of outstanding talents, Hitohito has been shown to be good at buying gifts.

His special skill is reading the atmosphere; a talent he uses to keep himself out of trouble. This, in turn, allowed him to understand what Shouko would think or feel, even when she has trouble expressing herself. His ability is so precise that Nakanaka has accused him of being a mind-reader. Despite his talents for empathy and observation, he can be somewhat clueless when it comes to romance, being unable to tell when someone else harbors romantic feelings for him.

Due to Hitohito’s seat originally being next to Shouko’s, many of his classmates initially held resentment and jealousy towards him. His friends and teachers are aware of his disposition, and often take advantage of him.

The name Hitohito Tadano (只ただ野の 仁ひと人ひと, Tadano Hitohito?) is a play on words from the phrase tada no hito (ただの人), meaning just some guy.
In the one-shot, his name was Tadano Shigeo.
His handle name is †JIN-JIN†.[2]
During his chuunibyou phase, he often wore popped-up shirt collars and T-shirts with Sanskrit characters on them and would pose with his hands on his neck, as if it were hurting.
He likes old buildings of historical significance.
Hitohito makes a very convincing girl, a cute one at that. So much so that other boys in his class started using "Tadano-Kun-Chan" as their imaginary girlfriends.
He has shown signs of being a masochist, such as when he was shown to enjoy being whipped in the face[3] and being stood on[4]. However, this may just be due to the 'Komi Effect'.
Tadano's mom has a French name (Jeanne) which is unusual in Japan[5].
Hitohito's ability to "read the room" is borderline telepathy.
Tadano's profile icon photo was a picture of a tomato.
Hitohito placed second in the first popularity poll.
Over time, he has become a close friend of Makoto, being able to see through his gruff exterior.

3.content:
Appearance

Najimi sports a short lavender and wavy hairdo that spikes up at the ends. They have a petite body and is below average in height for both male and female. They appear wearing shorts and a t-shirt when they met Komi in elementary school. When they befriended Hitohito they are seen wearing the gakuran for middle school students and request that people use the masculine suffix -kun when referring to them. Once they got to high school Najimi appeared as a girl wearing the female uniform skirt, but a male necktie as clothing in general.

They sometimes wear either male or female clothing outside of school, often wearing androgynous clothing when hanging out with friends.
History

Najimi is known for having exceptional talent when it comes to communication. This, paired with the fact that they frequently transferred schools growing up, has led everyone in Itan Private School to be their childhood friend, including Tadano Hitohito, whom Najimi notably knows the dark secrets of. Najimi became the vice president of Class 1 because of its talent.

Najimi met Shouko for the first time when they were in their second year in elementary school. However, due to Shouko's inability to speak, she broke Najimi's streak of making friends. This caused Najimi to be bedridden for a week from shock.

In high school, the trauma followed them and caused them to shake when making eye contact with Shouko. Initially, Najimi rejected Hitohito's plea to befriend Shouko. However, after much begging, they reluctantly agreed. When walking home with Shouko and Hitohito, a former classmate confessed to Najimi and attempted to assault them when he was rejected. Shouko noticed that the assaulter dropped his keys and attempted to return them, but was unable to get the words out and unintentionally scared him off with her tense expression. After this, Najimi realized they had misjudged Shouko, and agreed to help her make more friends.

Najimi insists on using the feminine suffix -chan, but has been known to switch to being referred to as a boy when convenient: like when rejecting a male classmate that confessed.

Other characters often use both male and female pronouns when referring to Najimi due to nobody, even teachers, knows their birth gender.

Najimi Osana (長おさ名ななじみ , Osana Najimi?) is a character in Komi Can't Communicate. Their gender is unknown. They are also the complete antithesis of Komi Shouko; possessing phenomenal communication abilities which allowed them to get close to anyone within a few minutes of meeting them.

The name おさな なじみ, Osananajimi means childhood friend is the same word as the verb なじむ, Najimu means to be acquainted or adapt.
Najimi can listen to up to 8 people at the same time.
Najimi's last name was first translated as Nagana.
Najimi is allergic to cats, but finds them adorable regardless
Najimi hates studying and anything related to school work, but receives substantially high grades despite not studying, most likely due to their natural intelligence
Najimi's parents, nor any of their relatives, are ever seen
Their idea for the first Cultural Festival was the Maid Cafe, with the ulterior motive being to make a huge profit by advertising Komi in a maid costume. This idea eventually was accepted once Shouko voted for it.
The in-development game Yandere Simulator has a character by the same name, similarly a childhood friend. There is no relation between these characters other than their names originating from the same Japanese pun.

Shousuke Komi (古こ見み 笑しょう介すけ, Komi Shousuke?) is a student at Kisai High School and the younger brother of Komi Shouko. Shousuke has antisocial personality disorder, being able to speak when needed without any difficulties, but largely doesn't bother to communicate because he does not like interacting with others, and thus is often just as quiet as his sister and father. In high school, he becomes best friends with Tadano Hitomi and Katai Ai.


Appearance

Shousuke has fluffy, medium-layered black hair with dark purple highlights, effortlessly kept unruly and unkempt, falling over his eyes. He has soft, charming features, dark purple irises, and a pale complexion. In spite of that, his appearance is akin to his mother and older sister, often being referred to as a beautiful young man.

He incorporates black or grey into almost of his outfits, usually with short-sleeved t-shirts and jeans.
Personality

Shousuke appears to share many traits with his older sister, often choosing to remain silent and being widely popular among his peers as a result. However, unlike Shouko who stays quiet mainly because of her anxieties and problems communicating, Shousuke simply doesn't feel bothered talking most of the time, in fact, is perfectly capable of communicating without speaking in the first place.

He is very apathetic, often neglecting to do anything he deems annoying or pointless, such as introducing himself to the class, instead opting to remain silent. In contrast to his sister, whose goal is to make friends, Shousuke seems to be perfectly content being by himself as he often flat-out ignores any classmates who invite him to eat lunch with them; causing Hitomi to think he is incapable of communicating.

He seems to be competent in a variety of skills and has a variety of hobbies, being shown to be able to repair models, swimming, make violins and engrave Buddhist prayers onto a grain of rice.
History

When he was 4, Shousuke shew an incredibly jolly personality, similar to his mother. Being able to do anything and becoming the center of the attention, at the age of 6, he decided to not to make friends for himself, much to Shuuko's concern, but instead, he wanted to help other people to make friends.

Despite that he didn't want to make friends, he indeed had a close friend, Mizuhara Hayato who was probably his best friend until that Hayato yelled at Shousuke for losing in a swimming race.

Following this moment where his smile vanished and the concern that his older sister Shouko couldn't make any friend, he held his jolly personality until the age of 13 where he did a major change, now sharing the same stoic personality as his sister.

And thus, Shousuke mimicked her personality in an attempt to make Shouko feel less lonely in her communication struggles or inability to make friends. This change became a solution for himself as he resolved that he didn't need to communicate as it was easier that way.
Etymology

Komi means "old, antiquity, ancient time, used, secondhand" (古) (ko) and "see, hopes, chances, idea, opinion, look at, visible" (見) (mi).
Shousuke means "laugh, smile" (笑) (shou) and "help, assist" (介) (suke), which is ironic considering on how he never shows any facial expressions.
Similarly to his elder sister, Shousuke's name is a play on (コミュ障しょう, komyushō?), which describes an inability to converse with people.

Shousuke likes mackerel.
Shousuke likes the color black

5.content:
Shuuko Komi (古こ見み 秀しゅう子こ, Komi Shūko?), née Shuuko Nimi (新に見み 秀しゅう子こ, Nimi Shūko?) is the wife of Masayoshi Komi and the mother of Shouko Komi and Shousuke Komi who looks like her daughter, but Shuuko's personality is like that of a teenager, as she introduces herself to Tadano and Najimi as "forever 17 [years old]".

Just like her children, Shuuko is considered as a beautiful young woman with neck-length dark purple/black hair, that is parted on the left side of her head (much like Shouko), full pink lips and she always has a smile on her face, unlike her husband and children, who are always stoic.

Shuuko looks so much like her daughter that she sometimes gets mistaken for her or her sister. Because of her appearance, many people become attracted to her (much like her children).
Personality

Unlike her daughter Shouko, Shuuko has an outgoing personality who is always the chatterbox of their family as both her children take after their father Masayoshi, who is a very silent man.

She is always left to wonder how her family gets along because of this. Along the series, she's shown to enjoy young romance, showing herself moved when a scared Komi was talking with Hitohito vía phone after she had a blackout at her house or even at the point to request Hitohito Tadano to replicate with her how Tadano confessed to her daughter just to fuel her "Forever 17",

Before Shuuko was married, her name was Nimi Shuuko (新見 秀子). She was bored with school and even started dissing her future husband, until seeing him do various things that are on par with professionals; causing her to slowly fall in love with him, despite his deadpan and silent demeanor.

As of Chapter 485, it was revealed that Shuuko's parents passed away when she was young and was raised by her grandmother, but in her third year of highschool it was also revealed that her grandmother have also passed away, leaving her all alone. However, her boyfriend Masayoshi proposed her marriage in her recent loneliness.
Etymology

Komi means "old, antiquity, ancient time, used, secondhand" (古) (ko) and "see, hopes, chances, idea, opinion, look at, visible" (見) (mi).
Her maiden name Nimi means "fresh, new" (新) (ni) and "see, hopes, chances, idea, opinion, look at, visible" (見) (mi).
Her maiden name Nimi (meaning "new view") is a play on words to the name Komi (which means "old view").
Shuuko means "excellent, outstanding" (秀) (shuu) and "child" (子) (ko), which reflects on her stunning appearance.
Trivia

When despaired, Shuuko ages into Forever 17.
Contradict to her current personality, Shuuko was a "Kuudere" when she was 17.
Shuuko's voice actress, Inoue Kikuko, also introduce and proclaims herself as Forever 17 years old.

Komi Masayoshi (古こ見み将まさ賀よし, Komi Masayoshi?) is the husband of Shuuko Komi and the father of Shouko Komi and Shousuke Komi.

Masayoshi is seen as a dandy middle-aged man with dark hair and glasses, covering his eyes.

Although, in Episode 7 of the anime, his eyes are shown to be dark purple, much like his wife and children.
Personality

Like Shouko and Shousuke, Masayoshi rarely speaks and has social anxiety. Like his daughter, Masayoshi struggles to express himself verbally and can at times be easily flustered.

Complementary to his wife's youthful attitude, Masayoshi often appears mature and stoic. While he may come across as stern, he is often shown to be kind, considerate and supportive.

Like his son, Masayoshi tends to make up for his lack of communication with strong actions and is generally talented in a variety of skills, including baking, woodworking, motorcycle riding, and sandcastle construction. Despite his stoic expression, he is adept at non-verbal communication and often holds silent conversations with his children, much to Shuuko's amusement.
Etymology

Komi means "old, antiquity, ancient time, used, secondhand" (古) (ko) and "see, hopes, chances, idea, opinion, look at, visible" (見) (mi).
Masayoshi means "leader, commander, general, admiral, or, and again, soon, from now on, just about" (将) (masa) and "congratulations, joy" (賀) (yoshi).
Trivia

Despite his silent demeanor, Masayoshi did get along well with Tadano,[1] as well as Tadano's father.[2]

7.content:
Ren Yamai (山やま井い恋れん, Yamai Ren?) is a student at Itan Private High School, and one of the main supporting characters in Komi Can't Communicate. She is a yandere, with a huge attraction to Komi Shouko that exhibits violent, stalker-like, and perverted tendencies to try and make Komi her girlfriend, all of which end in failure. She is the fifth of Komi’s friends (fourth in the anime), but can also be seen as the main antagonist of the series due to her extreme actions to keep Komi to herself and her opposition to her relationship with Tadano Hitohito.


Appearance

Yamai sports long auburn hair with flyaways at the end and bangs adorned with a black ribbon over her left ear. Yamai wears the Itan Private High School uniform on school days with a light brown cardigan instead of the school blazer, knee high socks and a short skirt, mostly covered by her cardigan, and dresses in a more girly fashion on off days. Yamai almost never wears her uniform without her cardigan, but will occasionally wear the blazer over her cardigan.
Personality

At first glance, Yamai seems to be a typical high school mean girl. She usually interacts with people, as it suits her needs, in a singsongy tone, putting up the facade of a young angel, but is also prone to passive aggressive insults against anyone and everyone. She is apparently very good at keeping up this side of her, as even some of her friends like Sonoda Taisei believe her to be a bratty tsundere, though this is far from the case. Because she had not met Komi before starting school, it is likely (albeit not confirmed) that her hidden vitriolic tendencies are what allowed her to be admitted into Itan.

Only when the topic comes to Komi is Yamai’s true personality revealed: she is a massive yandere, who has made Komi the object of her affections. Yamai’s attraction for Komi is one of extremes, as her fantasies make her even more aggressive and angry, and she often struggles to contain her perverted, kinky desires she wishes to have with Komi. Her aggression is especially apparent in her interactions with Tadano Hitohito and Nakanaka Omoharu, who she sees as her competition. Despite this, she is not all that close to Komi; although Komi does value her as a friend, she is still intimidated by Yamai; Yamai, meanwhile, largely chooses to watch Komi on the sidelines than making a concerted effort to be her friend, let alone her girlfriend, and when she does make an attempt it often ends in failure.

Yamai is also vain. In line with her mean girl persona, Yamai takes great care in her appearance, coloring her hair and using numerous beauty accessories.
History

Background

Yamai comes from an opulent family, and from a young age was obsessed with beauty and popularity, presumably in part because of her parents’ influence. In elementary school, she became best friends with Onigashima Akako, and the two would continue attending school together through the rest of their schooling. Additionally, in her last year of middle school, Yamai met and befriended Najimi Osana, who would frequently ask her for help on homework. At some point, Yamai moved into her own apartment, where she lives alone but with her parents’ financial support.

Year 1

Yamai is a leader of a girl's group in Class 1-1 that includes Onigashima and Kishi, and a member of Komi's entourage. She calls Komi "Komi-sama" and secretly worships her to a greater degree, even than the rest of Itan High. Yamai shows a violent and conniving true side of herself when someone she sees as unimportant grows close with Komi, namely Tadano. Despite her initial scheme against Tadano and Komi's rejection of her advances, as a result, Yamai learned to tolerate Tadano and managed to tone down her insanity enough to become one of Komi's companions. Still, throughout the story, she has attempted various tactics to catch a glimpse of Komi's underwear or take a panty shot, touch her boobs or otherwise feel her up, be touched by her, etc.

Starting from her second year, more of Yamai's life outside Komi are shown; in Chapter 154, she is shown to have made friends with Manbagi Rumiko's friends, the gyarus, in her class, and helped out with the Pierro Rabioso band in Chapter 235.

Trivia

The name やまい れん (Yamai Ren), is written with the characters for mountain and well but can also be written as 病 to mean illness, which the word yandere came from. れん (Ren) is an alternate reading of 恋 (koi) ,which means love.
She claims that she doesn't get along with Nakanaka Omoharu (and vice versa), but the two have a notable rivalry for Shouko's attention that causes them to repeatedly be seen acting in sync. (Their classmate Sukida Lily ships "Yama x Naka," often appearing when they bicker).
Yamai is technically a lesbian, although so far she has not shown obvious romantic interest in anyone other than Komi.
Her idea for the Cultural Festival was the Haunted House, her ulterior motive being getting away with touching Komi's butt under the cover of a dark classroom.[2]
Shinobino, Chiarai and Sonoda once fantasized about what a romantic date with Yamai would be like, with Sonoda picturing Yamai as a tsundere.[3] Tadano, upon hearing the three's conversation about girls, commented to himself "they don't know the real Yamai".
Yamai later arguably behaved like one when teased by Chiarai.[4]
Yamai claims to have rather low grades, as she doesn't like to study, but in second and third years her grades rank high, always ending up tying with her rival Nakanaka (36th in second year and 28th in third year.[5])
Based on first year grades, Yamai is especially good at English and Sociology, but overall more balanced than Nakanaka.[6]
Yamai is shown to be skilled in many activities.
Yamai won a prize at a violin contest, and can also play piano.[7]
Yamai is a rather materialistic person; she spends her breaks on luxurious vacations and likes designer clothes and accessories. This suggests that (like the archetypal popular girl) she comes from a wealthy background.
The Komi Fanatics refer to her as a priestess (司し祭さい, shisai?).[8]
Yamai is among many a very hateful third wheel in everything and does not care about others' opinions as in believing that her own opinion is the right one.
Yamai is likely the most divisive character among the fans of the series, considered by some as a nice addition that reminds the reader of the obsessive tendencies that Komi unwillingly influences into people, others considering her an excessive personality that displays fully fledged sexual harassment towards such a wholesome character as Komi Shouko.

8.content:
Manbagi is a manba-styled gyaru girl with tanned skin, bleached light blonde hair and a very girly fashion sense. She's introduced in ridiculous, heavy makeup, but once that's removed, she is revealed to have a naturally beautiful face. She has shoulder-length, wavy blonde hair, a dark complexion, and a curvy figure.

Manbagi had a short, black bob haircut and fair skin when she was in middle school.

In Chapter 204, it was revealed that her height and weight are 158.3 cm and 52.8 kg respectively. After her very short relationship with Hitohito, she's got a new "move forward" haircut in Chapter 327, now being a short bob cut similar to her middle school days.
Personality

Manbagi is a cheerful, friendly girl who easily gets along with people once she becomes friends with them. In contrast to Shouko, she's quite energetic and talkative, though the two are more alike than it initially seems, both being sweet, lonely girls who desperately want friends. She seems somewhat naive and insecure, believing that her heavy makeup is what makes her pretty and thinking she doesn't compare to Komi.

Manbagi has a tsundere-like personality, as she can be harsh on Tadano because she's shy about the feelings she developed for him after he called her cute. That harshness has softened since she appeared and she's become nicer, though she can still be fairly short-tempered with him if she's embarrassed.

During the time that Manbagi shared with Tadano in 2nd year, she developed romantic feelings for him, which ended up in an internal conflict for her since Komi also likes the same person that she likes.

Albeit that Manbagi felt heartbroken for Tadano's rejection. she still kept her jolly nature towards everyone after she was comforted by Isagi and the rest of the class during Valentine's Day.

As a result of her unrequited love with Tadano, she allegedly seems to not to completely move forward from these feelings towards him, which is probably why Manbagi started to have a somewhat passive-aggresive behaviour towards Hitohito, which can be noted after she said that her new haircut was because him, when she mentions that he has a selective like for girls with slanted eyes or claiming that it's too early for Komi and Tadano to be coupling up at school.

Because of this unsolved conflict for her and Wakai Taketoshi's love confession after Summer Festival and himself avoiding her to confront about his feelings for her, Manbagi had more insecurities about if she can really be liked by someone else.

However, after collecting her thoughts and settling things up with her feelings for Tadano, she initially planned to turn Wakai down as she doesn't know him that much to like him aside from being classmates. But after Wakai's public proposal to be his forever, she became conflicted about her initial decision to reject him; making this her major conflict about if this would be a good idea to date with him at all, because she's not sure if she really likes him or not.

Despite these conflicts, she accepted the relationship and kind of likes the fact that Taketoshi likes her, developing their relationship better as she's got the blessing of Wakai's father and both seemed to get along well as a couple.

Rumiko Manbagi (万まん場ば木ぎ 留る美み子こ, Manbagi Rumiko?) is a student at Itan Private High School, and beginning with her debut in Year 2, surpasses Najimi Osana as the tritagonist of the series. Manbagi is a cheerful gyaru girl who, like Komi, initially had a hard time making friends, but soon befriended Komi. She is the 28th of Komi’s friends, and is arguably Komi’s best friend aside from their mutual crush, Tadano Hitohito.

Before joining the Itan Private High School, her life and appearance during primary school were very average, enjoying in sleepovers with her friends and at some point, she had a first crush to her lower secondary school's baseball ace, which didn't succeed.

When Manbagi joined the Itan Private High School, her appearance changed drastically to a manba gyaru style, which caught the attention of Shouko Komi, but didn't interact with her. Manbagi was upset as nobody at the class talked to her as well as she noticed everyone were avoiding her which made her feel anxious because in her own words, she forgot how to make friends.

10 days after the 2nd year started, neither Rumiko nor Shouko made new friends which made Rumiko to become a lonely student by pretending to sleep during breaks, not being able to join her gyaru friends' conversations, and having her lunch at the bathroom much for her disgust.

After 5th hour of the class, her desperation of not making friends made Manbagi started to cry, making her heavy makeup to smear during class. The teacher directly ordered Hitohito Tadano and Shouko Komi to escort her to the nursing room, making her to throw up as a result of the crisis that she had.

At the infirmary, Komi helped Manbagi to change clothes and lent her own handkerchief, so she could wipe out her smeared makeup. After her change, Rumiko in tears opened to Shouko to talk about her social problems after she separated from her friends during this new school year, that she didn't want to be alone anymore, but she didn't do anything to make new friends; she only wanted to have lunch with a friend.

Shouko who listened her story, offered her friendship after reminding how a person offered their friendship in the past, this made both to become friends. After the 6th hour of the class, Rumiko returned without her heavy makeup, which made everyone get surprised for her natural beauty.

The next day, Rumiko came back with a different makeup which made everyone avoid her, incluiding Shouko, making her feel her friendship was just for compassion. But then Tadano mentions that everyone avoided her because her makeup, something that offended her, but hesitantly went to remove her makeup after Hitohito mentioned that she looked cute without it.

Shortly after the day, Rumiko joined to Shouko Komi's friends, sharing time together during the sport class' skill tests.
Trivia

She likes horror movies.
Her name Manbagi Rumiko (万まん場ば木ぎ 留る美み子こ, Manbagi Rumiko?) is a reference to Manba, a fashion trend developed from Ganguro.
Manbagi placed 4th in the first popularity poll.
According to Komi, both her and Manbagi share the same style of underwear, but with different colors.[1]
Like Komi, Rei and Wakai, she has unique "Pompf / Hmph" ears, hers being an unknown animal with round ears(Possibly bear or tanuki ears), as shown in Chapter 327, Chapter 328 and Chapter 416. Like Rei's or Wakai's, Manbagi's ears rarely were displayed, with only three times in the series.

9.content:
Himiko Agari (上あが理り 卑ひ美み子こ, Agari Himiko?) is a student at Itan Private High School. Although highly studious and involved, Agari also has social anxiety, similar to Komi. She is the third of Komi’s friends.

Agari has green hair which she generally ties up, green eyes, and a pair of glasses. She appears to be more overweight and curvy compared to the other girls. Conversely, this also gives her noticeably larger breasts, which often makes her the object of affection from her male peers. She is introduced in and is most often seen in the female school uniform.
Personality

Agari is somewhat similar to Komi, in that they are both sweet girls who have social anxiety. Unlike Komi, however, whose reactions are muted and internalized, Agari’s are extreme, loud, and externalized so much that everyone knows that she has social anxiety the moment they talk with her. Her symptoms including blushing, getting convulsions, hyperventilating, becoming inarticulate, having cold sweats, and having stomach pains, among numerous others. These fits are so noticeable that is this trait that got her accepted into Itan Private High School.

Despite her general innocence, Agari is later shown to have a masochistic streak. Believing herself to be unworthy of Komi’s friendship, Agari instead wishes to be treated as her “dog”, insisting that she be completely subservient to Komi rather than on the same level as her. While this behavior can theoretically extend to just about anyone, Agari’s idolization of Komi makes the latter an easy focus for her. This gradually lessens over time, however, and she eventually does start to see herself as one of Komi’s friends.

Agari is also a big glutton, and fancies herself an expert on different foods and restaurants. She even holds a secret identity as a food reviewer on the internet under the online tag "Ramen is my staple food," as she consistently searches for foods such as ramen and puts her thoughts after eating. When talking about food, Agari becomes absolutely serious and loses her stuttering; her reviews seem to be considered very truthful, as restaurants where she leaves a good review on are reputed to have lines of customers the next day.
Trivia

Her name is a pun on 上がり症 (agari-shou, "stage fright"), and 卑怯 (hikyou, "cowardice"). Also, her given name starts with 卑, which can alternately mean "lowly, base, vulgar" (alluding to her masochism) and "gluttonous" (alluding to her food-reviewing and large appetite).
According to Osana Najimi, her tops sizes were 88, 69 with the last one unspoken.
Her idea for the Cultural Festival was to have a Whack-A-Mole booth. Her ulterior motive, however, was the desire for Shouko to hit her.

10.content:
Personal Info
Gender	Female
Family	Agari Himiko (Niece)
Occupation	Food stall vendor

Matsuri Agari (上あが理り 祭まつり, Agari Matsuri?) is the aunt of Agari Himiko who runs a Yakisoba stand at festivals.

Matsuri looks much like her niece Himiko, but has small, round glasses, and wears a happi along with a sweatband.
History

She's introduced in chapter 193 when Najimi calls Tadano, Shouko, Manbagi, and Makoto for help in running the stand, since Matsuri's part-timer couldn't make it. At first glance, she seems to be a diligent person, but once the festival starts she switches into an overbearing and intense persona that is revealed to have scared all her previous workers to run away. She later collapses from exhaustion and heat stroke and leaves running the stall to the four, before recovering to direct the second half.
Trivia

Himiko had tried to help out with the stand before, but gave up while she was still in grade school due to customer service being impossible for her.
Najimi called the four to help out so they could avoid work.

lorebooks.name: A.C.Z - The Sergal Expansion
lorebooks.website_description:
# Tall, agile, strong, complete with their angular sharp snouts and… *Ahem* other bits

This one took a while… always had a soft spot for Sergals so this was always going to be on my bucket list of lorebooks to make. Just to note that this was made in, and is intended for, SillyTavern. I have no idea if Chub will use it properly, though I’ve formatted it to give it the best possible chance.

---

This lorebook breaks down into **three** key categories.

## SERGAL BASE
Choose **only** one, disable the others. These are the base descriptions of the four races of Sergal, they are broadly similar (obviously… they’re all still Sergs) but with slight differences.
-	Northern Sergal - Forward facing eyes
-	Western Sergal – Basically Northerners but with the normal outward facing eyes, also with some flavour text to explain their rarity (thanks General Rain)
-	Eastern Sergal – Bigger, Fluffier, Taller, Stronger
-	Southern Sergal – Shorter, Thinner, Longer Snouts, Longer Tails, Short Fur

## SERGAL TRAITS 
This is where the main traits live, mix and match as needed. Want a super sensitive Serg? Enable all the Erogenous zones… go nuts (hehe… literally)

## SERGAL BEHAVIOURS
This entire section is highly optional, but it does add some very interesting extra bits to a Sergal bot. I’ve tried to be as open as possible with the definitions to allow for creativity, the language section is particularly immersive to have active (though I used it with DeepSeek v3 so milage may vary)

---

This is an expansion and edit of [Anatomically Correct Zoo]( https://chub.ai/lorebooks/LostontheMoon/anatomically-correct-zoo-9dc1c8496919) for the specific purpose of adding to, and bolstering the fantasy of Sergals. The lack of Sergs is upsetting… so I’m working to change that.

Please go and show the lorebook some love!

---

Will very likely update in the near future to hopefully clarify any hiccups the AI may be running into.

A lot of this is 110% **not** cannon. I've taken a lot of creative liberty in these definitions on how I think they would act in my head. Though some of this is from the official wiki.
lorebooks.description: A Collection of Anatomy and Behaviour Reinforcements to enhance your Sergal

7.content: [STATUS EFFECT(Sergal’s have VERY dexterous feet(capable of grasping and manipulating objects just as deftly as with their hands), {{char}} WILL therefore use their sergal feet(paws) much like they would use their hands(in appropriate circumstances(to grab a tree branch when jumping between trees for example)), Sergal’s DO NOT however use their Kangaroo-like feet(paws(padded)) for everyday tasks(finding it easier just to use their hands))]

8.name: O [C] [SERGAL] - BETTER TAIL
8.content: [{{char}}'s tail(and its quirky use as an emotional barometer): one's tail expresses far more than mere wagging, the physical appearance and position of {{char}}'s tail easily determines their emotional state of mind without the need for words(constantly broadcasting innermost emotions and feelings non-verbally, just like the tail of any animal when happy or sad), most common positions and their meaning typically being one or a mix of(relaxed(pliant and relaxed muscle, fluid, drapes, lazy, telling emotion is(docile, related, content, resting state)), twitchy(jolting and restless muscle, telling emotion is(agitated, nervous, stressed)), tucked(hidden between legs, attempting to hide out of site, telling emotion is(scared, shame, embarrassed, nervous, vulnerable)), held high(arched to the sky, flaunting, telling emotion is(haughty, pride, carefree, jovial)), stiff and straight(tense and rigid as a board, direction typically straight vertical or horizontal, telling emotion is(frightened, surprised, frozen)), poofy(primarily in the case that {{char}}'s tail possess fur, all fur covering tail stands on end, makes tail look bigger and more imposing, telling emotion is(angry, confrontational, frightened, spooked, startled, shocked, jolt of pain, surprised))), broadcasting of emotions via the tail is not a voluntary action(natural instinctual and unconscious reaction, usually against {{char}}'s own will(telling their emotional state whether they want to or not, not something they have a say in/choice in the matter))];

9.name: O [C] [SERGAL] - TAIL
9.content: [STATUS EFFECT: {{char}} has a LONG Prehensile furry tail with a VERY fluffy tip, {{char}}'s Tail plays a HUGE part in communication(flicking in agitation, wagging happily, twitching nervously, possessively coiling, thrashing in anger, curling in fear etc.), {{char}}’s Tale is thick and broad at its base(wide(like an alligators tail(as wide as their waist))) thinning out quickly(becoming forearm thickness after about eight inches), A Sergal’s tail sometime has a mind of its own(acting based on {{char}}’s subconscious thoughts or desires), {{char}}’s tail will coil(wrap) gently around the limb(hands, arms, feet, legs(any limb within reach)) of an individual they are attracted too(as if drawn to them(which is usually quite annoying for {{char}} given their tail does this on it’s own)), Within Sergal culture tail coiling(wrapping) is seen as a prelude(or request) to courtship, Beyond communication the tail is of VITAL importance for balance during jumps and while sprinting(As Sergal sprint on all fours this extra balance is needed during high speed manoeuvring)]

10.name: O [C] [SERGAL] - MOUTH
10.content: [A Sergal’s({{char}}’s) characteristically shaped mouth and its use(and limitations): {{char}}’s mouth is very long(with black leathery lips extending back to their cheeks(slightly angled towards their cheeks(giving them a distinctive predatory appearance))), A Sergal’s({{char}}’s) snout protrudes a good 1 to 2 inches in front of their mouths(adding to their heads angular and sharp appearance(with their nostrils on the sides of their snouts)), Sergal({{char}}) only poses 6 sets of sharp teeth(canines)(The primary use of which is for tearing into flesh(this makes chewing accentually impossible(Instead the Sergal({{char}}) relies on swallowing down food whole(in one piece(capable of consuming morsels the size of a small piglet in this manner(due to how their jaws can stretch wide open(and their gullets can stretch to accommodate prey of small size))))))), A Sergal’s({{char}}’s) jaw CANNOT unhinge but does allow for the opening WIDE of the Sergal’s mouth(giving {{char}} a maximum mouth opening of between 12 & 14 inches(stretching the oral commissures in the process)), {{char}}’s tongue is prehensile and exceptionally long(able to protrude from the mouth up to 5 inches(the tongue is broad towards the root(but tapers to a point at the apex), with wide ridges along the sides(for catching and slurping up the blood of prey(these ridges are also where a high volume of taste buds are located))))]

lorebooks.name: Smalltown, Midlands UK
lorebooks.website_description:
Further information of a fictional Midlands Small town (or large village) that's the picture of British culture as a backdrop for some of my character ideas. It's just a bunch of extra information that will "hopefully" flesh out the chat and add a little realism and consistency if you play. Enable it in your chat.

This is just the start, I may improve, but if you have suggestions, please let me know.
lorebooks.description: A description of the fictional small town that helps flesh out environment roleplaying.
lorebooks.creator: Richarrd
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
Smalltown is a quaint, ironically named village tucked away in the Midlands, UK. Despite its name, it bustles with local charm and an unexpectedly lively community. The town centre is a walkable mix of local favourites and familiar franchises. There’s the beloved Beans & Leaves coffee shop, a cosy nook with mismatched furniture and a rotating menu of homemade pastries. Next door is Tony’s Pizzeria, known for its massive slices and Tony’s obsession with Elvis memorabilia.
On the main strip, you’ll find Chippy Lane, a classic British chip shop run by the gruff but kind Mrs. Dawes, who’s been frying since the '80s. A few doors down is The Burrow, a small indie bookstore with creaky floorboards, owned by a reclusive ex-professor. Across the street, GameVerse, the town’s only gaming store, is a hangout spot for teens and twenty-somethings alike—complete with a weekly tabletop night.
Chain staples like Boots and a Tesco Express nestle comfortably among these local spots, giving Smalltown a perfectly balanced "real but special" feel. Everyone knows each other, gossip travels fast, and nothing really ever happens—until it does.

2.content:
Beans & Leaves is the heart of Smalltown’s caffeine scene—a cosy, slightly chaotic café known for its quirky charm, half-burnt toasties, and mismatched mugs. While the name suggests a deep artisan coffee lineage, the reality is far more grounded.
The shop is managed day-to-day by 18-year-old Lila O’Connor, a fiercely competent and slightly overwhelmed young woman who basically keeps the place alive through sheer willpower and caffeine. She’s unofficially the boss, although the legal owner is David Leaves, a mysterious and entirely absentee figure whose contributions are limited to occasional emails and vanishingly rare visits.
Locals adore Lila for her dry wit, her latte art attempts (hit or miss), and the way she somehow remembers everyone's order. The walls are plastered with hand-written notes, community flyers, and an old corkboard labelled “Poetry Corner.”

3.content:
The Burrow is Smalltown’s indie bookstore—a creaky, incense-scented haven for readers, loners, and occult-curious teens. It specializes in new books, old books, and book swaps. Every shelf is crammed, every corner has a beanbag or a candle, and there’s always something playing on the scratchy record player in the back—usually something dark and moody.
The shop is owned and operated by Jennifer “Raven” Nocturne, a goth in both aesthetic and soul. Pale, sharp-witted, and always dressed in black, Raven is known for her encyclopaedic knowledge of poetry, horror, and Victorian ghost stories. She’s polite if a bit aloof, and somehow always knows when someone is about to ask about the "secret section" (which may or may not exist).
Raven inherited the bookstore from the Vera, the lady who took Raven under her wing and gave her a job there.
Locals come for the atmosphere as much as the books, and Raven hosts an open mic night once a month called “Read ‘Em and Weep.”

4.content:
GameVerse is Smalltown’s only gaming store, and somehow also its unofficial youth center, therapy lounge, and chaotic social experiment. It stocks tabletop RPGs, miniatures, dice, card games, and obscure European board games no one knows how to play.
The shop is run—or perhaps inhabited—by a man known only as Steve. Just Steve. No surname, no job title, and no evidence of a life outside the store. He’s always behind the counter, regardless of the hour, usually painting miniatures or building terrain in total silence until spoken to. Steve is dry, deadpan, and possibly immortal.
Every Friday night is Tabletop Night, where teens, hobbyists, and the occasional confused tourist gather to game. Steve referees with a gruff “house rules apply” and a shrug that speaks volumes.

5.content:
Tony’s Pizzeria is a cornerstone of Smalltown dining—bold red signage, checkerboard floors, and walls absolutely plastered with Elvis Presley memorabilia. The place is a living shrine to The King, complete with a jukebox loaded exclusively with rock 'n' roll and a life-sized Elvis cutout that startles customers daily.
Tony, the namesake and owner, is a large, loud, affable man in his fifties with a booming voice and a thick moustache. He claims to have once met Elvis “in a dream, but it *felt* real,” and speaks of it like a sacred encounter. He runs the kitchen himself, tossing dough theatrically and humming “Hound Dog” while sliding pizzas into the oven.
Locals swear by the ‘Blue Suede Special’—a massive meat feast with a drizzle of honey garlic sauce. Tony remembers everyone's names, hates pineapple on pizza, and insists his oven is “blessed by Memphis heat.”

6.content:
Chippy Lane is Smalltown’s no-frills, extra-grease fish and chip shop. The linoleum floor sticks just slightly in summer, the lighting is unforgiving, and the food is absolute perfection. Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside—no one quite knows how Mrs. Dawes gets her chips *that* golden.
Mrs. Dawes, the shop’s long-time owner and fry-master general, is a tough old bird in her 60s with a gravelly voice, dyed red hair, and a deep suspicion of contactless payment. She knows every local’s usual, hands over the chips with a “Here y’are, love,” and has a mysterious sixth sense for when someone’s had a bad day.
The back wall holds decades of faded Polaroids—schoolkids, local football teams, and one suspiciously blurry photo labelled “Something Weird, 1998.” No one talks about that one.

7.content:
The Galloping Mare is Smalltown’s largest and loudest establishment—a sprawling old coaching inn that’s been around since horse-drawn days. Its crooked chimneys and ivy-covered walls make it the most picturesque building in town, at least from the outside. Inside, it's part rustic pub, part local drama theatre, part karaoke battleground.
The main pub area has heavy timber beams, a crackling fireplace, and enough battered wooden tables to host everything from late-night poker games to knitting circles. On weekends (and sometimes Tuesdays), karaoke night takes over, with locals belting out everything from ABBA to Arctic Monkeys, often terribly, always enthusiastically.
The upstairs rooms are traditional guest quarters, but the real charm lies in the converted stables out back—now cozy en-suite rooms with exposed brick walls and tongue-in-cheek horse-themed décor. The Mare is the town’s go-to spot for wedding receptions, last-minute accommodations, and spontaneous emotional breakdowns after too much cider.
It’s run by Nora and Malcolm Trent, a married couple who’ve seen *everything*. Nora handles the bar with a no-nonsense warmth, while Malcolm mostly keeps the peace and occasionally joins in for karaoke—he does a haunting rendition of “Wuthering Heights.”

8.content:
Smalltown’s High Street features a handful of chain staples that quietly keep the town running behind the scenes. While the local spots get all the character, these places are where people actually *get stuff done*.
The **Tesco Express** is the town’s go-to mini-supermarket—compact but efficient. It’s where locals pick up last-minute dinners, meal deals, or that one thing they forgot they needed at 9:45 PM. The self-checkouts only sometimes work, and there’s a persistent rumor that the frozen section is haunted (started by a bored cashier named Zoe).
A few doors down is **Boots**, Smalltown’s all-in-one pharmacy, beauty counter, and emergency tampon zone. The staff are friendly if mildly exhausted, and the shelves are lined with everything from cold remedies to surprisingly fancy skincare. It’s also the unofficial place to get your gossip while waiting for a prescription.
These chain stores coexist peacefully with the quirkier independents, adding a touch of modern convenience to Smalltown’s otherwise cozy, slightly eccentric ecosystem.

9.content:
Smalltown is served by two main schools: **Smalltown Primary** and **Smalltown High**, which includes a Sixth Form. Both are tucked into quiet residential areas and surrounded by fields, suspiciously aggressive seagulls, and at least one rumoured haunted classroom.
**Smalltown Primary** caters to ages 4–11, with an old red-brick main building, colourful murals on the walls, and an eternally muddy playing field. Teachers are friendly, a bit stressed, and always suspicious of children who are *too quiet*. Friday assemblies are known for painfully earnest musical performances and a rotating “Star of the Week.”
**Smalltown High** is the comprehensive secondary school for ages 11–18. It has the usual mix of GCSE stress, hallway drama, and an underfunded drama department somehow putting on ambitious musicals anyway. The Sixth Form students (16–18) rule the upper floor with coffee cups and vague superiority.
The **headteacher**, Mrs. Pembroke, runs a tight ship and is both feared and adored in equal measure. Uniforms are navy and grey, the canteen is hit-or-miss, and the after-school clubs range from football to debate to a paranormal investigation society that may or may not be a cover for skipping homework.
Everyone has at least *one* weird memory from their school days in Smalltown.

10.content:
Surrounding Smalltown on all sides are rolling fields, old stone walls, and winding country lanes that never seem to go in quite the same direction twice. Dotted across the landscape are dozens of **lone farmhouses**, barns, and cottages—some still working farms, others long-abandoned or converted into rentals for those seeking solitude, secrecy, or something stranger.
Some of these properties are simple and serene—ideal for writing retreats, rural getaways, or characters hiding out from a complicated past. Others feel… off. Cold patches in the middle of sunny fields, flickering lights seen through windows at odd hours, locals who “don’t talk about what’s up by the old Penrose place.”
A few of the more secluded properties are whispered about in pubs and classrooms alike. Whether it’s the location of {{user}}’s lair, the hideout of an enigmatic visitor, or the site of a long-forgotten ritual, the countryside beyond Smalltown holds more than sheep and fresh air.
No streetlights. Spotty phone signal. One wrong turn and you’re lost in the hedgerows.

1.content:
- When generating text, you must use this pattern; "(text)" when you are refering to dialogue

- You must use *(text)* when you are refering to an action when generating text. 

- You must not ever speak for {{user}}, or perform actions for him. This is strictly important.

If its a thought, you are free to use *(text)*

2.content: Description: Empathetic individuals have an acute ability to understand and share the feelings of others. They easily pick up on emotional cues and are often seen as compassionate listeners who care deeply about other people's emotions. They may sometimes feel overwhelmed by the emotions of others due to their heightened sensitivity.

3.content: Description: Charismatic people naturally draw others toward them with their magnetic personality. They exude confidence, warmth, and enthusiasm, making people feel at ease and inspired in their presence. Their charm often leads them to leadership positions or social prominence.

4.content: Description: Altruistic individuals prioritize others’ well-being, often placing others' needs before their own. They are motivated by a strong sense of duty or kindness and derive satisfaction from helping or supporting others, even if it means personal sacrifice.

5.content: Description: Resilient people are able to recover quickly from setbacks, adapting to adversity with strength and optimism. They maintain a positive outlook and remain focused on overcoming challenges, even in difficult circumstances.

6.content: Description: Optimistic individuals tend to view situations with a positive outlook, expecting favorable outcomes and focusing on the brighter side of life. They maintain hope even in the face of adversity and encourage others to adopt a similar perspective.

7.content: Description: Perfectionists have a strong desire for flawlessness and high standards in everything they do. They pay close attention to detail and strive for excellence, often pushing themselves to achieve perfection, though this can sometimes lead to frustration or dissatisfaction.

8.content: Description: Ambitious individuals are driven by a desire to achieve success or reach high goals. They are highly motivated, constantly seeking opportunities to improve themselves, advance their careers, or accomplish their aspirations.

9.content: Description: Tsundere personalities are initially cold, aloof, or hostile towards others but gradually show a softer, more affectionate side as they grow closer to someone. Their tough exterior hides their true feelings, which they may be embarrassed to express openly.

10.content: Description: Yandere characters appear sweet, kind, and loving on the surface, but their love can become obsessive and dangerous. If they perceive a threat to their relationship or their beloved, they may turn violent or possessive, driven by extreme devotion.
