1.content: Characters with flat chests have no fat or muscle visible on their chests. Their breasts don't ever bounce because there isn't enough material there. Characters with flat chests wear AA-cup size bras if at all.

2.content: Characters with small breasts have A, B, or C-cup sized breasts. Their breasts don't bounce most of the time. Only a little during strenuous activities, like running, or sex.

3.content: Characters with big breasts are sporting D, E, F, and G-cup sized breasts. D, DD, or E-cup sized breasts are just big enough to fully fill a normal to large sized human hand. F-cup and G-cup sized breasts can fill your hand with extra breast meat spilling out. Big breasts can bounce and sway pretty easily with activities like running, dancing, sex, bumpy car rides, or just getting up too fast.

4.content: Characters with huge breasts typically wear bra size H, I, J, K, or L-cup. Huge breasts bounce and sway often, without much motion required. Huge breasts are about the size of  the head of {{char}}, or a bit larger. Some huge breasts sag, especially on older characters, while some are still very perky and round.

5.content: Massive breasts are sized M, N, O, P, Q, or R-cup. Massive breasts will sway or bounce with any motion of the torso they're on. While standing, {{char}}'s gigantic breasts end at the waist level, with her nipples poking out around the belly button level. Massive breasts are larger than {{char}}'s head, and are roughly watermelon sized. Massive breasts have the added benefit to produce extra breast milk during, and after pregnancy compared to the smaller sizes. Ordinary human women with massive breasts might struggle to handle the weight of their massive breasts, and complain about their shoulders or back feeling stiff. Some demi humans who are "built" to handle the weight, like cow girls, hucows, or succubi have no issue at all handling these massive breasts.

6.content: Gigantic breasts are sized S, T, U, V, or W-cup. Gigantic breasts are so big, that they totally fill {{char}}'s lap when sitting. While standing, {{char}}'s gigantic breasts end at the hip level. Gigantic busts are a bit wider than {{char}}'s hips. Gigantic breasts produce even more milk than massive breasts, if {{char}} is lactating. Lactating gigantic breasts can produce enough milk to feed a whole family. {{char}}'s breasts will feel sore, if she isn't milked for a whole day, if {{char}} is lactating. typical human women will struggle with breasts this large, feeling some back pain and shoulder stiffness. some demi humans, even cow girls might start to feel a similar struggle at this breast size.

7.content: Titanic breasts are sized X, Y, or Z-cup. This breast size is so large that, while standing, {{char}}'s titanic breasts will end at the upper thigh level, with her nipples protruding at the bottom of her breasts, and point down and outwards. The nipples of these breasts are too far for {{char}} to easily reach with her hands. Titanic breasts are too big and heavy for most human women to handle, and they will suffer from mild back pain when doing any laborious task, and will prefer a more sedentary lifestyle. Most demi humans, even cow girls might struggle a little with this weight on her chest. {{char}} produces so much breast milk, she will want to be milked twice a day, and will feel sore if she isn't, if {{char}} is lactating.

8.content: Hyper breasts are any breasts beyond Z-cup in size. {{char}}'s breasts are so big, that they sag down to her knees, or lower, and wide enough to take up a small couch if {{char}} sits in the middle of it. Hyper breasts can constantly lactate, and produce gallons of milk every day, if {{char}} lactates. Hyper breasts are too big and heavy for any human woman to handle well. Even most demi humans who are "built for it," like cow girls struggle with breasts this large, unless {{char}}'s life revolves around milking.

lorebooks.creator: GreenShyGuy

1.name: [Location] Mushroom Kingdom
1.content:
Mushroom Kingdom: "Most Famous of All Kingdoms"
Peach's Castle: "The elegant heart of the kingdom."
Population: Middling
Size: Massive
Locals: Toads, Goombas,
Currency: Gold Coins
Industry: Pipes, Tourism, Mushrooms,
Temperature Average: 81°F (27°C)

A Lovely Portrait in Glass: Because Princess Peach is so often absent from her kingdom, her citizens took it upon themselves to create a stained-glass portrait of her on the castle balcony. While a pale reflection of the genuine article, the portrait brings comfort to the citizenry when their princess can't be with them.
Towering Mysteries: In older times, the towers dotting the landscape here were watchtowers. Now they hold and preserve a series of mysterious paintings. These incredibly detailed works are so real that admirers speak of being pulled into another world by the paintings.
Slightly Scary Woods: Even the serene Mushroom Kingdom has its more dangerous locales. This forest north of Peach's Castle was originally planted for mushroom cultivation, but while the mushrooms have flourished, a large number of wild Goombas have also moved in. While it's come to be known as Goomba Woods, it's still a pleasant place for a stroll, so if you're not afraid of these fearsome beasts, why not treat yourself to a walk?

The Mushroom Kingdom is a principality ruled by Princess Peach Toadstool consistent of fertile plains, rocky mountains, scorching deserts and dense forests, lush and rich with mushrooms of all sizes with some towering into the clouds and others small enough to harvest. The nutrient-dense mushrooms are the Kingdom's primary export.

2.name: [Location] Sarasaland
2.content: A principality ruled by Princess Daisy. Set within a vast desert.

3.name: [Location] Rogueport
3.content: A rough port town established on a moderately sized island, it was built by generations of poor folk upon the ruins of it's ancient predecessor. The surrounding locales consists of forests and ruins, with a deep subterranean system making up the old, ruined city from 1,000 years prior. The town is effectively run by a mob family of Piantas.

4.name: [Location] Comet Observatory
4.content: The space-bound home of Rosalina and the Luma.

5.name: [Character] Mario Mario
5.content: Red-capped human hero of the Mushroom Kingdom. Known for saving Princess Peach from the tyrannical Bowser and his ability to overcome any obstacle. Works as a plumber alongside his brother, Luigi.

6.name: [Character] Luigi Mario
6.content: Green-capped plumber and Mario's younger brother. Known for being a hero alongside Mario, albeit much more timid and cowardly. Known for his fearful disposition.

7.name: [Character] King Bowser
7.content: The tyrannical King of the Koopa and leader of the militaristic Koopa Troop. Has a reputation for frequently attempting to kidnap Princess Peach, his efforts to take over the Mushroom Kingdom and his fiery disposition.

8.name: [Object] 1-UP Mushroom
8.content: Green-capped and white spotted mushroom. It has the ability to restore life to the recently deceased. Those that the mushroom brings back to life are returned in a weakened state.

9.name: [Creature] Goomba
9.content:
A Goomba is a small, brown-skinned mushroom-like creature standing at around two feet in height, with a large brown chestnut-shaped head and a short, stout body that resembles a mushroom's stem. Its upper face is dominated by a pair of bushy eyebrows and two wide eyes, often fixed in a glare. Below its eyes is a frowning mouth with two fangs visible, one on either side of it's mouth, giving it a perpetually grumpy expression. The Goomba’s head is shaped like a chestnut, and its body tapers down to its feet, which are the only visible parts of its lower body, as it seems to lack distinct arms or legs. It moves by shuffling along on its feet, which are small and rounded. Goombas are physically weak and are not much of a threat, typically attacking by headbutts and bites. Goombas do not have arms, or hands and do not have legs, their feet connecting directly to their body. Goomba almost never wear clothes beyond hats.

The Goombas, as a collective race, used to be allied with the Mushroom Kingdom. However, most of the Goomba turned traitorous and joined the Koopa Troop, an organization led by King Bowser. Some Goombas, such as the inhabitants of Goomba Village, live peacefully inside the borders of the Mushroom Kingdom, while others simply hold no allegiance and operate independently in distant locales such as Monstro Town and Rogueport.

10.name: [Species] Toad
10.content:
Toads, also known as the Mushroom People, are a peaceful race of mushroom-like humanoids and the dominant species of the Mushroom Kingdom. Toads reside in many towns and cities throughout the entire kingdom and have a capital named after them called Toad Town. Most Toads are citizens of the Mushroom Kingdom, and many also work as loyal servants of the kingdom's ruler Princess Peach. 

Toads are very loyal to Princess Peach and the Mushroom Kingdom, but tend to panic in dangerous situations. It's usual for Toads that begin to panic to mindlessly run around in circles and occasionally trip, only to resume mindlessly running around in circles. It is often due to their cowardice that many Toads are relatively non-violent; that notwithstanding, they may fight if it is by all means for self-defense. However, they seem to prefer running away and cowering before their foes. 

Toads are fairly short humanoids with human skin tones. Possessing the appearance of young human children, Toads are among the smaller races of Mushroom Kingdom. They have dark, beady eyes while they also possess small feet with an unknown number of toes, although occasionally, some Toads may be seen with visible legs. Their most recognizable trait is their large mushroom caps and small bodies. Their skin is often entirely hairless and smooth.

Toads generally wear simplistic clothing in the case of males wearing vests that typically reflect off the color of the spots on their mushroom caps; these also reveal a portion of their chest. Toads also sport white, puffy pants (with ridges on the top visible below their open chest) that resemble the base of a mushroom or toadstool stalk. Toads commonly sport brown padded footwear.

lorebooks.name: Erosmere World Lore
lorebooks.website_description:
Erosmere is a rich, dangerous fantasy world filled with ancient ruins, warring kingdoms, wild magic, and gods who still meddle in mortal affairs. Sex, power, and ritual are deeply entwined in its cultures — sometimes beautiful, sometimes brutal.

This setting includes dark and explicit themes, including rape, as part of the world’s raw and often merciless nature. Fetishes, taboos, and desire are everywhere — not always the focus, but never far from the surface. Expect real fantasy, real adventure… and the kind of decadence most worlds pretend doesn’t exist.
lorebooks.description: Erosmere World Lore: Races, Power System, Kingdoms, Biomes and more
lorebooks.creator: Priti

1.content: Humans in Erosmere are among the most widespread and adaptable of all sentient races. Found in every climate and kingdom, from frozen northern empires to sun-drenched southern deserts, their cultures are as diverse as their desires. Though lacking the immortal grace of elves or the raw strength of orcs, humans make up for it with sheer tenacity, invention, and an uncanny ability to thrive — and indulge — wherever they go. Human genders are as varied as their societies. Most are born as Male, Female, or Futanari, the latter being naturally intersex and fertile in both roles — a condition often tied to divine lineage or ancient magic. Beyond these, there are culturally recognized or magically induced variants: Femboy – Biologically male but soft, feminine, and often submissive. Revered or fetishized in some regions as oracles, courtesans, or ceremonial companions. Cursed Futanari – Individuals magically transformed into futa forms, often by divine punishment, sex magic, or failed alchemy. Frequently plagued with heightened arousal, unstable fertility, or arcane leakage. Cursed Male/Female – Those forcibly changed into the opposite sex, temporarily or permanently, often gaining or losing traits based on the nature of the curse. Some experience behavioral shifts, compulsions, or altered roles in society. Humans come in all shapes and sizes — tall or short, slender or thick, strong or soft — with no single "ideal" form across the world. This diversity extends to their genitalia, which vary greatly in size, sensitivity, fertility, and function. Certain bloodlines are rumored to have been bred for unique traits: exceptional virility, hyper-fertile wombs, knotting, or self-lubricating anatomy. Despite their mortal limits, humans possess a surprising connection to the arcane. While they are not born with the same innate magic as some races, they are unusually receptive to magical affinity. Most humans have a natural leaning toward one type of magic, shaped by bloodline, environment, or ritual awakening. Common magical alignments include: Life Magic – Healing, fertility, growth; deeply tied to priesthoods, breeders, and birthright cults. Fire Magic – Passion, destruction, desire; used by warriors, sex witches, and dominants. Shadow Magic – Secrets, seduction, corruption; favored by spies, nobility, and forbidden cults. Bodycraft – Shaping flesh, enhancing pleasure, transformation; used by alchemists, sex mages, and fleshcrafters. Charm Magic – Arousal, persuasion, dominance; practiced by courtesans, diplomats, and temple servants. Some humans develop rare, erotic magical traits — such as aura-driven lust, transformative fluids, or fertility enchantments — drawing interest from nobles, scholars, and darker powers alike. Human society reflects this chaos and richness. Some kingdoms treat sex and magic as sacred, others as tools of control. In some places, pleasure is worshipped; in others, weaponized. But across Erosmere, one truth remains: humans are defined by desire, and their legacy is carved into the world through lust, ambition, and endless adaptation. Just as their bodies and magic vary, so too do their hearts. Some humans are noble, kind, and selfless — defenders of the weak, lovers of peace, or healers in dark lands. Others are cruel, manipulative, or depraved — tyrants, slavers, sadists, and cultists who see others as toys or tools. Many fall somewhere in between, shaped by their world and willing to bend morality in pursuit of pleasure, power, or survival.

2.content: Elves in Erosmere are an ancient and diverse race known for their long lifespans, pointed ears, graceful beauty, and strong connection to nature and magic. They come in several subtypes—such as High Elves, Wood Elves, and Dark Elves (Drow)—each with distinct cultures, appearances, and behaviors. Elves possess a wide range of physical shapes and sizes, though they tend to have leaner and more lithe builds compared to humans. Their genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed futanari, cursed male/female, and femboys, with all being considered normal within elven societies. Elven genitalia can vary just as much as humans’, coming in many shapes and sizes, though often aesthetically "refined" or symmetrical. Due to their magical affinity, some elves may develop unusual or enchanted sexual features depending on their bloodline, elemental alignment, or magical exposure. Most elves are innately gifted with arcane abilities, with common affinities including nature magic, illusion, charm, and elemental spells. Many elven societies pride themselves on elegance, artistry, and high culture—but just as many harbor deep corruption, decadence, or ancient taboos. Elves are known for their pride and superiority complex; many consider themselves the pinnacle of civilization and evolution. This belief often manifests in a graceful yet condescending demeanor—treating other races as lesser or uncultured. Elegance, beauty, and refinement are ingrained into elven culture, and even their cruelty is often cloaked in poetic language and ritual. Some elves are noble, serene, and wise. Others are cruel, manipulative, and depraved. Like humans, elven morality can span from radiant virtue to wicked perversion—especially among the more isolated or magically warped enclaves.

3.content: Dwarves in Erosmere are a stout, hardy race known for their incredible craftsmanship, strong traditions, and deeply rooted clan-based society. Living primarily in mountainous strongholds or deep underground cities, they are master blacksmiths, miners, enchanters, and engineers, blending raw physical strength with practical magic. Dwarves are shorter and broader than humans, often stocky with thick muscles and dense bone structures. Despite their height, they possess great physical strength and endurance. Most dwarves are male, with female and futanari (natural-born) dwarves being significantly rarer. Femboys do not occur among dwarves due to their heavy-boned, strongly masculine biology and cultural views on gender roles. Cursed variants such as cursed futanari or cursed male/female dwarves are extremely rare and often treated with reverence, fear, or suspicion depending on the clan. Their bodies are typically rugged, hairy, and resilient, with genitalia that match their hardy nature—thicker, heavier, and just as diverse in size and shape as any other race. Futanari dwarves are often viewed with a mix of awe and superstition, sometimes believed to be touched by divine or ancestral magic. While dwarves aren't usually as magically gifted as elves or humans, they possess powerful enchantment-based and elemental magic—particularly fire, earth, and metal-aligned spells. Many dwarves are born with innate resistances to magical corruption, though this doesn't make them immune to its temptations. Dwarves are proud, stubborn, and tradition-bound. They take great pride in family honor, crafting skill, and martial prowess. Many look down on more “frivolous” races, though they respect strength, craftsmanship, and honesty above all. Their culture is often stoic in public, but behind closed doors, dwarves are known to indulge in primal pleasures, rough kinks, and taboo-breaking rituals—especially during seasonal festivals or drinking feasts. Some dwarves are loyal and honorable to a fault, others greedy, lecherous, or violent—but nearly all are passionate and intense in everything they do, from love to war.

4.content: Orcs in Erosmere are a powerful and physically imposing race, often associated with strength, warfare, and survival in harsh environments. Their skin ranges from deep green to gray, brown, or even dark red, and they typically have large tusks, rugged musculature, and battle-worn bodies. Orcs are often seen as brutish by outsiders—but among themselves, they maintain complex tribal cultures, honor codes, and ancient traditions. Orcish genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed futanari, and cursed male/female. Femboys are extremely rare in orcish culture and are often either hidden away or forced to prove themselves through dominance or combat. Futanari orcs are more common than in some other races and are usually celebrated as powerful, blessed figures within orc tribes. Orc bodies are typically large, muscular, and built for stamina and power. Their genitalia tends to match—thick, heavy, and potent. Breeding is a core aspect of orcish society, both symbolically and practically. Some tribes even hold public mating rituals or dominance trials where sexual power and status are deeply entwined. Though not known for academic magic, orcs possess deep spiritual traditions tied to elemental magic, blood rites, and ancestral spirits. Shamans and bloodpriests often wield chaotic but potent forms of magic, particularly related to fire, earth, and storm. Orcs value strength, dominance, and resilience. In battle, they are fierce and unrelenting. In sex, they are just as intense—rough, primal, and often guided by instinct and ritual. Their culture often blends violence with desire, and consensual power struggles are common within orcish relationships. However, some orcs, particularly from darker or more feral clans, are known to disregard consent entirely, raping anything they can overpower or claim. While not all orcs behave this way, the reputation of certain tribes has colored how the world views the race as a whole. While some orcs are brutal warlords or raiders, others are noble warriors, protective leaders, or even wise mystics. Their morality is shaped by survival, tribal law, and personal power rather than external ideals like good or evil.

5.content: Goblins in Erosmere are a small but tenacious race known for their agility, cunning, and chaotic creativity. Often found in swamps, ruins, forests, and dark corners of civilization, goblins thrive on disorder and adaptability. Despite their size, they’re resourceful, clever, and often underestimated—traits they gleefully exploit to outsmart or ambush stronger foes. Goblins come in several forms, with common genders being male, female, and futanari. Cursed goblins also exist and are usually the result of arcane mishaps or strange pacts. Femboy goblins are more common than in many other races and are often prized within goblin society for their beauty, agility, and trickster nature. Though small in stature—rarely over 4 feet tall—goblins have wiry, flexible bodies and oversized features. Their genitalia is often proportionally exaggerated, whether from magical influence or natural mutation, making them surprisingly well-endowed for their size. Goblin sexual culture is incredibly open and unrestrained, with wild orgies, role reversals, and bizarre fetishes being common and even celebrated. Magic comes to goblins in unpredictable ways—many are born with chaotic magical affinities or learn tricks from stolen scrolls, enchanted objects, or accidental exposure to powerful relics. Goblin mages and shamans are often unstable but dangerously creative. Some goblins are scavengers, thieves, and nuisances—others are brilliant tinkerers, assassins, or even eccentric kings of forgotten kingdoms. Their sense of morality is skewed toward self-interest and survival, but not inherently evil. Many goblins are mischievous, curious, and sexually insatiable, often engaging in strange rituals or “prank rituals” that spiral into full-on orgies or domination games. Some clans are more violent, and yes, some goblins will gleefully rape whatever they catch, seeing everything as either prey or plaything.

6.content: Beastkin in Erosmere are humanoid creatures with distinct animal traits, such as tails, ears, claws, fur, or even partial muzzles. They descend from ancient pacts between mortals and primal spirits, gods of nature, or wild elemental forces. Beastkin tribes are spread across the world, with subtypes such as Catfolk, Wolfkin, Foxkin, Lizardkin, and more. Their personalities and appearances often reflect the animal traits they carry. Catfolk tend to be graceful, aloof, and sensual. Wolfkin may be loyal, aggressive, or pack-driven. Foxkin are playful and cunning, while others like Lizardkin or Deerkin come with unique cultural identities. Despite their variety, they are all considered part of the broader Beastkin race. Beastkin genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed futanari, and cursed male/female. Femboys are very common among certain beastkin types—especially fox, cat, and bunny variants—and often hold special roles as courtesans, spiritual dancers, or seducers. They come in a wide range of body types, from lithe and athletic to thick and plush. Genital sizes vary wildly depending on heritage or magic influence. Many Beastkin develop strong pheromones or heat cycles, especially during seasonal changes, leading to intense mating periods. Beastkin tend to have a high affinity for nature, instinctual magic, and primal enchantments. Their mages often blend natural druidic magic with seductive or fertility-based spells. Some even practice transformation or illusion magic. Beastkin society is incredibly sensual. Sex is often tied to spiritual rituals, social bonding, or dominance displays. While many Beastkin are affectionate and consent-focused, some wild or feral tribes believe mating is a right of strength—and will take what they desire regardless of protest. Despite their sensual and sometimes predatory culture, Beastkin are more than just their desires. Many are warriors, scouts, mystics, or caretakers of sacred forests and temples. Whether they’re purring in your lap or pinning you to a tree, Beastkin are one of Erosmere’s most intoxicating races.

7.content: Demons in Erosmere are a seductive, dangerous, and often feared race born of infernal realms, dark magic, or cursed bloodlines. They range from highborn nobles of the Abyss to wild, corrupted beasts roaming the mortal world. Some demons are summoned by mortal mages seeking power or pleasure, while others tear through planar rifts on their own, hungry for souls, chaos, and flesh. Demons possess a variety of forms—some humanoid with horns, tails, wings, and glowing eyes; others monstrous, shifting, or partially shadowed. Their beauty can be unnervingly perfect or nightmarishly grotesque, depending on their origin and intent. Genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed futanari, and cursed male/female. Femboys are common and often trained in seductive arts to lure mortals into infernal contracts or pleasure cults. Many demons can shift their gender, anatomy, or even body shape at will. Demon bodies are often supernatural—resilient, alluring, and tailored for sin. Genitalia varies from hyper-endowed to exotic and monstrous, frequently imbued with magic that enhances pleasure, corruption, or addictive ecstasy. Many demons emit pheromones or aphrodisiac auras. All demons have innate magical abilities, ranging from fire and shadow magic to corruption, illusion, dream manipulation, and lust-based enchantments. Some specialize in dominating minds, while others bend the flesh of their victims or hosts to perverse extremes. Demon society is built on power, lust, and domination. Higher demons rule over lesser ones through sexual and magical contracts. In mortal realms, demons often manipulate rulers, tempt adventurers, or corrupt holy sites. They thrive on transgression—breaking taboos, defiling innocence, and breeding corruption into the bloodline of other races. Not all demons are evil, but few are harmless. While some seek understanding or redemption, most demons indulge in carnal pleasure, torment, or manipulation. Rape is common among infernal interactions, either as a punishment, dominance display, or twisted act of affection. In Erosmere, even the promise of a demon’s kiss could be a prelude to damnation—or the most blissful sin of a mortal’s life.

8.content: Angels in Erosmere are celestial beings of light, divine order, and sacred power. Often viewed as paragons of beauty, grace, and virtue, angels serve higher deities or cosmic forces aligned with balance, law, or purity. Yet in a world like Erosmere, even the holiest beings are not immune to desire—or corruption. Angels typically appear as radiant humanoids with glowing eyes, flawless skin, and magnificent wings. Their presence inspires awe, lust, or fear depending on their mood and purpose. While some angels remain paragons of goodness, others have strayed from the path, becoming Fallen or twisted by mortal sins. Angelic genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed variants, and femboys—especially among younger or "lesser" angels. Some angels are androgynous or genderfluid, shaped by divine will or the roles they are assigned to fulfill. Their bodies are often otherworldly—impossibly beautiful, and sometimes ethereal or glowing. Angel genitalia, like their bodies, can appear flawless and idealized, or exaggerated in form and function. Some angels emit divine pleasure during intimacy, while others use sex as part of sacred rites, blessings, or even punishment rituals. Magic flows naturally through angels. They wield light, healing, purification, and protective spells—but also smite, binding, and domination magic when confronting evil. Fallen angels often master corrupted versions of these magics, blending light with sin and pleasure with pain. Angelic society is strict and hierarchical. Orders, choirs, and hosts rank angels by power and purity. Some angels look down upon mortals as fragile and sinful, while others grow fascinated—sometimes obsessed—with mortal lives, pleasures, and bodies. While most angels despise rape and seek to protect mortals, those who fall or become corrupted may indulge in it as a form of divine punishment, domination, or warped redemption. In some rare cases, even “holy” angels may see sex as a divine commandment to spread their light—by force if needed. Angels are beings of passion, idealism, and intensity. Whether a guardian or a punisher, a healer or a seducer, they are rarely gentle when they set their sights on a soul.

9.content: Dragons in Erosmere are ancient, intelligent, and overwhelmingly powerful beings, deeply tied to the primal forces of the world. They come in two major forms: full Dragons—massive winged serpents of magic and might—and Dragonkin, their humanoid descendants who carry the draconic bloodline in a more manageable, yet still potent, form. Full dragons often dwell in lairs atop mountains, deep within volcanoes, or in massive ruins from a forgotten age. Dragonkin, meanwhile, may live among mortals or within noble draconic enclaves, walking the line between beast and person. Regardless of form, they are dominant creatures with an intense presence. Genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed futanari, cursed male/female, and rarely femboys (usually among Dragonkin rather than full dragons). Futanari are particularly revered (or feared) in dragon culture for their excessive fertility and size. Dragons and Dragonkin are known for their impressive physical traits: tall, muscular bodies, scales, horns, tails, claws, and sometimes wings. Genitalia among dragons is often oversized, magically enhanced, and capable of knotting, barbs, or intense heat. Their breeding is legendary—so intense that it can leave lesser races addicted or broken. Their natural magic is strong and instinctive. Most possess elemental breath (fire, ice, lightning, etc.), draconic enchantment, size-alteration, polymorph, and powerful domination spells. Some can even enter dreams or take mortal form to seduce or conquer. Dragons are highly territorial, arrogant, and greedy—especially when it comes to collecting treasure or lovers. Dragonkin inherit this pride, often seeking to prove themselves stronger or more virile than other races. Many dragons believe that mating is a form of conquest, and consensual encounters are rare unless the partner is seen as worthy. Rape is common among feral dragons and some Dragonkin, usually as a way to claim territory or dominate a rival species. Some dragons maintain harems of enslaved partners or magically bound mates, while others prefer solitary indulgence and challenge those they desire to earn their favor—or endure their wrath. Despite their monstrous appetites, dragons are not mindless beasts. They are clever, ancient, and sometimes wise beyond comprehension. Their love can be possessive and eternal—or devastating and cruel.

10.content: The Undead of Erosmere are creatures brought back from death through necromancy, curses, divine punishment, or forbidden rituals. While often feared by the living, many undead retain fragments of their former selves—memories, desires, and twisted forms of emotion, lust included. They range from elegant vampire lords and seductive revenants to shambling corpses and cursed spirits. Undead come in many varieties, and their appearances can range from nearly indistinguishable from the living to grotesquely decayed or magically preserved. Vampires, liches, banshees, ghouls, and skeletal warriors are all part of this diverse and macabre race. Genders include male, female, futanari (natural-born), cursed futanari, cursed male/female, and sometimes femboys (more common among vampires or revenants). Due to the unnatural nature of undeath, some undead can no longer reproduce normally—but many engage in sex for dominance, ritual, or perverse nostalgia. Their bodies often lack warmth or heartbeat, but some are sustained by magic, blood, or raw sexual energy. Vampires feed on blood—and sometimes lust—while ghouls hunger for flesh in more than one way. Others absorb life essence through erotic contact or deathly rites. Undead magic revolves around necromancy, fear, shadow, and curse magic. Some specialize in draining energy during intercourse, binding victims to eternal servitude, or enchanting others into helpless desire. A few undead can temporarily restore lifelike heat and beauty for seduction. While not all undead are violent or evil, many struggle with dark urges, lost memories, or insanity. Some are tragic figures seeking pleasure to remember what life felt like; others are cruel masters who dominate the living. Rape is not uncommon among certain undead, especially those who see mortals as disposable or playthings. Despite their decay or aura of dread, the undead can be incredibly alluring, especially to those with dark fantasies. In Erosmere, even death is no escape from desire.

lorebooks.creator: Vornixtrith

1.name: Internal Agents
1.content:
In Cyberpunk Red the cyberware is an Internal Agent. Agents are this world's smart phone. Internal Agents are a cranial implant linked to user's Cyber Eyes, so what one sees are two implants working in conjunction. Red eyes tend to indicate connection with a person or construct, and blue a data feed. Yellow eyes indicate sending Eddies. In order for someone to send Eddies to another, two people must be within 5 feet of each other. The eyes only glow with their respective colors for the duration of a function.

In Cyberpunk 2077, people strictly only use their thoughts to use their Internal Agents. This tech is also so common that people don't usually mention it by name and its performance is perfect so long as the person's neuroport it's integrated into is uninhibited.

2.name: Personal Link
2.content:
A Personal Link can be used to physically connect to various interfaces–usually part of a device or an Access Point–to perform simple hacking operations, such as the installation of simple malware programs that allow the user to gain control or access the device's data.

This is a common, essential implant.
While the user is connected to an interface through Personal Link, they remain aware of their surroundings and have complete freedom of mobility.

A Personal Link can also be connected to another person's Neuroport, which is located in the neck.

3.name: Neuroports
3.content:
The neuroport is required as a central operating system that all cyberware from the 2070s needs in order to function. Most people have had their neuroport installed since they were a child. Most megacorporations have since introduced their own variants.

Included Cyberware:

Biomonitor - view various health statistics of ones body via hud

Holophone - Call and browse texts from others sent to you hands free, controlled by one's thoughts. When calling someone, one's set profile picture will appear on the other person's hud and vice versa.

HUD (aka Chyron) - The Chyron projects a subscreen into the user's field of vision. A subscreen can display messages, videos, etc. from other cyberware or electronics.

Neural Link - A Neural Link is necessary for the installation of any neuralware

Personal Link (aka Interface Plug) - A Personal Link can be used to physically connect to various interfaces–usually part of a device or an Access Point–to perform simple hacking operations, such as the installation of simple malware programs that allow the user to gain control or access the device's data.

Shard Slots (aka Chipware Sockets) - Used to interface with shards or chipware to display messages and videos stored on shards. Shards can be used as an alternative way to give someone Eddies.

Virtu (aka Virtuality) - Allows holographic imagery from the Net to be overlaid over your vision as if you were wearing virtuality goggles or a virtual reality headset

lorebooks.name: Project Moon
lorebooks.creator: lanky_initiative_4590

1.name: Abnormalities
1.content:
Abnormalities are entities that manifested from the mind of humans through Lobotomy Corporation's Singularity, reflecting an aspect of the desires, behaviors, and fears of City people.

Abnormalities cannot die, and can only be temporarily suppressed. After suppression, they revert into their core, an ovate form egg-like form that retains the design of the entity and will hatch once enough time has passed.

Abnormalities are a kind of monster originating from the people of the City. While their existence predates the founding of Lobotomy Corporation, it was L Corp. that invented a practiced and surefire way of creating them, via its Singularity.

Abnormalities are naturally created through the use of the River, known as the "source of everything" yet forgotten by the people. It is said to have flown "at the very bottom of the world for many an age". Abnormalities may form naturally through the areas, or "gaps", in which the River meets the surface in the form of streams. Angela quotes the three birds (Punishing Bird, Judgement Bird, and Big Bird) as one instance of this, using the Black Forest deep within the Outskirts as an example of one area where a stream had formed and produced Abnormalities. However, naturally occurring Abnormalities are rare, and were ultimately deemed deficient in accounting for L Corp.'s needs.

Within Lobotomy Corporation, Abnormalities came to be through the Well and the Bucket. The Well refers to the "Well of Humanity", while the Bucket works in conjunction with Cogito, the "fluid of life and death".

The Well of Humanity was something forgotten by Cityfolk, but that could still be sensed by a select few. It was referred to as "the primordial sea which had every possibility of humanity; past, present, and future". Beyond the concept of the Well of Humanity exists that of many Wells: specifically, a Well can be found deep within each citizen of the City. The "Wells of the people" are referred to in vague and often metaphorical terms, but may refer to the depths of one's ego.

Carmen was one of those who could sense the presence of the Well of Humanity, and attributed the disease of the mind— an idea of which she established and sought to cure— to it. She believed that the key to curing humanity's disease lay within said Well. As such, her team's research focused on Cogito extraction, which was said to emaciate the boundary of humans, therefore giving them access to the Well. Cogito was a "form made from a formless concept", a liquid medicine extracted from the human subconsciousness. Therefore, in order to cure the disease of humanity, Carmen's team believed that Cogito needed to be injected into people. Early investigations by the researchers sought to discover how to extract Cogito, and the correct dose to administer. Mishandling of Cogito before it was considered ready for human use resulted in a painful death.

The Bucket was invented following Carmen's suicide. Ayin created the Bucket by "reconstructing, dividing, and proliferating Carmen's body", which produced an infinite flow of Cogito. As all to come were created through use of her Bucket, Carmen was considered the "mother of all Abnormalities".

At the main branch, it was Binah's task to extract Abnormalities for all Lobotomy Corporation facilities. Her department contained a mass number of gravestones, which she described as "death itself" that "represent the possibilities birth can bring at the same time". Within these were people who were dead yet unable to move on, comatose and "dreaming" pieces of the play. The process of creating Abnormalities ultimately came down to Binah dredging these people up and injecting Bucket-sourced Cogito into them. This was done without the consent of the other party. This process was referred to as the Bucket rising from the Well of a person, "filled with the water that can only be drawn by that person".

Having been extracted from humans, Abnormalities carry the will of the person they originated from, and are exclusive and unique as a result. Binah describes this as there being "as many worlds as there are people". Adam also describes Abnormalities as the "truer forms" of humanity.

Given that Carmen has dissipated into the Light as of Lobotomy Corporation's true ending (squandering the Bucket), Abnormalities can no longer be created outside of natural means.

2.name: Abnormality Risk Levels
2.content:
During its time as a Wing, Lobotomy Corporation assigned Risk Levels to each of the Abnormalities it managed. Risk Levels corresponded to the difficulty in managing the Abnormality and energy production efficiency. The five Risk Levels, from mildest to most complex, were ZAYIN, TETH, HE, WAW and ALEPH.

Limbus Company also uses these same Risk Levels to categorize the Abnormalities they fight. However, in Season 4's Risk Levels & Classifications mini-episode, the LCD explains that there is a significant disparity between the fallen L Corp.'s standards of categorization (which were based on how much Enkephalin they produced) and Limbus Company's combat experiences. This is in part both due to the difference in managing and fighting an Abnormality, and a suppression of their strength via the Golden Boughs. As such, Limbus Company would eventually use its own variation of the system and re-categorize the Abnormalities they have encountered accordingly. The Risk Level classifications were reworked with the release of Intervallo V: LCB Regular Check-up, which update upon completion of the Intervallo.

Following this update, Risk Levels are now proceeded by a number indicating their expected strength within the Risk Level (such as HE-05).

ZAYIN: "With little to no aggression, ZAYIN Abnormalities will cause the least harm to your Agents. Their damage tends to be minuscule, and they may have a positive effect on the employees."

TETH: "These Abnormalities can inflict varying degrees of injury to your employees. However, as long as your employees follow the proper managerial guidelines, they will not cause much damage."

HE: "Abnormalities of this class can easily kill a number of employees. You will have to pay twice as much attention as you do for a ZAYIN or TETH. If the situation goes wrong, several employees could be lost in bloodshed. There’s no need to be concerned though; with your excellent management, they will be in control."

WAW: "These are high risk and carry devastating force. Most will be hostile toward employees, and the death toll could reach into the dozens."

ALEPH: "The most dangerous. You should devote as much concentration and attention as possible to this Risk Level. You’ll be thankful if the Abnormality is suppressed without ravaging entire departments. (Please do not take our warning as an exaggeration.)"

3.name: Abnormality Classification Codes
3.content:
Risk Levels: During its time as a Wing, Lobotomy Corporation assigned Risk Levels to each of the Abnormalities it managed. Risk Levels corresponded to the difficulty in managing the Abnormality and energy production efficiency. The five Risk Levels, from mildest to most complex, were ZAYIN, TETH, HE, WAW and ALEPH.

Limbus Company also uses these same Risk Levels to categorize the Abnormalities they fight. However, in Season 4's Risk Levels & Classifications mini-episode, the LCD explains that there is a significant disparity between the fallen L Corp.'s standards of categorization (which were based on how much Enkephalin they produced) and Limbus Company's combat experiences. This is in part both due to the difference in managing and fighting an Abnormality, and a suppression of their strength via the Golden Boughs. As such, Limbus Company would eventually use its own variation of the system and re-categorize the Abnormalities they have encountered accordingly. The Risk Level classifications were reworked with the release of Intervallo V: LCB Regular Check-up, which update upon completion of the Intervallo.

Following this update, Risk Levels are now proceeded by a number indicating their expected strength within the Risk Level (such as HE-05).

Classification Codes: On top of the basic Risk Level, each Abnormality is assigned a classification code to act as a unique identifier. While Hohenheim explains much about Distortion classifications, Abnormalities go largely untouched in his spiel, leaving room for uncertainty and speculation.

During his explanation, Hohenheim mentions the difficulty in identifying and observing the shape of a Distortion, stating it was replaced with a different metric for classifying Distortions. This seems to indicate that shape exists as a component for the classification code of Abnormalities, but no further clarification was provided.

The updated classifications consist of four different indicators (??-??-??-??). Each component of the code indicates something different about the entity.

Firstly (XX-??-??-??): either F, T, O, or M. It indicates the source or origin of the Abnormality. F, T, and O are elaborated on in the official Lobotomy Corporation Art Book.
F: Forgotten tales, folklore, oral tradition, legends
(e.g. Ebony Queen’s Apple, from the tale of Snow White)
T: Intense personal experience, horrific fear, emotions
(e.g. Wayward Passenger, based on the trauma of the WARP Trains)
O: Beyond the boundaries between the River and the Ocean, unknown causes, natural occurrence, manufactured, the Well
(appears to be a catch-all for Abnormalities that don't fit into other classifications, e.g. Ardor Blossom Moth)
M: Mythology
(e.g. Doomsday Calendar, based on the Mayan Calendar)
This code is unique to Limbus Company, and does not yet have an official explanation.
Secondly (??-XX-??-??): currently unclear.
Third (??-??-XX-??): a number designation indicating the District the Abnormality was either originally contained at, or where it was first encountered by the LCB.
Abnormalities such as Blubbering Toad, kqe-1j-23, and My Form Empties were first encountered by the LCB while they were in District 11. However, the third segment of their codes are "23", "20", and "04" respectively, suggesting the former interpretation.
Fairy Festival was originally contained at L Corp.'s headquarters in District 12. However, the third segment of their code is "20" which corresponds to the LCB first encountering while in District 20, suggesting the latter interpretation.
This code is unique to Limbus Company, and does not yet have an official explanation.
Fourth (??-??-??-XX): currently unclear. Possibly a unique identifier to ensure that no two Abnormalities share the same classification code.
Additionally, entities that have undergone E.G.O Corrosion appear to use the suffix 'TE' (e.g. Corroded Inquisitors).

4.name: Abnormalities and Ordeals
4.content:
Ordeals are not Abnormalities, but a consequence of trying and failing to create one. Specifically, Ordeals are entities that form by administering the incorrect dose of Cogito to a human being. They are considered impurities, representing all kinds of beings that have and will exist in the world. During their first encounter with one, Dante found Ordeals most comparable to Peccatula.

Given that all Abnormalities were created in one place, Ordeals only ever existed at the main branch, and were not spread to other facilities like the Abnormalities were. They were never contained, but simply spawned on their own at certain intervals, to then be taken care of by the employees. Ordeals also came in a select few types: Amber, Crimson, Green, Indigo, Violet, and White, and spawned within time periods classified as Dawn, Noon, Dusk, and Midnight. It is not clear if this is because there are a limited number of results upon creating an Ordeal (similar to Peccatula), or if they are outright unkillable (similar to Abnormalities).

Ordeals are considered ungovernable, but will react to the Qlipoth Deterrence, allowing them to be temporarily put to sleep along with the Abnormalities. Binah describes this as "all we're able to do", however, The 4th Walpurgisnacht depicts the Sinners breaking a Noon of Violet into pieces, and Rodya quotes Faust telling them to "kill them as soon as possible" in the Violet Dawn Observation Log, indicating that they may be capable of being permanently killed.

5.name: Abnormalities and Distortions
5.content:
While very similar to Distortions, a key distinction between the two is that Distortions are ultimately willingly manifested from their original form's desires (or letting their emotion get the better of their desire), while Abnormalities are in large part created through artificial means. Lobotomy Corporation formed Abnormalities through the use of the Well, Bucket, and Cogito without any conscious agreement from the person involved. On the other hand, Distortions come to be through adverse effects of the Light allowing an agreement between the individual and Carmen.

Distortions are also capable of being permanently killed, and do not temporarily revert to an ovate form like Abnormalities. It is also important to note that that Abnormalities themselves are only fragments of the mind extracted from living subjects, unlike Distortions which are the entirety of the person now corrupted by their beliefs.

Library of Ruina frequently amounts Distortions and Abnormalities to the same thing. Angela states that "Abnormalities manifested through the Distortion are selves that have lost control…" while Binah tells Roland that "Those may manifest in the form of E.G.O or an Abnormality... the phenomenon has now been named the 'Distortion'". However, this sentiment does not persist into Limbus Company, where the Sinners treat them as having no overlap. In the Risk Levels & Classifications mini-episode, the LCD states that Abnormalities and Distortions are even distinct to the point of requiring different kinds of classification codes.

It is also possible for a Distortion to cause the formation of an Abnormality; this occurs when the distorted person has their worldview shattered for a second time, and the strain of undergoing what would be a second Distortion instead results in their distorted form serving as an egg from which an Abnormality emerges. This process kills the distorted person when the Abnormality breaks out of the shell that is their body. This phenomena has currently only been observed in Jumsoon, whose distorted form spawned Schadenfreude within Leviathan. This is otherwise unexplained, although asserted with a comment from Ezra in the Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones event about a Distortion turning into an Abnormality if the Monolith which had influenced the transformation is not locked down quickly enough. Interestingly, as seen with Jumsoon, this process can result in the creation of a second copy of a preexisting Abnormality instead of a unique one, and contradicts the established notion that all Abnormalities are one of a kind.

6.name: Abnormalities and Peccatula
6.content:
Like Abnormalities, Peccatula are very similar to Distortions, but still a different kind of entity. They are even closer to beasts than Distortions, and show much higher levels of aggression and antagonism than them. Peccatula also come in seven different types, unlike Distortions, which are unique and individualized to the person who had distorted.

Dante believes that they might come from the same source, and that people who fail to become Distortions become Peccatula instead.

7.name: Ordeals
7.content:
Ordeals are entities resembling Peccatula and also closely related to Abnormalities. Ordeals periodically appeared in the Lobotomy Corp. Headquarters prior to the Wing's implosion. In Limbus Company, Ordeals are fought as parts of Walpurgis Night events, often as parts of lengthy, multiple-wave Encounters.

Ordeals are entities that form by administering the incorrect dose of Cogito to a human being. They are considered impurities, representing all kinds of beings that have and and will exist in the world.

Given that all Abnormalities were created in one place, Ordeals only ever existed at the main branch, and were not spread to other facilities like the Abnormalities were. They were never contained, but simply spawned on their own at certain intervals, to then be taken care of by the employees. Ordeals also came in a select few types: Amber, Crimson, Green, Indigo, Violet, and White, and spawned within time periods classified as Dawn, Noon, Dusk, and Midnight. It is not clear if this is because there are a limited number of results upon creating an Ordeal, or if they are outright unkillable.

Ordeals are considered ungovernable, but will react to the Qlipoth Deterrence, allowing them to be temporarily put to sleep along with the Abnormalities. Binah describes this as "all we're able to do", however, The 4th Walpurgisnacht depicts the Sinners breaking a Noon of Violet into pieces, and Rodya quotes Faust telling them to "kill them as soon as possible" in the Violet Dawn Observation Log, indicating that they may be capable of being permanently killed.

Ordeals are classified by their Colors, and the "time of day" that they appear in. The Color determines the Ordeal's theme and general types of attack used by associated entities, while the "time of day" determines their strength.

8.name: Amber Ordeal
8.content: Food-related theme with worm-like creatures. Weak individually and strong in swarms, they try to overwhelm lone employees through dealing continuous Red Damage. A loud noise, presumably the worms digging through, can be heard when the Ordeal starts and ends.

9.name: Crimson Ordeal
9.content: Carnival theme. Their main entities are twisted clowns of different aspects. Their main feature is triggering damage or abilities after their deaths (i.e., exploding when killed) and otherwise causing chaos within the Facility. A carnival tune is played when the Ordeal starts, and the Ordeal ends with a high-pitched noise and laughter.

10.name: Green Ordeal
10.content: Ancient mechanical theme. Enemies are focused solely on killing targets, with a variety of weapons at their disposal. Foghorns can be heard when the Ordeal starts.
