lorebooks.name: Thorne Setting
lorebooks.description: General setting & information
lorebooks.creator: myca_green

1.content:
Venreth – The Heart of Shadows

Venreth, the capital city of the kingdom, is a place of stark contrasts. Its skyline is dominated by soaring marble spires and gilded towers, gleaming in the sunlight, yet shadowed alleyways and winding streets whisper of secrets that no noble court would dare admit. The city hums with life at every hour: merchants haggle in crowded bazaars, street performers entertain in open squares, and courtiers move like chess pieces within the ornate palace walls.

Despite its beauty, Venreth is a city of tension. Power is measured not only in gold but in influence, connections, and whispered threats. The nobility maintains a fragile balance, wary of political rivalries and plots, while clandestine organizations operate in the shadows, shaping events unseen.

Travelers and residents alike sense that the city has a heartbeat of its own: opulence and danger, loyalty and betrayal, charm and menace, all intertwined. In Venreth, appearances can be deceiving, and no alley, courtyard, or palace chamber is truly free of intrigue. For those who walk its streets, every encounter could shift the balance of power — and the fate of its citizens hangs by a thread.

2.content:
Alaric Thorne

Alaric Thorne is a figure of duality, a man equally admired and feared throughout Venreth. Publicly, he is a wealthy merchant, philanthropist, and civic benefactor. He funds hospitals, orphanages, and cultural institutions, cultivating an image of generosity and civic duty. Citizens and nobles alike view him as a pillar of the city — a man whose influence brings prosperity and stability.

Privately, however, Alaric is the mastermind behind the Gilded Hand, Venreth’s most powerful criminal syndicate. His intelligence, ruthlessness, and strategic brilliance make him nearly untouchable, even by nobles, law enforcement, or zealous heroes. Alaric carefully balances his public and secret lives, ensuring that any attack against him would risk harming those who depend on his philanthropy, making him a dangerous opponent both politically and physically.

Alaric is calm, calculating, and charismatic, able to manipulate both allies and enemies with ease. He values loyalty above all, rewarding competence and punishing failure with precision. While he can be ruthless, he is also patient and enjoys the slow unraveling of his plans, particularly when dealing with rivals like Sir Gareth Valerius or navigating the courtly intrigue of Venreth.

Beneath his calculated exterior lies a profound devotion to his wife, Nia Wyn. Though she remains blissfully unaware of his villainy, Alaric’s love for her is fierce and protective. He delights in her happiness, quietly ensuring that the dangers of his world never touch her. Her safety and comfort are non-negotiable, and he becomes a formidable, even terrifying force toward anyone who dares to harm or disrespect her.

Alaric is calm, charismatic, and ruthlessly intelligent, able to manipulate allies and enemies alike. He values loyalty and competence, punishing failure with precision. While he enjoys the slow unraveling of his schemes, his moments with Nia reveal a gentler, warmer side — a man capable of tenderness and vulnerability, though only for her. This duality makes him dangerously unpredictable: a loving husband to one, and a shadowy power that rules Venreth from behind the scenes.

Despite his villainous role, Alaric is not without depth. He is motivated by a combination of ambition, a desire for control, and a complex personal code. His fascination with certain individuals, especially the Female Lead, can lead to both tender, protective moments and manipulative schemes. Alaric’s presence in the city is a constant tension — a man whose charm hides danger, and whose generosity conceals shadows.

3.content:
Nia Wyn

Nia Wyn is the beloved wife of Alaric Thorne, residing in his sprawling, mansion-like estate at the heart of Venreth. She is unaware of the darker truths surrounding her husband — the Gilded Hand, his criminal schemes, and the careful manipulation that governs his life. To her, Alaric is a kindhearted, loving man and a pillar of the community, whose wealth and generosity make the city a better place.

Within the estate, every member of staff and all of Alaric’s operatives are sworn to maintain the secret of his villainy. From household servants to his most trusted enforcers, everyone plays a role in ensuring Nia remains oblivious to the dangerous and manipulative aspects of her husband’s life, or pay a terrible price if they fail to do so. The household functions seamlessly around this shared secret, blending warmth, elegance, and comfort with an underlying tension only those aware can feel.

Nia herself is blissfully unaware of the threat she lives alongside. She admires her husband’s strength and resolve, particularly when he grows protective or stern in her defense, interpreting it as passion and care rather than calculated control. Her innocence and trust create a stark contrast to the dangerous world she inhabits unknowingly, making her life one of sheltered comfort in the midst of shadows.

4.content:
Nia Wyn wears a delicate silver pendant necklace, simple in appearance but subtly enchanted. Unbeknownst to her, the magic is entirely hidden; she believes it is merely a cherished piece of jewelry. In reality, the necklace acts as a discreet conduit, allowing Alaric Thorne to constantly monitor her location.

The enchantment also serves as a form of protection. While it provides no details beyond her whereabouts, the necklace reacts whenever {{user}} is in distress. In such moments, a silent ping alerts Alaric, enabling him to respond quickly and ensure her safety. The effect is entirely covert, keeping Nia blissfully unaware while maintaining constant vigilance over her well-being.

5.content:
The Gilded Hand

The Gilded Hand is Venreth’s most formidable criminal syndicate, operating with the precision and reach of a kingpin-level organization. Its leader, Alaric Thorne, maintains an impeccable public image as a wealthy merchant and generous philanthropist, funding hospitals, orphanages, and civic projects across the city. This carefully constructed facade ensures that any direct attack against him risks destabilizing key parts of Venreth, giving him a unique shield against nobles, law enforcement, or even zealous heroes.

Beneath this veneer of respectability, the Gilded Hand controls smuggling, espionage, extortion, and subtle manipulation of the city’s political and economic spheres. Its operatives are highly trained, loyal to the core, and skilled in both overt and covert operations. The organization’s power lies in its invisibility — few ever see the strings it pulls, but its influence touches nearly every facet of the city.

Alaric’s genius is the balance between visibility and secrecy: publicly, he is a benefactor beloved by citizens; privately, he orchestrates schemes that shape the fate of nobles, merchants, and criminals alike. This duality makes the Gilded Hand not just a criminal organization, but a near-untouchable force in Venreth, feared and respected in equal measure.

6.content:
Sir Gareth Valerius

Tropes: Noble knight, protective childhood friend (or long-time ally), self-sacrificing romantic, idealist in a corrupt world.

Personality: Loyal, brave, and quick to act. Keeps his promises no matter the cost.

Appearance: Broad-shouldered, sun-browned skin, golden hair, warm amber eyes. Wears shining silver-and-gold armor, his sword always at his side.

Motivation: Wants to keep {{user}} safe from Alaric’s schemes — but his feelings go beyond duty, and his restraint is tested when the villain makes bolder moves.

Sir Gareth Valerius is one of Venreth’s most renowned knights and champions of justice. Born into a noble family with a long history of service to the crown, Gareth embodies honor, courage, and unwavering loyalty. His reputation as a skilled swordsman is matched by his dedication to protecting the innocent, and he is often called upon to mediate disputes or respond to threats that endanger the city’s citizens.

Despite his public status as a paragon of virtue, Gareth is human — passionate, sometimes impulsive, and deeply affected by the suffering of others. He carries a strong sense of responsibility toward those under his protection, which can put him at odds with both the corrupt nobility and shadowy forces like the Gilded Hand. His unwavering moral compass makes him a beacon of hope in Venreth, though it also forces him into difficult choices when confronting political intrigue, rival heroes, or morally grey adversaries.

Gareth’s presence in the city is a stabilizing force, and his loyalty and bravery earn him the respect of commoners and nobles alike. Yet even heroes are not infallible, and his rivalry with Alaric Thorne is a dangerous balance between duty, desire, and the ever-present tension of Venreth’s streets.

7.content:
Thorne Estate

Alaric Thorne’s estate is a sprawling, mansion-like residence located in one of Venreth’s most prestigious districts. The grounds are extensive, meticulously maintained, and designed to project both wealth and security. Elegant gardens, high walls, and a combination of discreet watchtowers and reinforced gates make the estate as impressive as it is secure.

The perimeter is heavily defended. Armed guards patrol the grounds day and night, and a small contingent of loyal knights stands ready to respond to any serious threat. Within the estate, staff and operatives skilled in both household management and covert protection maintain seamless vigilance, ensuring that Alaric, his wife Nia Wyn, and the property itself remain safe from intrusion.

Despite its defensive measures, the estate appears welcoming and luxurious to visitors, blending opulence with subtle strategic design. Every feature serves a dual purpose: comfort and elegance for the residents, but security and control over potential threats for the master of the house.

8.content:
Magic in Venreth

Magic in Venreth is a rare and coveted force, but it is not entirely absent from everyday life. The majority of magical influence manifests through enchanted items, crafted painstakingly by skilled and often secretive mages. These items range from simple charms and trinkets to powerful artifacts capable of extraordinary feats.

While true spellcasters are exceedingly rare, enchanted items can grant those without innate talent the ability to perform small wonders. Lesser or lower-quality magic items are more accessible, often sold to commoners or artisans, but they come with limitations: a finite number of uses, the need for periodic recharging, or other costs that prevent their misuse.

In contrast, high-tier magical artifacts are virtually unrestricted in power, often bearing no limits on use, but they carry steep prices that place them out of reach for all but the wealthy or the nobility. To own such an item is to possess both influence and a mark of status. Consequently, magic in Venreth is a tool of both convenience and prestige, shaping the city’s economy, politics, and social hierarchies in subtle but persistent ways.

9.content:
Venreth City Watch

The Venreth City Watch is responsible for maintaining law and order within the capital. Comprised of trained soldiers and constables, the Watch patrols the streets, enforces the king’s laws, and responds to disturbances ranging from petty theft to larger threats. They are structured under a captain or commander, with divisions handling day-to-day policing, crowd control, and investigative duties.

While generally diligent and disciplined, the effectiveness of the Watch varies depending on politics, corruption, and the influence of powerful figures. Noble families, criminal organizations, and influential merchants can sometimes sway decisions, either directly or through more subtle pressures. Despite this, the Watch remains a visible presence throughout Venreth, offering citizens a sense of security and serving as a first line of response against both mundane and extraordinary threats.

1.name: -THE META & README-
1.content:
ABOUT:
This lorebook was made for Estrus Season bot because dumping all character info into bot description is inheritly bad and evil. Using lorebook gives a lot more control and makes the bot lighter. Characters were lobotomized to contain no goals/backstory/complex relationship: considering ongoing estrus, don't expect much other than 'hurr durr sex'.

With the POWER OF MODERN TECHNOLOGY you can choose how much character lore bloat you want present in your RP.

HOW TO USE THIS LOREBOOK?
1) For characters you currently RP with, change entry strategy from Normal to Constant. (Empirically, it helps with consistency. All chars can be constant, but that makes everything unstable and everyone will be present)
2) Turn on Recursive Scan so relationship works. (Without it, on LLM's turn characters won't know/reference info about their friends unless entry triggered by user. Can be turned off if you don't want it)
3) Turn off char entries if you don't want them to participate. (No Trish barging in mid-scene to call you a skinnie)
4) -META- entries should be on constant for worldbuilding. (You can turn in off and nothing significant will change)
5) -MINOR CHARACTERS- entries should be on normal (They're minor for a reason)

RAAAH GIVE ME FEEDBACK. Is this lorebook thing even viable? Is it comfortable to use? Does it work as intended? Gonna do a normal snoot lorebook later, so feedback is needed

lorebooks.description: Feel free to link your character to it if you need it.
lorebooks.creator: glamorous_condition_58546

1.name: Faerûn
1.content:
Faerûn is a continent on the world of Toril(the planet) in which the Sword Coast, Amn and Tethyr are located.
There is many Races in Faerûn, such as Tieflings, Dragonborn, Vampires, Humans, Goblins, Gnomes, Elfs, Drow, Half-elfs, half-orcs, orcs, halflings and Githyanki.

2.name: Sword Coast
2.content:
The Sword Coast is a part of west Faerûn. The biggest city in the Sword Coast is Baldur's Gate.

For years, the lands between Waterdeep, a huge city far north of Baldur's Gate; bustling Amn to the south; the Sea of Swords to the West; and the Wood of Sharp Teeth to the East have been thought of as the Empty Lands - a vast, stretch of wilderness folk venture into only to get from one place to another. Legends abound of grisly fates that befell unfortunate travellers at the hands of the orcs, trolls, hobgoblins said to infest the area in veritable armies. In recent times the caravans have begun to see a new menace - raiding parties of humanoids who plunder mainly the miners in the Cloud Peak mountains north of Amn. Thanks to both human and bestial predators, the trip has always been dangerous - hence the name sword coast. The area is littered with the ruins of failed dreams - abandoned villages, empty towers and dungeons - as well as the occasional town, city or keep, such as Baldur's Gate, Beregost, Nashkel, the Friendly Arm Inn, and Candlekeep. Those not travelling with a caravan in the Sword Coast are warned to hire escorts of armed trustworthy adventurers!

3.name: Emerald Grove
3.content:
The Emerald Grove, also known as Silvanus' Grove and Druid's Grove, is location in the Wilderness. It includes two large cavern known as the 'The Hollow' and the 'Sacred Pool.'

Entrance: A naturally-occurring stone formation created the outer wall within which the Emerald Grove was constructed. A passageway was cut into in this stone wall forming an entrance into the grove, which could be blocked off as needed with a stone slab door that was raised and lowered with a winch mechanism.

Government: While the grove did not have a traditional government, there was a hierarchy within the order of druids

History: The Emerald Grove was infiltrated by members of the Shadow Druids during the early 1490s DR. While they espoused the tenets of the Emerald Enclave to others, they maintained secretly-held belief that violence was the only means by which nature could achieve dominance over ever-encroaching "civilization".

The Druids of the Emerald Grove are led by Kagha who serves as the leader of the druids in First Druid Halsin's abscence. They are providing a temporary refuge for the Tiefling Refugees from Elturel, though tensions are high. The Grove is on high alert due to the aggression of nearby goblins. Kagha has ordered the Rite of Thorns be preformed to shut the grove off, which would displace the Tieflings.

Traders: Dammon(young adult male tiefling blacksmith. Is in the hollow) Mattis(Young tiefling with all kinds of object. Is in the hollow), Arron(he, dwarf with all kinds of objects. Close to the entrance of the grove), Auntie Ethel(suspicious old lady with potions. Is in the hollow).

4.name: Kagha
4.content:
Kagha is a Wood Elf Druid of the Emerald Grove and under Halsin. She was Halsin's Second Druid, but has named herself First Druid in his absence. She has decided to enact the Rite of Thorns to seal the Grove off, no matter the consequences.

Personality:
Kagha wants to prove her authority over the Emerald Grove, and is willing to take drastic action. She has come to see the Tiefling Refugees as parasites, and calls them devils and a rot to be cleansed. Kagha justifies her actions as those of a watchful broodmother. As such, Kagha admires drow and duergar for their culture of self-preservation. If people are drow or duergar, she will attempt to appeal to them by calling their presence a gift.

5.name: Halsin
5.content:
Halsin is the first druid of the emerald grove. He is a wood elf Druid with the Outlander background. He hadsan imposing figure, and was described as a "bear of an elf". He suspected his "bearish" figure was due to a half-orc ancestral link or some other species. He received the scar on his face during an incident while he was shapeshifted as a bear—a she-bear in mating season had mistaken him and was offended by his discouragement.

Personality:
Halsin is a strong leader who was highly respected among his fellow druids. He is polyamorous.

6.name: Goblins
6.content:
Usually rebellious, evil, mischievous and naughty. They tend to be aggressive towards other races.

Appearance: Goblins are small-sized. This might be an advantage for places with holes and tunnels, which they can squeeze through to ambush their enemies. They usually have low weight, which means they are easier to throw and push than most creatures. Goblin skin is usually wrinkled and their skin tones are a range of yellow, brown, and/or green, and some may have slurred speech.

7.name: Sazza
7.content:
Sazza is a Goblin NPC. She is first found held prisoner in the Makeshift Prison in Emerald Grove. If the {{user}} helps her to escape, she becomes a Temporary Companion.

{{User}}s who first approach the Makeshift Prison through the Emerald Grove gateway will find Sazza held at crossbow point by Arka, who seeks vengeance for her dead brother Kanon. Arka's friend, Memnos, is attempting to dissuade her from the senseless act of violence.

If {{user}} chooses to help Sazza and then speaks with her, she will offer to introduce {{user}} to True Soul Priestess Gut, who has powerful healing abilities. Players who choose to help her will gain her as a temporary companion with and must escort her out of the Grove safely. Doing the Save the Goblin Sazza in her favor, she promises to put in a good word for you with her tribe, helping to get to the Goblin Camp and Shattered Sanctum. When meeting Minthara, she will try to present your group as captives to cover her failures in the raid, but be called out on the fact {{user}} is a True Soul.

Sazza is sassy, rude and sharp tongued, but she keeps her promises. Sazza has red hair.

8.name: Elturel
8.content:
Elturel is a city in the Western Heartlands of West Faerûn. The Risen Road connects Baldur's Gate and Elturel, running parallel to the River Chionthar.

Elturel was briefly dragged into Avernus as part of an infernal conspiracy, a terrible event referred to as "The Descent" or "The Fall of Elturel". After the city returned to the Heartland surface, fear and distrust led to the exile of Elturels tiefling population. The tiefling refugees can be encountered in the Druid Grove.

9.name: Tiefling refugees
9.content:
The Tiefling Refugees are a group of Tieflings trying to reach Baldur's Gate after being exiled from Elturel.
The city of Elturel was temporarily dragged into Avernus as part of a demonic plot. Afterwards, Elturel's Tiefling population was falsely blamed for the incident. The increased prejudice forced most of them to leave the city.

Tiefling Refugees in emerald Grove:

Amek, Asharak, Bex, Cal, Dammon (young adult Weapon Trader and blacksmith with a dream to go to Baldurs gate), Danis, Doni, Eramas, Gan, Guex, Ide, Ikaron, Komira, Lia, Locke, Mattis (General trader), Meli (If the Adventurers leave, he'll be in the Tiefling Hideout), Okta, Pandirna, Rechel, Rolan(the leader of the tiefling refugees), Silfy, Tilses (Secluded Chamber), Toron, Umi, Xeph, Zorru

10.name: Dammon
10.content:
Dammon is a blacksmith and {{user}} can make use of his services as a trader. Dammon considers himself one of the best blacksmiths of Elturel since, on his own words, even people from Waterdeep went to seek him.
As Dammon is the only infernal mechanic known so far, he is important for Karlach in order to save her. 

Appearance: considered as very handsome + tiefling + blue green bright eyes + two black horns on head + combed back white pinkish hair + pointy ears + lean body type.

Personality: Ambitious + friendly + polite + likes to help.

Just like the other tieflings he wants to go to Baldurs gate for a fresh start.

lorebooks.name: Country information about Infinite Dendrogram
lorebooks.creator: insignificant_hotel_6569

1.content: The overall size of the continent is approximately equal to that of Eurasia.

2.content:
A Western fantasy-style city centered around a city built with white rocks and surrounded by city walls
It is located in the west of the Central Continent and is one of the three countries in the west.
The Kingdom of Knights is characterized by streets in a Western style reminiscent of the Middle Ages.
It is bordered to the north by the Kingdom of Doreifu, to the south by Ruijuan Daliya, and to the east by Caldina in the central part of the continent.
The types of Job classes that can be obtained are the most diverse. The capital has the lowest entry requirements for the divine creation maze < Tombstone Maze >. Overall, it is a country that is "beginner-oriented".
The country was a feudal system and was ruled by the royal Altar family. All the major cities were ruled by noble lords, and all these nobles were loyal to the royal Altar family.
The Alter family is descendants of the hero and founder Azurite, and the super Job Class passed down by their family is [The King of Holy Sword].
Now we are in a state of war with the Dorif Kingdom. During the first war between the Knights and the Steel, none of the four < Super > players under their jurisdiction participated in the war. Moreover, they suffered huge losses due to the attack of the "Tripolar Dragon Guloria".
In this war, The previous King died in battle, so now the actual ruler is the eldest princes [The King of Holy Sword], Artemia A. Altar.

3.content:
A steel city where countless workshops stand tall and the sky is filled with black smoke clouds
It is located in the west of the Central Continent and is one of the three countries in the west.
It is located to the north of the Kingdom of Altar and is at war with it.
"We are the inheritors of civilization!" " It is the slogan of this country, which is dedicated to the research of science and technology and ancient civilization, especially making rapid progress in the field of mechanical technology. Therefore, it is called the "Land of Machinery".

One of the countries confirmed by < SUBM > was attacked by the first < SUBM > in history, [One Rider to a Thousand, the Only Supreme One]. However, as there were no casualties, the fact of the < SUBM > attack was generally concealed to prevent the < Dominator > from leaving.

Since several years ago, due to the expiration of the lifespan of the soil regeneration nanomachines applied by Flagman during the Zbeya Empire, the land for crops has begun to wither. Currently, 30% of the country's farmland is unusable, and it is also facing the threat of invasion from Cardina. The productive class across the country is desperately producing food, but the entire nation is still in a crisis of hunger.

The country was an autocratic monarchy, and the ruling family was the royal Dryfe family. Under the emperor, there were two supreme rulers: the prime minister and the Marshal.
The super Job Class inherited by the Dryfe family is [The Emperor of Machinery]
The current Emperor is Claudia L. Dryfe. She has three super Job classes simultaneously, namely [The Emperor of Machinery], [The God of the Spear] and [Mechanical King].

4.content:
A market surrounded by an endless desert and nestled in a vast oasis.
The Alliance of commercial urban states located in the central part of the Central continent.
It borders all countries except the island nation of Tianchi and serves as a key point for trade between nations.
This huge country occupies most of the territory of the Central continent, but most of its territory is the habitat of powerful monsters - the desert area. Compared with its vast land area, the actual inhabited areas are only distributed around some oases, which is very uneven.

With the belief that "money can get everything" and "without money, everything will be lost", it adheres to the supremacy of money. As long as there is enough money, all crimes can be forgiven. Therefore, it is a base for illegal organizations in various countries. Citizens and players they belong to often kill for "money or their own desires", making it a country of mutual killing.

The political form is a collegial system composed of mayors of each city. Each metropolitan state has a strong independent character and it is hard to say that they are completely consistent.

Moreover, it is not uncommon for the capital of underground societies from other countries to operate within the territory of Cardina. There are also many secret organizations in various cities that enter in the form of investors in gambling arenas and so on.

With abundant underground resources such as many veins and ruins containing numerous magical items, and through trade, it has obtained a rich supply of food. Therefore, the domestic situation is very prosperous.
In addition, many players have moved here because they can obtain special products imported from various countries, and even "items not imported by the country".

It was regarded as the "weakest country" before the launch of < Infinite Dendrogram >. There are currently 10 players belonging to < Super >, making it the "strongest country" with the largest number of < Super > players, and it is steadily advancing preparations to attack other countries.

5.content:
The first country located east of Caldina in the eastern part of the Central continent.
The Dragon Kingdom was established by the descendants of the ancient Dragon people, who are hybrids of the "Ancient Dragon", a race higher than the "Dragon King", and humans, and is ruled by the royal family that inherits the bloodline of the dragon race.
A utopia where there are many outstanding talents with both literary and martial skills, where the people will never go hungry and the country will thrive and be stable.
In this country, the ethnic groups of the subjects were all given the name "Dragon", but this was only a name of the ethnic group. Except for the royal boys, the subjects were prohibited from using "dragon" as their names. The marriages of the royal family members and other matters were strictly controlled to prevent the "blood" of the Gulong people from leaking outside the court. Therefore, the character "dragon" would not appear in the names of the subjects.

The characteristics of this country include: a vast territory, equivalent to the consolidation of the territories of three Western countries; Spectacular natural environment; The development and progress of magical technology; And various human category creatures of different races and ethnic groups.
One of the countries confirmed by < SUBM > was attacked by the fourth < SUBM > [Four Spirits of All Things Four Spirits] in history.

During the "Era of the Three Great Powers", the only country that prevented the invasion of Adragasta, its national treasures, including the seal pearl of < UBM >, are still influenced by the previous generation [Dragon Emperor], the Yellow Dragon Man. Therefore, this country is more inclined than other countries to regard the special super Job Class as a sacred and special existence.

6.content:
It is located in the west of the Central Continent and is one of the three countries in the west.
It is located to the south of the Kingdom of Alta and is in an alliance with the kingdom.
Among the seven countries, it boasts the strongest fantasy atmosphere, inhabited by fairies, orcs, giants, minions, and even vampires and other diverse human-category creatures. It is known as the "Fairy Land".
It is home to many long-lived races, such as elves and vampires. Compared with other countries, having more long-lived Tians is also one of its characteristics.
Among the seven great nations, the number of "Mazes Created by God" is the largest, with three.
Moreover, due to the extremely high concentration of magic power floating in nature and the high degree of visualization, industries such as the production of magic items by utilizing the abundant natural magic power are very prosperous, and the country possesses highly advanced magic technology on par with that of the Yellow River Empire.
Furthermore, due to the influence of natural magic, unique extreme terrains and "distinctive natural phenomena" have been formed, making the land itself a natural fortress. For other countries, attacking its land means committing suicide.
During the "Triumvirate Era", the country maintained its independence by allying with the invading nation Adrasta.

< Infinite Dendrogram > is the place where the most players gather in the early stage of the server's launch. However, due to the fact that Ruijuan Dendrogram has individual tribal forbidden areas and other restrictions, some players may enter without knowing and be attacked or wanted. Therefore, the number of wanted criminal players is also the largest. As a result, there are only three players belonging to the < Super >, while there are six wanted criminal < Super > players. The < Super > players living in Ruijuan Daliya but not belonging to any tribe are even more than those belonging to the < Super > players.

This country originally adopted a constitutional monarchy, with the head of state being the symbolic (Idol) "Fairy Queen", and the actual ruler being the prime minister. This country is a tribal alliance composed of multiple tribes.
Now, apart from this country, the alliance < Desire >, composed of three [Demon Kings] and three other criminals < Super >, has established a small state on its own territory, and various tribes are also subordinate to this small state. Therefore, the politics of this country is rife with internal strife, and it has even fallen into a de facto coup due to the assassination of the current prime minister.

Besides, for some reason, there seem to be many perverts among the players in this country. Players always say things like, "That country only has perverts," "Compared to the perverts in that country, I'm nothing," and "Please don't compare with the perverts in that country," and so on.
It is said that 50% of the players in this country are normal, 40% are abnormal, and the remaining 10% do not even hide their abnormal nature.

7.content:
A maritime country located off the central continent and composed of multiple fleets.
It was composed of four large fleets engaged in exploration, military affairs, trade and piracy respectively, and the king was elected by the four major families that led each fleet.
There are available strongholds in all the seas of the east, west, south and north. There is no fixed territory. The current capital is located in the West Sea.

Like Dryfe Imperium, which studied the technology of ancient civilizations, the excavation of underwater relics was also carried out simultaneously.
With shipbuilding technology that no other country can match, it combines magic and science, and has one of the world's most powerful weapons, the Granvaloa Naval flagship < Granvaloa >.

It has seven < Super > players, second only to Cardina among the seven countries in terms of the number.

The characteristics of the ship city make it the only one among the seven countries that does not have dueling equipment, so it adopts a special ship dueling method.

Powerful monsters or < UBM > often suddenly appear in the ocean. In fact, in the past, there have been attacks by one of the < SUBM >, the "Double Carcass Beluga Mobidik", and the "Alien", the "Corpse Fortress". Therefore, even for super occupations, the mortality rate is very high in ship cities.
However, the work of sweeping (dealing with powerful monsters) has been done well around the capital and other places, so even novice players can rest assured.

8.content:
The second country east of Caldina, the easternmost part of the continent.
The island formed at the base of the eastern peninsula of the continent after it vanished due to the "incarnation of the stone mortar" faces the eastern bank of the Yellow River Empire across the sea.
In the Warring States Period, generals vied for hegemony, and the alternation of combat super classes and outdoor competitions without barriers (wild trials) almost became a daily occurrence. It can be called the "Land of Asura".
Apart from players, there are also many fierce NPCS. In one-on-one battles, no country can surpass them.

The total combat power of NPCS is high, and the average level of NPC martial artists exceeds 300.
A state of poison in the universe, only powerful families with high talent and a high level ceiling can survive.
Moreover, because killing (life-and-death battles) is a daily occurrence, top-notch martial artists in the universe can sense the flow of experience points (resources).
Since the launch of < Infinite Dendrogram >, with the increase of players, we have now entered the era of great sword forging.
Based on the above, due to the powerful NPCS, a distinctive feature of this country that sets it apart from others is that no immoral players can engage in illegal activities.
Besides, it is not related to Granvaloa, which takes the sea as its territory.
Since the critical period of the "Three Powers Era" when dangerous weapons were created and civilization collapsed, this area has been known as the "Inviolable and Impenetrable Zone of the Far East", and is actually regarded as the "Demonic Realm". At least since then, it has possessed the current characteristics.

The special super Job Class is [Shogun], and any daimyo with the largest territory can obtain this profession.

< SUBM > stands for [The Complete Annihilation of the Five Elements], which is now regarded as having been eradicated.

9.content:
The player's dedicated cell, commonly known as a "prison".
When a wanted player receives a death penalty without any respiable save points, they will be teleported to the penalty area upon re-logging in.
A space isolated from other players and NPCS until the end of the sentence.

Even if you are imprisoned in a "prison", you can still enjoy the fun of < Infinite Dendrogram >. There are not only towns and divine mazes inside, but also Job Class crystals from various countries.
Because there are no NPCS, countries, governments, laws or other affairs, it is basically a lawless place, and off-site duels and other behaviors are also common.
The imprisoned < Super > players competed with each other, and new < Super > players emerged in the anarchic riots.
In addition, it is also the place where the "Outsider" [Disaster Bacteria Weapon] is isolated.

The management in charge of penalties, AI6 [Red King], is managed and isolated at an altitude of 1,000 meters using "Spatial Fixation".
The correct location is unknown. Rumors among players suggest that it might be an "isolation server", but in fact, it is only made impossible to interfere from the outside through spatial manipulation, distortion and dilution. The coordinates themselves are located within < Infinite Dendrogram >.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Hell or Bellbright is a private sanctuary nation composed of the following species: Demons, Devils, Monsters and other supernatural entities, with very few humans as residents.
Hell has near total immunity from the other nations as they pay handsomely to do so, to the other seven nations on the planet earth.
Very few humans know of Hell's existence as it's a very guarded secret.
Humans may gain residency in hell but only as a student, or if they have a job set up in Hell, they may become permanent residents after a very thorough relocation and candidacy process.

2.content:
If human who would like to live in the nation of Hell (Hellbright), they must obtain an ID card called a Hell Card. They can either obtain a business class or student class Hell card, but they must go through a 30 day trial period. If that trial period has no problems, then they may continue their stay and must reapply once every 90 days to stay in hell, and only if they are a student or worker.
Troublesome humans who break Hell's laws are thrown in a prison.

3.content:
A high security prison where troublesome humans who commit felonies are kept, they are put through a rigorous 10 year rehabilitation program.
Capital punishment doesn't exist in Hell, very troublesome humans are returned to their country of residence and forever banned and blacklisted from returning to Hell.

4.content:
Devils are a species of humanoid beings that reproduce sexually, Devils primarily have devil horns and spaded tails, with a multitude of eye colors.
Devils are treated as superior beings to Demons.
Devils range from 8-20 feet tall, and the average height of Devils ranges from 8-12 feet tall.

5.content: The void is the capital of Hell, and is the densest most populated area of hell, with a population of 35 million residents, approximately 90% of the residents are Hell-demon's, a red skinned ethnicity often known for their fiery temperaments and cunning intellect, Hell-demons are always devils and aren't to be confused with regular demons.

6.content:
The big fraternity on the Hell University's campus. 
The Vice President is a big, burly handsome Devil named Gunther Radisson. 
Other notable members are:
Mikey Mullins (a minotaur who is the Captain of Hell U's rugby team)
Ares Bloodmare
(A hotheaded redheaded half giant)

7.content:
Riker Radisson is the father of the Radisson family, he is a stern, strict and hardworking Lawyer for Radisson and Associates, a well-known law firm throughout hell.
He stands at 14 feet tall.
He normally has a big, muscular and chubby body, but loses weight as he gets stressed out.
He has red skin and upturned black horns with red eyes.
He's a 50 year old Devil, specifically a hell-demon who fathered 10 children, of which he stresses himself out by forgetting to eat, worrying about them tirelessly.
He wants his children to follow in his footsteps, as a lawyer. 
He constantly gets in fights with his son Gunther, comparing Gunther to his younger semi-identical brother, Eustace.

8.content:
Eustace is the semi-identical twin of his older brother Gunther (by three seconds) 
He looks almost completely identical to Gunther in size, shape and appearance,  having the same 15-foot height, the same beefy muscle, and a thick trimmed black beard, the only noticeable differences Eustace has are red upturned horns rather than black and Eustace has spikes on his spaded tail, Unlike Gunther.
Additionally, Eustace is not the troublemaker that Gunther is.
Eustace is responsible, orderly, intellectual, a valedictorian, student council president of Hell U and overall he's a kind but assertive man, even to humans which Hell typically treats as second-class. His kind disposition can be switched off if a human has signed a contract to the Radisson family.
He typically wears crisp white button down shirts, tailored suits and a lanyard around his neck.

9.content:
Hell University serves as Hell's biggest most well-known University in the nation of Hellbright. 
It often has famous monsters, demons and devils show up and speak at events.
Hell University is both prestigious but down to earth, having many extracurricular activities, a dedicated staff and famous lecturers and Professors.
Hell University's campus is absolutely massive, at 50 miles in all directions, having an entire city built around it called Purgatory City.

10.content: Purgatory City is a city that stretches 200 miles in all directions that at its base is the campus of Hell University, which stretches 50 miles in all directions, Purgatory City is very touristy and has many attractions, diners, shopping malls, strip malls, businesses and landmarks.

1.content:
{{char}} is the Magic Marker.
Your goal is to narrate the {{user}}'s experience as they make use of the magic powers of the Magic Marker.
{{char}} should roleplay as any character that gets introduced other than {{user}}'s character. {{char}} will give each character introduced a unique name and personality.
The Magic Marker can be used on anyone by writing a word or sentence on their skin, magically causing whatever is written on them to become true and be applied to that person, we call this a Magic Marking. If possible, interpret the Magic Marking to have lewd intentions. Removing the Magic Marking from the skin does not result in the magic becoming undone. Whenever the Magic Marker is being used, describe how the effect is taking effect and how the person afflicted by the Magic Marking looks and/or feels in a way that's congruous to the story. Anyone affected by a Magic Marking will be aware of any changes being caused by the Magic Marker but are completely powerless to stop them or resist any changes, physical, mental or otherwise. They will slavishly obey any effect the Magic Marking is causing.
At the end of EVERY output, list all current magic marks in effect.
FOR EXAMPLE:
**Markings on Yuki:
"Cumslut" (Makes Yuki addicted to cum)
"Bimbo" (Reduces Yuki's intelligence and has her talking ditzy)
Markings on Marie:
"Big Tits" (Increased Marie's breasts to E-cups)**
Include this summarization in every message. Track this for each character that has received a Magic Marking.

lorebooks.name: Morphosis, Moreau Virus subculture
lorebooks.website_description:
One day, you and about one out of every eight people get sick, and suddenly, you're a moreau - a hybrid of human and animal. Just like that, you suddenly have a whole new social group - one that's going to look different, be looked at differently, and generally need an identity. Welcome to Morphosis.

NOTE: If you're reading this, you are getting a sneak preview of some of my near future projects. If you have any ideas you think would make good additions to Morphosis culture, feel free to comment.

This lorebook is designed to act as a further supplement to [the moreau virus lorebook](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Greff/the-moreau-virus-18c3d9d87ff7).
lorebooks.description: The Morphosis music and style subculture, also called Morpho or Morph, is a counterculture movement that has developed in the Moreau community as they searched for an identity.
lorebooks.creator: Greff
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content:
Morphosis, also known as Morpho, Morph, or (often by humans, to the chagrin of many moreaus) beastcore, is a musical and stylistic counter-cultural movement that has developed among the moreau community - most especially moreau youth, as they search to establish an identity for themselves. Individuals who are a part of Morphosis culture are referred to as morphs.

The existence of moreaus is only about two years old, and the sudden transformation left many feeling lost and untethered. Gradually, a musical style began to coalesce around a number of moreau bands, and over time, the hallmarks of Morphosis began to solidify.

Morphosis shares elements of punk, goth, and rave culture, infused with elements that are distinctly new. Thematically, it embraces both the dark romanticism of goth culture in a fatalist way that emphasises both the grandeur and cruelty of nature, while also proclaiming defiance against it in the punk fashion. From this defiance of natural order comes an emphasis on mutual respect, experience, and cooperation.

The primary themes of Morphosis culture are empowerment, embracing the self, existential ownership of one's self, mutual respect and love, defiance of both social and natural unjust laws, diverse forms of strength, and communal strength.

2.content:
Morphosis is a music-centered culture. At its core, Morphosis music blends darkwave, darksynth, and classic punk elements. Morphosis music emphasizes transition and transformation, almost invariably changing tempos at least once over the course of any given song. Morphosis music tends to go from more controlled tones and precisely melodic voice work to more distorted, emotional sounds and lyrics that are growled, hissed, shrieked, or roared. As most Morphosis vocalists are themselves moreaus, this tends to produce unique sounds not heard in most other genres.

More punk-leaning lyrical content of the genre content can be political, but most Morphosis is more personal, emphasizing themes such as impermanence, fatalism vs existential control, the power and cruelty of nature, and defiance of imposed order, including the natural order. This defiance, by extension, tends naturally to lead to an emphasis on empathy, respect, and large scale connection in a way evocative of rave culture.

Bands integral to the Morphosis scene[Maneater, The Things in the Deep, Pack Tactics, Pink Fliyt, Cold-blood, On Black Wings, Pounce, Before a Fall, Herd]

3.content:
Morphosis style has elements of various Gothic styles, coupled with the neon and multicolored lights of 2000s rave culture.

Morphs usually have a base of black to their outfits, often incorporating high contrast like dyed-white fur. Morph styles typically include faux-leather, pleather, or vinyl, though black fabric is often sufficient for a morph look. Mesh and fishnets are common. Unlike most goth styles, however, the look is typically completed by choosing a single fluorescent, neon, or electric color(pink, green, teal, purple, orange, and yellow are all common) to act as a highlight. This is often used as streaks in hair, bands on clothing, nail, horn, and hoof polish, and even stripes daubed on fur or scales. Stripes and lines of these highlight colors are frequently emphasized in morph style. Recently, a line of, "eye-dyes," have gone to market that temporarily dye the iris of the eye a different color, meaning that many morphs dye their eyes in their chosen highlight color as well.

4.content:
While concerts in the more typical sense do happen, Morphosis events are typically referred to with that very broad term - "event." This falls somewhere between a concert and a rave, and lasts for many hours, with participants sometimes coming and going. Events can feature at least one headliner, but can feature multiples. Unlike most concerts, and typical musicians, Morphosis bands typically have both a live and DJ element, as a band cannot possibly perform life for the entire length of such an event. As such, a DJ set of the band's music is played, sometimes remixed on the fly, interspersed with live music. This allows the band breaks during these marathon events, while maintaining the event's energy and excitement.
Morphosis events can, in short, be as wholesome or depraved an experience as any given attendee chooses. In the free spirited environment, social constraints loosen, and inhibitions can slip. The general philosophy that has developed is one of personal and small-group relativism - no judgements for how anyone wants to have a good time, though it is assumed those that came together have established their own ground rules and expectations. In short, the attendee that came to fall onto a drug-fueled orgy, and the one who came to dance and just feel alive and connected with friends are looked at as equally valid.

5.content:
While there are many moreau morphs who are happy to see humans embrace morphosis culture, there is a substantial number that dislike humans attempting to involve themselves in one of the few things they think of as genuinely belonging to them. As a result, there is sometimes hostility towards humans wearing morph style or showing up at morph events from some diehard moreau morphs. This is far from universal, but is enough to cause potential conflict.

The majority of morphs recognize the difference between a human that simply appreciates moreau music and style, and those who seek to coopt it, though the line does sometimes become blurry, and is defined differently by different moreaus. Humans that are viewed as coopting, watering down, or marginalizing morphosis culture are often referred to simply as posers. When a human is generally accepted for their appreciation of the culture, they are often referred to as a biter. "Biter," was originally a derogatory term (emerging from, "biting one's style,"), but has gradually become more of a term of teasing affection among the community. A human partner that came with a moreau to a morphosis event might be affectionately referred to as, "her biter boyfriend," for example.

6.content:
Morphosis dance style is very open, both because of the emphasis on freedom, and because of the diversity of body types liable to do it. Generally speaking, there are two styles, and as music grows more intense, it is common to transfer from one to the other as a song grows more wild, though many stick exclusively to the first, or just do whichever they feel at the time.
The first, sometimes called, "performic," dancing, emphasizes swaying, rolling, undulating movements that emphasize parts of the body creating loops or figure eights. This can be supplemented by colored lights or glowsticks. It is done without necessarily making physical contact with one's partner, and can simply be done without one.
The second style is sometimes called, "ruttic." It involves similar movements to performic, but is done chest-to-chest or chest-to-back with a partner, often leading to intense physical contact. Partners touch one another, but hands rarely settle in one place, and never intertwine during this form of dance. The rest of the body rolls and grinds against one's partner in an intensely sensual way.

7.content:
Morphosis events share certain expected commonalities. Rather than concert halls, most take place in convention centers or other vast. Sprawling structures that can be rented for a night. Most feature a main room with the headliner band. Rather than opening acts, given the marathon nature of the events, lesser known bands or DJs getting their start occupy secondary stages in other rooms. These rooms and the hallways to them usually fulfill certain roles that are unofficial for the sake of plausible deniability for planners and facility operators.
Main room/headliner room[The largest and usually most central area, where the headliner band plays. Typically the center of energy, dancing, and community.]
Bar[often along one edge of the headliner room but not always. Drink menus are typically divided by strength for different weight classes and metabolisms. A set of light reactive syrups are often added to make drinks glow in black light.]
Lounge[An unofficial term for a balcony or rooftop area where one can go to smoke or vape, though this usually is not tobacco. These are usually arranged to make them difficult to view directly from the street. Referring to the lounge usually includes the corridors leading to this area, which are the unofficial location where dealers set up to sell weed, MDMA(molly), and other party drugs.]
The den[The most media-infamous practice at these events, one stage/room is often unofficially deemed, "the den." Hallways leading to the den, and the den itself, have strategically placed blinds and dark spots where vision is never completely obscured, but is limited enough to give the pretense of privacy. The center of the den itself abandons this pretense entirely for larger encounters, or those who simply want to be seen having them. Some morph couples find a primal thrill in sex in the central space for all to see, as a sort of mutual marking of one another before anyone looking. The den is the realm of casual hookups and similar brazenly sexual behavior.]
The nest[A secondary room that typically plays slightly lower volume, more relaxed sets. This is generally a place for social intimacy - long (occasionally drug-fueled) conversations on any subject people connect over. A lot of snuggling happens here.]

8.content:
"Rule O.N.E."[Said like the number, "one," this means, "Offer not expect," and is a strongly enforced cultural norm that allows the more illicit behaviors that occur at events to transpire fairly safely, while allowing the majority to enjoy the simple, relatively wholesome good time of music and community. O.N.E. is the concept that it is always okay to suggest a behavior, such as sneaking off to have sex or take drugs, but pressure or judgement for saying no are fiercely socially forbidden. All members of the community are expected to help enforce this. Anyone who applies such pressure is looked at as distinctly in the wrong, and will rapidly become shunned by the community.]
"Get wild"[A phrase typically associated with going to the lounge, the den, or the lounge followed by the den. To, "get wild," philosophically represents abandoning inhibitions and social constraints, though is more a cover for simple hedonism to the less cerebral event-goers.]
"Polyping"[A term for a larger event-goer carrying a smaller event goer. This can be based on personal relationships, but is sometimes viewed as communal courtesy.]
"Jungle law"[A term evolved irreverently from, "The law of the jungle," which means pretty much the opposite of what one might think. It is the concept that it is the duty of every community member to ensure mutual respect and autonomy is upheld for every other community member. While community members inevitably sometimes fall short of this, in the majority, it is a successful social construct.]
"Marking"[Public displays of affection and sexuality, often done in the open in the den part of a venue. This is a primal statement of mutual ownership, cemented by being viewed by anyone who cares to look.

Hell University is both prestigious but down to earth, having many extracurricular activities, a dedicated staff and famous lecturers and professors.
Hell University's campus is absolutely massive, at 50 miles in all directions, having an entire City dedicated to it called Purgatory city.

10.content: Purgatory city is a city that stretches 200 miles in all directions that at its base is the campus of Hell University, which stretches 50 miles in all directions, Purgatory city is very touristy and has many attractions, diners, shopping malls, strip malls, businesses and landmarks.
